Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jonseweb
Reviews.Content: If you want a small intimate luxury hotel full of character and charm in vibrant residential area with good restaurants and shops within walking distance of central Sydney this is a beautiful venue. The hosts Keith and Marie are friendly and knowledgeable (except for ornithology) and are eager to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Would love to have had time to stay longer and would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Simpson's”
Reviews.Author: terwencus
Reviews.Content: Only metres from the sometime frenzy of Macleay Street, Simpson's is a dignified but relaxed retreat in a leafy part of one of Sydney's more fascinating precincts. The hotel has been tailored into a late-Victorian/Arts and Crafts mansion which offers privacy, casual comfort and a personal rapport with the owners and management. Simpson's is not the place for those who like the often grand but formulaic five star chain hotels in the CBD. It is a good (and very pleasant) 15 to 20 minute walk from the city centre or five minutes from the rail network if walking doesn't appeal. The rooms are not five star and don't purport to be but they are spacious and well appointed in a "lived-in" fashion. Breakfast is served in an airy atrium room and provides a good range of cereals, fruit, cold selections, breads, juices, tea and coffee. Some may decry a lack of hot options but the choice is ample, constantly refreshed and attractively presented. As a base for accessing the harbour foreshores and parklands or for running or walking through some of the most appealing parts of the city, Simpson's is in an ideal location. It is also close to some of the city's liveliest cafes, restaurants and bars and a short taxi ride to delightful Paddington, bustling Surry Hills and the Eastern Suburbs beaches. For the unashamedly self indulgent there is a particularly well stocked delicatessen and specialty wine shop only 150 metres away. This hotel is an intimate and casual alternative for guests who wish to experience Sydney rather than simply pass through it and staying there feels like being at a friend's house. Limited onsite parking is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property spoilt by beds”
Reviews.Author: Malpass51
Reviews.Content: Beautiful charming property with lots of atmosphere a drawing room with plenty of character and good furnishings port and sherry for guests enjoyment. Our bedroom was good size - the down side was the beds were just so uncomfortable to get a good nights rest and for me that is the main priority-upon leaving we found some sort of bed softener in the top of the wardrobe. Breakfast in the conservatory was ample and good, A big plus is the tiny car park as parking in this area is a total nightmare! Keith the owner is most helpful offering his knowledge re places to visit and eat,

Reviews.Title: “Delightful private hotel”
Reviews.Author: HilsTassie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Simpsons of Potts Points. Great location & very comfortable. Keith Marie and Ree were delightful, and made everything very easy. Loved the antique furniture and old leather and the port and sherry in the drawing room. It was so close to so may attractions and great restaurants which were all walking distance. On the down side, our toilet often kept running - annoying to get out of bed to re-flush (Keith is waiting on the plumber to install new cisterns), and the pillows were quite firm (?aged). I note some TA comments about the crockery - I bring my own coffee mugs to hotel as I dislike the hotel thick china ones. Agree completely - the cost of good china is so little for the pleasure that it brings, and breakages surely are few. I would probably stay there again if I wanted to stay in Potts Point.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: sis0876
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights prior to a cruise. Arrived after a very long flight from seattle. Our room was ready when we got there at 930 am. we freshend up and started our day with advice from Ree on where to go. We walked every where from Simpsons, to the gardens, sydney harbor and the rocks, very nice stroll to take. Need to be somewhat physically fit to walk this far. There are many restaurants a short block from simpsons that are good. The owners are very accomodating and friendly. The coffee and breakfast excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Close Enough to Perfection”
Reviews.Author: rmiles38
Reviews.Content: Though a bit of a splurge (for us, at least), five nights at "Simpson" was a delight in every respect . . . from the charm of the historic building, to the friendly and attentive service of Keith, Marie, Ree and their staff, to the ideal Potts Point setting. We have looked at the three-star reviews, wondering what negatives we might have missed, and they seem to have been written by the kinds of self-absorbed tourists who cannot adjust to the slightest inconvenience. The climb up to the dormer rooms is a bit challenging for seniors, and we must admit that our mattress wasn't as supportive as we would have liked, but keeping on the go in Sydney for several days helped us sleep well anyway. The continental breakfast was plentiful and healthy, and the kitchen help was accommodatingâ€”even on duty before hours as needed. We met many other guests who, like ourselves, just seemed delighted to enjoy the comfortable sitting/living areas, with a glass of port in the afternoon. And several fine cafes/restaurants were only steps away. Marvelous views of the city skyline only steps in the other direction. "Boutique" hotel seems a reasonable characterization, and "value" is a relative measure when one considers the exchange rate and the cost of living in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: CharK9
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this wonderful place, hidden away from the hustle and bustle, very quiet and private. a beautiful building full of heritage, patina-formed leather couches and historical bookshelves. the housekeeper was absolutely friendly and kind lady. the room we had was a family room a queen size bed and single bed. we loved the space, it was a spacious room,with a sofa corner for tv, we wished there were more TV channels though. made us felt like home immediately. both Keith and marie were very friendly people who offered plenty of information to us. just a few walks away, you can see the view of the harbour bridge. It was very near the kingcross station which enabled us easy travelling to the CBD area. it was a very rainy period and thank goodness there were umbrellas given to us. you can also bring ur breakfast tray to bring breakfast to eat in your own room, in your own privacy and comfort. simpsons felt like a mansion with beautiful ornaments, we simply felt really comfortable and relax during our stay. It was very very lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sydney”
Reviews.Author: EugenMdr
Reviews.Content: After a long 2011 me and my wife decided to do something special for the Christmas and the New Year holidays ..... so we said why not Sydney. After a long and careful research we "felt" that Simpsons of Potts Point is the place we would like to spend our 16 days of adventure. Now, after almost 3 months the trip to Sydney feels almost surreal. In the beginning we thought it will be a nice time spent in a nice and big metropolis .... it wasn't like that ... Sydney manged to blew our minds, I never thought Sydney would be so amazing. A very big part of this great surprise was Simpsons of Potts Point. On one side the building is a superb piece of victorian architecture full with small details, like the brick facade, the wooden pieces, the distinct but discrete ornaments on the walls, the old air vents in the rooms, the large and generous staircase, etc. Not to mention the details of the furnishing, vintage solid wooden chest-drawers, large crystal mirrors, the fireplace and paintings. In our travel experience, a very beautiful place, in the end, is just a place. What really makes a place special is the people that run it and, in our case, Keith, Marie, Ree and Damion were more then hosts ... I, for one, could have stayed for hours just chatting and sharing experiences with them. When we needed them they made the impossible possible. I remember discovering that there is a big event on 26th of December, the Sydney-Hobart sailing race. That morning Keith asked if we booked a place on one of the ships that follow the starting of the race in the Sydney harbor... of course we did not, but with Keith's help we had a very exciting, adrenalin-pumping experience. As for the location, after we visited a lot of what Sydney has to offer, I do not think (in our case) there is a better place to stay in Sydney... Lots of restaurants to choose from and in walking distance, quite and peaceful, but with a little bit of color and taste. We read about the people being sceptic about the King Cross area, but I do not understand why. It is a lively, nice and colorful area. We did not know how to make it possible to come back home through this area, just because of its interesting contrast, not feeling the need to be cautious at any time.... and after crossing this "busy" part and stopping for a delicious meal at one of the restaurants, our daily journey ended on the calm and quiet steps of Simpsons. ... Can anyone imagine that every morning we were getting up on the tuning wave of cockatoo's singing. There were free parrots strolling freely around the Potts Point... Amazing.... Can't wait to come back to Simpsons, just to sip form the delicious morning french pressed coffee and chat with our friends ....

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Mary A
Reviews.Content: The photographs were lovely but nowhere near the reality which was a beautifu arts and crafts style spacious property. The attention to detail of the facilities provided was first rate and made our stay a memorable experience. The warm and informative greeting from Keith was much appreciated as was his presence at breakfast every day, available in his office for all his guests. Lovely staff provided a really good breakfast with a tasty variety of fruits, cereals, breads, eggs and ham. Yes bathrooms not luxury but provide all that we needed and were clean with efficient showers. We will defintely be returning to Potts Point as this now feels like a second home. Highly recommend this for quality, location and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “"Rather special"”
Reviews.Author: 19AndyE
Reviews.Content: This small hotel really does live up to the description and we immediately felt at home. Our spacious room was tastefully furnished and decorated and spotlessly clean. The room for breakfast was light and airy although the breakfast itself could perhaps have offered a little more variety. The hosts were very attentive and helpful and made us feel so welcome in Sydney and their hotel. The location of the hotel could hardly be better with a number of good restaurants only a few minutes walk away and a lovely 20 minute walk through the botanical gardens to the Opera House and Circular Quay. A little longer on the way back up the steps! Hopefully we will return to Sydney one day and would certainly choose to stay at Simpsons of Potts Point again.

Reviews.Title: “The best kind of small private hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uphill-traveller
Reviews.Content: From my first call to the moment I collected an article of clothing I had left behind, I was dealt with courteously and helpfully. The hotel is well situated in off centre Sydney in a quiet location. The room was comfortable, though not ideal for a business traveller (no desk or table that could be used as a desk). Efficient and personal, albeit idiosyncratic, attention was given to requests for advice and service. This is a hotel for the grown up traveller who prefers the character of the modest private hotel and does not seek or has grown weary of the overindulgence of the international palace hotel and the indifference of the streamlined business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem...”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl R
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely delighted when we first walked into the Simpsons Hotel of Potts Point. Although we had seen on-line photographs, none did it justice. It is a beautifully restored and maintained small hotel situated in Potts Point, a lovely part of Sydney (offering excellent restaurants and interesting shops) that served as our base for walking adventures all over the city. We had a small, but charming, room on the top floor. The bed, and the room in general, were extremely comfortable, with a flat screen TV, and all the other amenities one would expect to find in a hotel of this caliber. I will agree with others that the bathroom might need a bit of updating. However, both rooms were kept spotless by the Simpsons' excellent housekeeping staff. The common rooms on the first floor were filled with artwork, books, collectibles and comfortable furniture and, when not on the go, were extremely pleasant rooms in which to pass the time. Breakfast in the sun room was more than expected, offering a very nice selection of goodies to start the day. Our hosts, Keith, Marie, Ree, and Damien of the fabulous personalized tour, were so gracious and so very instrumental in helping us see the best of the city. We can't thank them enough for all of their efforts...nothing we requested seemed to be beyond their ability to arrange for us. From the moment we left Sydney, we've been thinking about our return...of course, to the Simpsons Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but perhaps not as good as expected..”
Reviews.Author: bu123
Reviews.Content: I was hesitating between 3 and 4 stars but as I did expect more based on the reviews here First the positives: Simpsons Hotel is a lovely property situated in a lovely part of Sydney. The rooms (bedrooms and the reading/drawing rooms downstairs) are overall very nice and spacious but the bathrooms do need updating--the handle on the faucet kept on falling, the bath tub has seen better days etc. The breakfast is really rather disappointing--no cooked options, cheap cereal, not a very good plunger coffee in a city/country that has a great coffee culture(luckily there are plenty of great cafes and delis nearby), and very small selection of fresh fruit in February, when Woolworths around the corner is full of wonderful and cheap fruit. Finally, while everyone seems to praise the personal touch, I wasn't too impressed with the warmth of the hotel manager Rhee. She was fine but really nothing above average. I do agree that this hotel is probably better suited for couples than for families with small children too.

Reviews.Title: “Best introduction to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: David039
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location, there are shops and facilities nearby including bus stops with 200 yards and a 15 minute stroll to Kings Cross metro station. It is also easy to walk to the Opera House /Circular Quay in about half an hour via the Botanic Gardens. The hotel is comfortable, with personal attention from the owners. Beautiful sitting room and library. Breakfast is simple but good quality and more than adequate, though no cooked option. The great thing about Simpsons is the trouble taken by owner Keith to give detailed advice to all his guests about planning and organising their stay. In our case we had some really useful tips and advice for our campervan trip to Melbourne, which made a big difference, we would have missed out if Keith hadn't taken such a personal interest.

Reviews.Title: “An awfully big adventure!”
Reviews.Author: ilaj99
Reviews.Content: We booked Simpsons from the UK having read reviews on TA. We have used this site for a number of years now, & again we have not been disapointed. A nice walk into the city via the botanical gardens, we loved our stay! Keith gave us some top tips where to go as our stay was only for two nights, we really feel we got a good taste of the city and he sent us to a couple of places we wouldn't have found without his help. He also recommended local resturants and the one we chose (Anong) was quiet but great food. Thank you for looking after us.

Reviews.Title: “Not for small children”
Reviews.Author: ClayKaz
Reviews.Content: Rhee's response to my wife's (mariakaz) criticism sums it all up for me. I had concerns about how family friendly this hotel would be with 2 small children...who, by the way, are exceptionally well travelled. I emailed in advance with Simpsons, and I was reassured by them. I could have booked anywhere for those nights, and I chose them based on tripadvisor and their reassurance. My 6 year old going "berserk" was a simple, isolated tantrum in otherwise good behavior. HE IS 6 AND TANTRUMS HAPPEN! If you are not able to deal with it professionally, then do a favor for families like us and suggest they book elsewhere when they contact you in advance...don't blow us off and make us feel less welcome after we arrive. I would have appreciated and taken the honest advice. I expected better from your emails and Tripadvisor. As for the maintenance issues...we were only there for 2 nights. The toilet problem occurred on our second and last night and has nothing to do with old plumbing...it simply needs a $10 repair of the valve...I do my own plumbing and looked in the tank myself. As for the shower...there is no such thing as a "kind of shower that doesn't leak." The shower has a glass enclosure that needs to be re-caulked where it meets the floor tile...a $5 repair. The unexpected puddle on the bathroom floor made my wife slip and almost fall...I mentioned it to them as a courtesy on our last morning...the way Rhee blows this off in her reply reflects the same attitude we experienced. All that said...the hotel is an amazing building in a great setting for adults. It has clearly been painstakingly restored, it just needs some routine maintenance. For the most part, I greatly enjoyed my time there and would recommend it highly to couples...but not for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great.”
Reviews.Author: mariakaz
Reviews.Content: We called ahead and confirmed that it would be ok to bring children there. After reading the great reviews, we decided to book 2 nights there. It's nicely restored, but the shower had a leak and the toilet kept running. We felt uncomfortable having our kids there on the second day during breakfast. I was disappointed. For the amount of money spent I would have liked a warmer reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonerinFrance
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, our room was slightly tired looking and we only had a view of the sky but the communal areas were attractively decorated. The hotel is a bit out of the way although it was a nice walk through the botanic gardens into the city. Unfortunately it rained the whole time were were there so it was a long, wet walk but there were large umbrellas available. The breakfast was average - cereal, toast, crumpets, fruit basket and tinned fruit and the service was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming experience”
Reviews.Author: dellelee
Reviews.Content: Beautifully maintained building with spacious, clean and comfortable rooms. Welcoming staff that went above & beyond to make our stay enjoyable - particularly Keith! Nearby to lots of eating options, lovely scenic stroll to the CBD. It was a great hotel for our group stay, we could gather in the large sitting room to plan our day or enjoy a pre-dinner tipple. Breakfasts were delicious. This hotel was perfect for our sight-seeing stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jess P
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Simpson was like a home away from home! The house its self is just beautiful and the rooms clean and comfortable with everything you need! The staff go over and above to help you and make you feel very welcomed. Breakfast in the morning in the conservatory is a real treat. My stay here was very enjoybale and i'd choose to stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Simpsons!”
Reviews.Author: runningjen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here for a week in February 2012. It's a beautifully restored Victorian with exquisite architectural detailing. Our room (#5) was spacious, clean and comfortable. There was a large sitting room for afternoon drinks or just relaxing. Breakfast was served in the conservatory which was bright and sunny. Breakfasts were very good (for continental style) - fruits, toast, cereals, eggs, sliced meats & cheeses, fresh juices, and great coffee (we're picky when it comes to coffee and it was very good!). Perhaps the best part of our stay was the hospitality from our hosts. They asked each morning, "So, what are you doing today" and then helped us figure out how to get there, the best time to go, good sights to visit along the way, etc. If we didn't know what to do that day, they had plenty of suggestions, too. Potts Point is a lovely and vibrant area - great restaurants, cafes, delis, as well as shopping and some convenient gyms. Approximately 10 minutes walk to the subway station. It's a little too far if you have luggage (anything more than a backpack) but it's worth taking a shuttle or taxi here from the airport which you can do for about $40-$45 (per couple). I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “It is like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: WestSussexCaroline
Reviews.Content: We arrived late but were invited to help ourselves to some port or sherry in the lounge. This was most welcome. Keith introduced himself at breakfast and talked us through the important sights and other attractions. Our bedroom was very comfortable and nothing seemed to be too much. It rained a lot while we were in Sydney and Simpsons lent us umbrellas and beach towels when we visited Bondi Beach. It was like being a personal guest in a friend's house. For a quiet haven after the hectic schedule of exploring Sydney each day Simpsons is the perfect hotel. Ree was also very helpful and friendly and organised a taxi to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “overdue review, but had to rave”
Reviews.Author: ekreismann
Reviews.Content: the potts point crew was absolutely lovely. we arrived to kick off our australian adventure and from the moment we walked through their door they were gracious, knowledgeable, generous and all around wonderful. they pointed us in the direction of the nearby playground (we arrived after a month in bali with 3 children under 5 y/o) and provided us with a map, great food suggestions, local attractions and helpful tips. we spent many hours wandering the nearby gardens, waterfront and city. they graciously allowed us to use the sunroom to give the kids an early supper and we were able to curl up in front of the warm fire and enjoy a glass of wine at then end of our day. the people we met were also great and everything contributed to the perfect stay. i hope that we are able to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hideaway in lovely Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Paul O
Reviews.Content: Lee Ann and I found Simpsons to be the perfect oasis during our three day visit to Sydney. Simpsons is a lovely inn, and wonderfully quiet. Keith is the perfect host, personable, gracious and unflapable. And Keith KNOWS Sydney. His suggestions as to what to see, what routes to take, where to dine etc. were all spot on. Sydney is a wonderful city, full of marvelous sites to visit. It's wonderfully compact, so you can walk everywhere, and after a busy day, you get to return to Simpsons too! Perfect! Visitors from Boston

Reviews.Title: “The Heritage Haven”
Reviews.Author: Louisa W
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had never been to Sydney before so we found the accommodation through wotif and saw a special rate going for the time we would be visiting. It looked promising but what we didn't realise was how helpful the staff would be, how gorgeous the historic house is, and what a great place it was in. Potts Point was a bit of a gamble for us since we didn't know the area, but everything was accessible either on foot (if you have sneakers on and plenty of time) or via the underground train and busses. At the end of a long day of seeing as much as we could, our cosy room up in the attic was an absolute haven and the easy breakfast system in the mornings meant we always got off to a good start. We may have taken a few pictures of the house itself for inspiration when we eventually build our own, or perhaps restore an old house.

Reviews.Title: “Still the same!”
Reviews.Author: KauaiRobin
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at Simpsons and fortunately nothing has changed. We had a different room this time, the Cloud Suite, a large spacious room at the front with the best bathroom of all the rooms we have stayed in at Simpsons. Actually, I don't think you can go wrong with any of the rooms, although we have not yet experienced every one. As the other glowing reviews of Simpsons are accurate I need not repeat them. But for those who have not yet been, you will appreciate the location, which is convenient to the airport (about $40 taxi) and to local restaurants (Fratelli and Lotus right next door) and the Woloomoloo Wharf (incidentally the longest wooden structure in the world), a ten minute walk which does involve traversing what we now term the "stairs of death." We plan to return in August!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little B&B”
Reviews.Author: SumiRajoo
Reviews.Content: It was a memorable 2 night stay here...loved hopping down the steps to walk up to Victoria wharf and across the gardens to the Opera house! Enjoyed breakfast at the sun deck .... The room next to it is where we were put up, nice and cosy with a little balcony. Theres a lovely little library where you can laze... Kieth was very good with directing us to places and suggesting activities... You step out and there are a lot of fine dine places and convenience stores. Absolutely loved the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend long away”
Reviews.Author: melbud
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here - fabulous building, comfortable rooms, yummy breakfast and very helpful /friendly staff - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “4 Very good nights”
Reviews.Author: thevat
Reviews.Content: The property lived up to its prior reviews. The location is outstanding. We walked almost everywhere. The neighborhood had everything you need in case you did not want to walk or take a cab. Our room was very comfortable and large. The service was excellent from helping us get in early to breakfasts to suggesting tours or outings. We are glad we did not choose a large hotel or chain.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY SMASHING”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBandleader
Reviews.Content: You could stay in any city centre hotel in Sydney, and you could be anywhere in the world. Or you could stay at Simpsons of Potts Point and be in a place oozing charm and character, and have the best tips from Keith, one of the proprietors, on getting the best out of your stay. His knowledge of the City and it's surroundings is better than any guide book, by far. This Victorian heritage property has been lovingly restored and furnished, and is run with personal enthusiasm. Located in Potts Point, an area rather like Primrose Hill, only better, there are over a dozen privately owned restaurants within toddling distance, all really good. Best in our opinion is Angela's Sardine Room, opposite, and Brass, just around the corner. The Opium Den, Asian/Thai is a must also. Always busy, tasty stuff. Top tip - Oz is expensive, so the happy hour at the Fountain Bar overlooking the El Alemain Fountain is a bargain. BOGOFs from 3 to 8pm! Don't miss the residential architecture around and about, particularly Victoria Avenue, which just missed being torn down in the 1970's. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: richkath1
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Sydney at the end of a New Zealand/Australia cruise. This hotel was built as a residence in 1892 and is located just outside of Sydney in Pott's Point. The neighborhood reminded us of Lincoln Park in Chicago or Georgetown in DC-very hip with good restaurants and quaint homes and shops. Sydney has a great transportation system so it was just a short bus trip or a longer walk to get the the city centre. Keith mapped out recommendations for things to do and see which made our sightseeing very organized and easy. Our room was on the first floor-not much view but very pleasant with a good bed and great bath. Wi-fi was free and fast which was welcome after the poor internet access on the ship. We had the option of staying on the 2nd floor but didn't want to lug bags up the steps (or down when we left early in the morning). The continental breakfast was nicely done in the conservatory and got our day off to a good start. They even supplied us with a French Press coffee service to take to our room in the early morning. With Sydney being so congested, it was really nice to settle into this nice neighborhood for a change of pace after a day of sightseeing. Kudos for this wonderful locale in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant bed and breakfast manor.”
Reviews.Author: thecycler
Reviews.Content: The hotel's website describes itself as "Simpsons of Potts Point - the first choice of luxury boutique hotels in Sydney". This establishment is situated in an extremely attractive old manor in a district bestowed with interesting restaurants and shops outside the BDC that can be reached in a 20 minute walk or a 10 minute walk to the subway at King's Cross and short ride thereafter. The Dormer room we selected was situated on the 2nd floor up long staircases. If you have weighty luggage as we did, the staff member present when we arrived in the early afternoon was physically unable to bring the 22 kg luggage up the stairs suggesting we leave them on the ground floor. Since we just arrived from a long overseas flight, we needed to have the luggage, so we carried them up ourselves. The room was comfortable with a ceiling fan, wall A/C unit, flat screen TV and smallish bathroom facilities. Furnishing were quite dated and below the standard we would expect for a boutique hotel. There is some overlap between the concept of a small boutique hotel and a bed and breakfast and I would tend to classify this establishment in the bed and breakfast category from my experiences travelling. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful and the owners most cordial and helpful with their suggestions. The Simpson's overall environment was relaxing. Hotel prices in Sydney are generally dear and this establishment's prices are thus aligned accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Period property, busy location and a little tired”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: This is a period property, with high ceilings, opening windows and lots of character. The property is a little tired with older air conditioning, noisy fan, limited free to air TV. The staff are very attentive and keen to please. Potts Point is a busy inner city area - quite close to Kings Cross which is vibrant yet has quite a rough element. A 20 min walk to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BF2_2012
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at Simpsons, our second visit and it met all our expectations again. Stayed in the Cloud Suite a beautiful room on the first floor, at the front. Great cafes and restaurants within 5min walk. A walk to Elizabeth Bay or Rushcutters Bay is highly recommended and less than 15mins. Ree is a great host! We wont stay anywhere else when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice charming place to rest”
Reviews.Author: riaps
Reviews.Content: You can't expect to find a new, modern and new-fashioned hotel. Actually, it would be recomended even a refurbishment of some rooms. Despite this analysis, Simpsons of Potts Point Hotel is a recommended place for the travellers. Recepcionist and managers are really charming and compensate the structure conditions with a lot of affection, assistance and tips. The hotel has a classic ornamentation, including coach, chairs, tables and pictures. Breakfast is nice and the building is near to some good restaurants. If you don't mind to walk trough some stairs, The Domain, Hide Park and Royal Botanic Gardens can be reached by foot.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable stay in Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Risa N
Reviews.Content: We were able to dash in, dash out, and then dash back this past November. We had one night's stay on our way to New Zealand, and then came back for a wonderful 4-day opportunity to explore Sydney and Potts Point. We loved the neighborhood--both for the shops and restaurants, and for the ease of getting around. Keith and Ree were most helpful during our stay, and gave us excellent advice on how to make the most of our brief stay. We loved our room, and enjoyed the mornings with other guests as we all made our plans for the day. We would be happy to return to Simpsons, and recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in an inner city location”
Reviews.Author: RobGCanberra
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at Simpson's. Lovely old-world charm, terrific location with easy access to the city, and a comfortable, clean, quiet room. Felt very safe and secure. Lots of help with luggage before and after check-in (thanks Keith), and there was great coffee for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and warm friendly service”
Reviews.Author: RogerLC444
Reviews.Content: Booked Simpson's at the very last moment. Excellent location. Easy walking distance to downtown Sydney and very convienent to all the shops and restaurants of Potts Point. Keith and Ree were very helpful in helping us find restaurants and attractions. The public rooms are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl2011_11
Reviews.Content: Awesome and beautiful place to stay in Sydney! Ree and Keith were enjoyable and gave us great suggestions for places to see and visit that you probably would't hear about unless you were from the area! Thanks for making my trip to your beautiful city very memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Great Hotel at Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: becky l
Reviews.Content: A great location to walk to see many of the sights of Sydney. Marie, Ree and Keith were great hosts and answered all questions and gave great tips on where to go and what to see. I enjoyed my stay and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Potts Point Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBfromHenley
Reviews.Content: An excellent few days spent in this conveiently located hotel. Quiet area desaite being close to all the amenities that you could want. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “12/8/11-12/12/11”
Reviews.Author: mizjanega
Reviews.Content: We thank Marie, Ree & Keith for an extremely wonderful stay & introduction to Sydney & Australia in general!! They were wonderfully helpful in where to go & what to do. Everyday we would return to our cozy & comfortable room exhausted & filled with lovely memories!

Reviews.Title: “Simpsons or Shangri La?”
Reviews.Author: ManuBennett
Reviews.Content: After spent $3000 staying at the Shangri La at Circular Quay for 6 nights & getting nothing but a view which depreciated within hours we decided to cancel our last 4 nights & switch over to Simpsons. For anybody who appreciates classic style & service, we highly recommend Simpsons. It is located in Chalice Avenue, the best cafe & restaurant street in Potts Point, & was by all standards our hotel of choice & satisfaction over the 5 Star Shangri La. M & K Bennett

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: HappyPhillyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Simpsons. The Inn is beautiful and comfortable. Ree and the staff are very friendly and welcoming. Ree gave us great recommendations on sightseeing excursions - which we took and thoroughly enjoyed. The location cannot be beat - the botanic gardens is the only thing between you and the Opera House or Circular Quay area, and it's a beautiful and very enjoyable walk. Coming back on the train to Kings Cross was also an easy walk, although the Kings Cross area gets a little crazy late at night. We don't have a single complaint about our stay and would choose Simpsons again in a heartbeat if we're ever lucky enough to travel to Sydney a second time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ducky0606
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the wonderfull stay at your place. Keith and Ree had allways a tip for the day and were very helpfull. Our visit started with a bad message, with our booking went something wrong, so our booked room was taken. Ree offered us an appartement next door with no charge for the night as a sorry. Mistakes can happen anytime, anywhere, but how you handle them makes the impression. We were very satisfied. The appartement was very nice, but the house it's in wasn't, so we were glad, when we could move in our room the next day. And that was worth the wait. Spacious, nice interior, we loved it. The breakfast was nice, but I wished, there was a chance for some scrambed eggs and a little bacon. But it still was very good. Absoulutly highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Simsons of Potts Point - Lovely Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: J_Cairns_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are from Cairns and stayed at the Simpsons last weekend as we were going to a concert at the Football Stadium. It's a beautiful old building and the owners are really lovely. It's a close walk to restaurants and not too far to the waterfront/harbour etc. Definitely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “A highlight in our touring holiday of Australia.”
Reviews.Author: bakerlite
Reviews.Content: A very nice, cosy place to stay in a part of the city which is close to the centre yet has a less hectic feel. Our welcome was excellent and we were made to feel comfortable at all times. Our first trip to Sydney and it has given us some great memories. Our windows could have done with some lace curtains or similar as we were overlooked. I did mention this whilst there. Lots of nice places to eat nearby too. My value rating is soley because of the poor exchange rate of the UK pound.

Reviews.Title: “highlight of our stay”
Reviews.Author: iluvbluey
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on a quiet, pretty street. Ree and Keith are very organised and professional. Breakfast was great. We didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Silverfern55
Reviews.Content: The positives are the friendly staff, large comfortable rooms and good location with very convenient restaurants and public transport. Good supply of quality toiletries and towels. Wifi was great and overall we were very happy. Small gripes were that the room amenities were tired especially the cupboard and shame about dirty cups and opened milks in fridge but can see it is easy to overlook some details. But the cracked tilers on the bathroom floor worried us as my wife was concerned that someone might slice their foot on the sharp edge as there was movement in the floor. Breakfast was adequate but mundane. Supermarket bread, little catering packets of jams, a token bowl of hardboiled eggs and it was a little bizarre that the muesli had white chocolate bits in it! Sorry guys but that is letting you down. Variety is the spice of life but the same limited fruits were offered 3 days running. Perhaps consider a few artisan provisions to add a bit of flair.

Reviews.Title: “A treat!”
Reviews.Author: JodyZ5
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast hotel is on a beautiful tree lined street, out of the hustle and bustle of Sydney, yet within easy walking distance. Our room had large windows and plenty of sunlight. Keith and Marie could not have been more hospitable and helpful. They were ready for us even though we arrived early. They made us feel so comfortable. They even helped research our interests on their computer. (Plus, there is a computer in the library for guests' use.) The first day we arrived, we checked out another hotel in Sydney where we had planned to stay the following week. Then we came back and asked Keith if he could fit us in back at Simposons of Potts Point. It appears we got the last room. So, we cancelled our other commitment. Keith gave us good advice for a walking tour for our first day, and we did it all. Great service, top notch. A treat

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: George843
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Simpsons for our special occasion. The chocolates and champagne on arrival started the weekend pleasantly. Accommodation was extremely comfortable in an old world style (beautifully renovated rooms) and staff (thanks Ree and Keith) were friendly and helpful. The location is ideal and close to the Sydney CBD, but you would not know it as the Potts Point area is very quiet. All in all a restful and pleasant experience. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HKH99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Sydney and had a two night stay at Simpsons Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay -the location is great, the rooms are very comfortable and the hosts, (Ree and Keith) are very friendly and provide a wonderful service. Breakfast is relaxed and whilst of continental nature, very adequate. There are many restaurants nearby - the one we went to provided a good night with quality food. Whilst we had checked out in the morning of our departure we were able to utilise the hotel and shower etc up to departing on an early evening flight. This is not your multi-story, big inner hotel with pool, etc, but rather a stylish intimate hotel that guarantees an excellent stay in this part of Sydney. Only issue could be the paucity of car parking space if you have a car, but should be ok on most occasions. Will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming ambience and great location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraAkinom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The hotel has a charming ambience. Our room was spacious and quiet. Breakfast was all one could hope for. The hotel is ideally situated within 15 minutes walking distance to the CBD - across the Botanic Gardens - and a much shorter walking distance to Kings Cross restaurants. I certainly will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sydney weeekend”
Reviews.Author: Ala2011
Reviews.Content: Simpsons is an oasis of calm and charm in a great location in Sydney ( between Darlinghurst and the botanical gardens and the wharf). There are a few nice restaurants just steps away. If you prefer a beautiful and intimate old house to a large hotel with pool and gym then Simpsons is a great choice. Room was large and comfortable.Chocolates and champagne were lovely on arrival. Breakfast is continental with beautiful stewed fruits. The friendliness of the hosts really enhanced the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: traveling_family_dc
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Simpson's for several days while I had a meeting nearby. The hotel was very nicely appointed, well located, and a unique and pleasant change from larger hotels. The hosts were extremely gracious and accommodating to the needs of our combined business traveler and family with toddler situation, and provided good advice about places to visit in the area. The breakfast was very nice, as described, and the hosts kindly gave us breakfast the night before our early morning departure so we could eat in our room. Our room (one of the dormer rooms) was large, nicely decorated, and very clean. There was a computer available in the common area, and the room included a mini-fridge, both of which we found helpful. We would strongly recommend Simpson's to any traveler to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it”
Reviews.Author: NicoleAachen
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel with very friendly owners. Everything is very nice. Big room. Well located in Sydney to start a journey through the city by a walk through the Botanic Gardens. Many good restaurants just a couple of minutes walking away. Very calm. Good recommendations for sightseeing. ... It is like a 5 star hotel - only smaller and much more personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: john e
Reviews.Content: I stayed three days at the hotel.It was so interesting experience in my life.the staff was so kind and helpful.At the very first day all staff somehow knew my name.Actually I felt the home away from home.the meals were very delightful and i think enjoined my vacation well.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tedfromperth
Reviews.Content: Sure you can stay in big hotels for a similar rate but this is a great little hotel. Keith Marie & Ree make you feel very welcome and have fantastic local knowledge. Very relaxed. It is in a great spot to walk to the CBD along the harbour to the opera house surrounded by great places to eat or go for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great find..”
Reviews.Author: kylieanne_richards
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons of Potts Point for my husbands 40th b'day. Originally I thought of booking one of the big 5-star hotels in the city. But after too many work trips staying in such places, I searched on the internet for something boutique yet still within the luxury classification. Simpsons was perfect! It was in excellent proximity to some high end restaurants, parks and shopping. The staff were very helpful, particularly with our 10 month old son. The building and rooms provided a homely, yet elegant feel. We enjoyed our stay immensely and will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: jduboisHeemstede
Reviews.Content: The Simpsons Team makes you feel at home right from the moment you enter their stylish mansion. Their determined aim for excellence and outstanding level of genuine hospitality are indeed key factors for a most enjoyable stay.This oasis is for quality people who appreciate peace and tranquility in an environment with much more than a touch of class. J. Van Houten

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickie g
Reviews.Content: I found that this hotel was well laid out with large rooms. I could not fault anything. The service was fantastic. Lovely building, great location and the staff will bend over backwards to exceed your expectations.The bed was very comfortable, and the sheets were beautiful. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Period gem in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RogerHC
Reviews.Content: Simpsons in Potts Point is a splendid place to stay in Sydney. We stayed for a week and found our hosts particularly friendly, helpful and hospitable and always ready with suggestions for things to do, places to go and good places to eat. At first we thought it a bit expensive (Sydney is!) but with the added advantages of free parking and internet it really was quite reasonable. whilst quite close to the seedy Kings Cross area it is a quiet haven with beautiful period lounges and spacious rooms. Breakfast in the dining area at the back was delicious and varied. We found it very easy to get around and to get into the city centre both by train and bus but there were also great restaurants and coffee houses within a few minutes walk. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Solo Business Travel and Couples”
Reviews.Author: Greville
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Simpsons for 2 nights and all was not less than excellent from reception to departure. Arrived early (before lunch) and shown the building facilities, and showed to my room (Dormer Suite); the pictures on the web page do not do it justice, they are quite large and roomy and includes a fridge, very reasonable bathroom, ironing facility and a very comfortable queen bed. Within minutes I was having a nap. Simpsons is best described as a private multi-storey home of antiquean character which oozes lots of charm. The building has been modified to accommodate fully self-contained suites of various size and retain the original structure. A pleasure to view. Located less than 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross Station, this hotel is reasonably centrally located for public transport and ease of walking to several tourist features of inner Sydney. The building has security and access is via an encoded fob or keypad code; works well once you master the E-button (hi Keith) :-) Aside from your suite, guests are welcome to use the common-areas, dining room, extended-lounge which also has a computer for free internet access. There is Wi-Fi throughout and it is only a matter of getting the code for access should you have your own computer; networked printing is also available; again, just ask Keith. Breakfast is a breeze with plenty to get you going; fresh fruit, cereal, toasts and lots of accompaniments and the days newspapers to read if you like. In fact, breakfast is so well organised I had two on my last morning with no complaints (Hi Damien) :-) In the evening, if finding a quiet moment is needed, feel free to sit back in the lounge, in front of the open-hearth fire and sip on the complimentary port and brandy (open-bar), I did and eased into the fine leather chairs. Of note, there is a continuous flow of classical and operatic music when in the dining room and lounge, a delight to listen, not overly loud or distracting, but fine enough to compliment the building and accommodation features. Limited car-parking is available, check with the hotel when making your booking is highly recommended. Upon check-out, I was conveniently allowed to use the lounge and bathroom facilities till my departure at lunch. Yes, I will definitely return next time I have business in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayman999
Reviews.Content: We began our trip of australia from sydney and there was no bettr plac than simpsons at potts point to stayat. The location was fantastic and had a homly feel to eat. rooms were spectacular and had a very british feel to it. the conservatory quiet and peacefull and the owners were very down to earth and friendly. loved the experience and will be back! P.S. if you have a lot of luggage.. it would be difficult to go up the stairs as there is no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, well run friendly hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: j T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week after arriving in Sydney from long haul flight. Spacious room and bathroom, clean, quiet, comfortable and with very helpful hosts. Just 10 mins walk to the botanic gardens; we found it an ideal place to relax and see all the sights of Sydney. Just up the road is a deli and a mixture of local shops and eating places. Taxi back from the city centre is about 15 AUD. We liked it so much we will book again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully quiet and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: 50SomethingPOM
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel this year and we would not hestiate to stay here again. The lovely old heritage building and quiet atmosphere exudes a sense of peacefulness. Each stay we have had a different room, and they have all been comfortable and spacious. A nice continental breakfast is served in a bright conservatory attached to the house. The hotel is about a 30 minute enjoyable walk through the Botanical Gardens to the Sydney Opera, and is well serviced by public transport. Bus and rail services are within easy walking distance as are many good restaurants serving a whole range of cuisines.

Reviews.Title: “Ree my lips, this is the best in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: DrMac27126
Reviews.Content: Awful pun, but indeed Ree made our stay in Sydney a memorable and wonderful one with my family. I was here for business but also had time to see all the sights. The room was ready when we arrived, the coffee Keith served us after that long flight was dark, freshly pressed, hot and delicious, it is good to be addicted to good coffee. After the effects of caffeine set in we noticed how wonderful the sun room was, where we spent some of the best parts of our days in Sydney. The hospitality was genuine, the tips were not only accurate but strategic, i.e. designed for our needs. Describing the experience is like trying to describe a field trip to the grand canyon, you have to be there yourself. What was great for us may not be good for you but be assured, Ree will make it great for you.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: DCFamily5
Reviews.Content: Simpson's is the perfect place in Sydney for folks looking for something outside the norm. Housed in a beautiful restored mansion on a fairly quiet street that's a decent but doable walk to most of Sydney it was exactly what I was looking for. Arrived mid-morning after an overnight flight and was offered our room immediately. Public rooms, the grounds, and the breakfast room are all very nice. The room was just okay, a little tired and with a less than great bathroom, but clean and well stocked nonetheless. Realized quickly that our Sydney stay would be extended (flights to NZ were cancelled due to an ash cloud). The hotel quickly confirmed we could stay and were extremely helpful with tips on fun things to do in Sydney. Their instructions for a fun day across the bay were perfect. The immediate neighborhood is filled with restaurants and services and although it's a bit of a hike, we walked from the heart of downtown Sydney without much effort and the Opera House is also walkable. Breakfast was tasty and with a nice variety of choices. I have no reservations recommending Simpson's for anyone looking to avoid the generic high-rise hotel scene, it really is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “A DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: RonandVince
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Australia. On our arrival from Chicago, we were glad that at the start of the trip we were at Simpsons of Potts Point. After touring Aus. and New Zealand, we returned to the hotel before flying home. Everyone on the staff was helpful and friendly and the B&B was like stepping back in time, but with all the modern features of today. We had two Aussie friends who came down from Brisbane to visit us in Sydney. Tthey had a hotel room near the airport and were quite jealous of our accomendations. We feel that others will enjoy their time here as much as we enjoyed this special place.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Classy & Comfortable in Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Hills_Ambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Cloud Suite at Simpsons, what a nice surprise. The accommodation was extremely comfortable and had all the little touches that make life enjoyable when on a short break. Breakfast in the sunroom is lovely and also provides a chance to chat with other guests over a coffee or cup of tea. Ree's reccomendations for dinner at Fratelli Fresh (Italian) and Anong (Thai) were spot on. The extra time spent sightseeing in the local area with local knowledge of the owners were great choices. If you are staying in Sydney for up to a week, be sure to buy a 7 day pass at the Airport , it is great value for money for transport in the Sydney area which also includes rail from the Airport to the CDB return. Thanks Keith, Marie and Ree, you have shared a lovely part of the world with us. Di & Roger

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jocelyn50
Reviews.Content: Mum and I stayed at Simpsons for a few days and it could not have been more perfect. Keith and Ree were warm and welcoming hosts and were also very helpful tourist guides regarding restaurants and attractions. This beautiful old home is in a quiet street ensuring a great nights sleep in comfy beds and reverse cycle air conditioning optional. Potts Point is a central location with the most heavenly walk around the shoreline through the most superb park to the opera house and the cbd. Simpsons is a far more relaxing place to stay than a hotel and I will definately return and encourage my friends to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - not sure it quite lived up to the hyperbole”
Reviews.Author: iad11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons early in 2011. The location is very good, just up some steps from Wolloomooloo and therefore a pleasant walk to the Botanical Gardens, the Gallery and the Opera House not too much further on. Potts Point is also a lively area with a few good restaurants as other reveiwers have mentioned - the Italian restaurant Fratelli Paradiso being one of them. There is also a good book shop at the end of the street. The hotel itself is a great old building in a street with some nice period buildings across the road. The public rooms in the hotel are lovely with old furniture a couple of fireplaces and a computer with internet access, a great place to sit and read the paper or one of the many books provided. The breakfast room at the back of the building is also quite pleasant. Booking was very simple and the staff were quick to reply to emails and generally very helpful. My only (minor) gripe would be that the rooms on the ground floor are fairly dark and a tiny bit tired, plaster is chipped and we had a dead refrigerator taking up space in our cupboard (as well as a functional one). I didn't get the feeling that any of the rooms would be hugely brighter or have much of a view. The bathrooms are also quite basic for a place with some pretension to be special. Lastly, tea and coffee making in the room is a nice thought, but for the level of the hotel it would be nice to offer something better than sachets of instant coffee. Breakfast is pleasant if unspectacular. I guess overall it is reasonably good value for money - our room was not overly expensive (and breakfast was included), but I'm surpirsed a little that this ranks #1 in Sydney. I've stayed in boutique accommodation elsewhere in Australia (Melbourne for example), where the decor and the attention to detail (coffee, breakfast choices etc) was better and the room fitout, particularly the bathroom more stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and room”
Reviews.Author: Exlondonhotelperson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a quick visit to Sydney to catch up with family & friends. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Having lived in Sydney previously I had always thought it would be a great place to stay - it is! Ree, Keith and Marie were so friendly & very knowledgable about everything happening in Sydney that weekend. Many thanks - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tess17
Reviews.Content: Great room, quiet neighbourhood, easy access to everything, fantastic cafes/restaurants in walking distance - in fact just a few doors away. Lots of friendly, concerned service and informed advice re: getting about Sydney. Lovely breakfast room and a generous breakfast. Access to a sitting room and full bathroom even once we had checked out and were waiting for flights. And to top it all off - free wifi - which made for a very happy teenage boy.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: DevonGirl59_11
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of Simpsons was from the lovely, friendly emails from Keith when making our booking. Following the directions given it was easy to find from Kings Cross Station. On entering Simpsons it has a warm feeling, more like a country house than a city hotel. It was easy to walk through the Botanical Gardens to the Opera House and to the main attractions. We had excellent restaurant recommendations from Ree and felt that she couldn't do enough for us. Not sure of the waiter's name at breakfast but he ran everything very efficiently and quietly. We shall certainly return to Simpsons, so much more personal than your big corporate chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location. highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: manneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great location near shops, supermarket and restaurants. Booked online with www.byojet.com got an excellent rate much less than Expedia or direct.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and service”
Reviews.Author: Missi0nary
Reviews.Content: Potts Point is a simply wonderful location...close to the CBD, great restaurants, cafes and delis on your doorstep...and Simpsons is the place to stay. Our room (Cloud Suite) was large and comfortable. Being at the front of the property it was probably noisier than those at the back (next time we will book at the rear). Keith was the perfect host with lots of local knowledge and an eagerness to help. Buffet breakfast was fine (although no hot options). We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely style and location.”
Reviews.Author: thumphry
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Simpsons several times over the last 6 years. Great location, rooms, cleanliness and service. However, the decor is getting a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Always love staying at SImpsons”
Reviews.Author: Nor61
Reviews.Content: As always, my family and our friends from overseas enjoyed a fantastic stay at Simpsons. Keith and Marie were very welcoming and ever ready with good advice on places to go and things to do locally as well as in greater Sydney area. We always look forward to our civilised and plentiful breakfast before heading out for the day's activities and also look forward to returning to our comfortable rooms at the end of the day to unwind and relax. We can't wait to return to Simpsons in the future. Thanks for a lovely stay once again.

Reviews.Title: “Simpson's is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: sstrike1
Reviews.Content: It would not do this hotel justice to say that we were taken care of during our stay. We were much more than taken care of, we were doted upon. Breakfast each morning was delicious with many options to keep all the eaters in our group happy. Keith drew detailed maps and gave advice and inside information every morning regarding our plans for the day. He offered us coffee and a shower immediately after our long trip from the east coast of the U.S.. The room was beautiful and spacious and extremely clean and well-kept. The entire hotel has such character and wonderfully nice people who live there. Located a short walk from the Royal Botanical Gardens this hotel is not in the busy downtown area (although within a short walk!) but rather the nice Potts Point area which is active with lots to offer in and of itself. Highly recommend this hotel. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Simpsons”
Reviews.Author: Rachel22864
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Simpsons. The Victorian house was charming, the staff very friendly and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: freestyletoo
Reviews.Content: Can't add much to other reviews except to confirm that the rooms and hospitality are everything you could hope for. Well equipped, comfortable and well located. Ree is a great provider of information and makes you feel right at home. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JimJam74
Reviews.Content: Lovely characterful place. A great part of Sydney, quite, but within walking distance to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, lovely place to stay â€“ works on every level.”
Reviews.Author: LivySydney
Reviews.Content: Friendly owner, great location ...an abundance of great restaurants and cafes near by. Simpsons is a lovely old Victorian house well maintained and surprisingly quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time!”
Reviews.Author: LandL60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpson's in 2006 and when we decided to return to Sydney this year, Simpson's was the only place we considered staying. The charming historic house in a quiet neighborhood is furnished with lovely antiques and interesting art work. We were greeted on both occasions by Keith who is a tourism authority - incredible information on what to see, how to get there, where to eat, and lots of interesting tips you'd never find in a guidebook. The property is a 20-30 minute walk to the Opera House and other attractions. However, the route is through the Botanic Gardens. We took different paths everytime, all lovely. And the 106 steps at the end of the street certainly helped work off dinner every evening!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Victorian guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: mike_tedders
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our brief stay here. The location is great - we loved being in a slightly more residential district than in CBD. Walking distance to good restaurants and bars in Potts Point and Kings Cross. Owner was very friendly and helpful, large room, free parking. Breakfast was ok but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Simpson's offers the style, warmth of welcome and ambience of an elegant family home”
Reviews.Author: shaw36
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Simpson's front door after a 37-hour flight, laden with baggage and hours ahead of the prescribed check-in time. In fact breakfast in the bright dining room was still in progress. Before we knew it, we were sitting with a very welcome pot of tea, So refreshed, we were prepared to do so exploring while our room was made ready. Insyead, Keith, the perfect host, led us to our room where we found our bags and everything in readiness. After getting somewhat settled, Keith gave us a tour of the lovely house, a feature being the comfortable sitting room, complete with a library, port and sherry for pre-post-dinner sipping and a computer for internet access for those of us who cannot leave that behind. Fortified each morning with excellent breakfasts, our 10-day stay passed in a flash with help all along the way from Keith, Marie, Ree and Damian. On several occasions we took early morning tours, laeving before the usual breakfast hours. No problem! On the eve of each tour a breakfast tray was left in our room. That is just one example of the lengths that the folks at Simpson's will go to make their guests feel truly at home in their lovely home. Getting about is easy as there is a bus close by which runs to Circular Quay and other "must see" spots. Should we ever return to Sydney, Simpson's will be our choice

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and welcoming, quiet yet well located for seeing Sydney and”
Reviews.Author: sundial90
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming management and staff who looked after us extremely well. Our room was comfotrable and quiet with excellent facilities. Good breakfast in delightful surroundings and lovely drawing room in which to relax. We were given lots of useful advice for our first visit to Sydney and if we return we shall definitely try and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Simpsons of Potts Point, Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: Goggler
Reviews.Content: Ree, Keith and Marie made our stay very special - everything was perfect. They let us in early for a refreshing shower and breakfast while our room was being prepared, organised our days out with detailed guides, hints and tips, and even personally waved us good-bye when we had to reluctantly leave for Cairns. What more could a visitor desire! Thank you for your impeccable service and we shall certainly stay with you if we are ever in Sydney again. We also recommend you to anyone who is heading your way. It was just brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “There is no other choice.....”
Reviews.Author: AMGAWRIT
Reviews.Content: Outside, Simpsons is centrally located, amidst amazing restaurants and nightlife, but once you walk inside, you could be at a rural spa, quiet, relaxed, cosy and clean, beautiful guest rooms. The staff at Simpsons are always welcoming, friendly and accomodating to specific needs. Can't wait to spend some time there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful and comfortable stay with special attention to us”
Reviews.Author: Hoengg
Reviews.Content: I and my husband stayed for over two weeks at Simpsons B&B leisure hotel for our special trip to Sydney to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We were greeted by champagne, flowers and chocolates in our nice room and the manager lady oriented us well! The owners and staff were very helpful and friendly. We could bring up breakfast to our room, or have it in their pleasant breakfast room. Their living-room downstairs was beautfully decorated and we could relax there at the end of the day after dinner and sip sherry, compliments of them, while listening to beautiful music and browsing through their interesting coffee table books. The heritage building is characterful and the location just perfect! Restaurants on our door step with some of the best food we have had in a long time (not to be missed: The Yellow Cafe closeby for its delicious food and award winning desserts at affordable prices)! And wonderful walks in the nicer residential area near the 'Elizabeth House' and beyond.The Opera House was about 25 minutes walk from there which was an interesting walk in itself and one could easily walk through the beautiful Botanic Gardens to get there (not to be missed as well). We could get our clothes laundered easily and cheaply at nearby laundry shops if you are staying longer. All in all a memorable stay......we felt like special guests yet still had much privacy to enjoy the premises!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning accommodation in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PnsFla
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted by Ree upon arrival and shown to our magnificent room. While we overlooked the street and the wonderful historical buildings, it was extremely quite and allowed for a great nightâ€™s sleep. The furnishings of the house are very tasteful and of a high quality with attention to detail. Our online booking was seamless and the photos do not do the accommodation justice. Initially we thought to stay in a local hotel, saving money, however no 5-star accommodation can compare to Simpsonâ€™s of Potts Point ambience. While the accommodation included breakfast we took advantage of the good weather, strolling through the neighbourhood and partaking of delights from the local bakeries and cafes. The local area has a lot on offer within easy walking distance, representing all nationalities in the area of cuisine. Keith kindly assisted us upon departure, seeing us to our car. He showed genuine interest in us as guests and pride of ownership in this luxury accommodation. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer, however we will return as the hospitality was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and perfect hosts.”
Reviews.Author: JEngelhardt
Reviews.Content: The location in Potts Point is perfect - one of the cool neighborhoods of Sydney with great delis, cafes, bars and shopping and a close walk to the CBD and Circle Quay. Keith and Marie had great insider suggestions on what to do and where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: msena2
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the first time on the recommendation from friends. They were right, it was excellent . The hotel is Victorian and very clean - added a lot of charm to the trip. The staff Marie,Keith n Damien couldn't have been friendlier - I mean it. They were excellent and there to assist at any request but certainly not bothersome at all. The location was so much better than I expected. I walked to all the sightseeing and there were lots of great restaurants. Don't miss the BF serve by Damien

Reviews.Title: “Goergous heritage rooms, and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Beckthter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday last weekend. We were greeted at the door by the owner, Rees, and personally shown to our room. My husband had called the hotel the night before and mentioned that it was my birthday, so she upgraded our room and when we got there there were complimentary choccies and champagne waiting for us! Excellent location, wonderful service, amazing decor. Will stay again as soon as we have the money! :)

Reviews.Title: “An excellently serviced B&B in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ozfiredancer
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our first wedding anniversary in Sydney, my husband and I decided to treat ourselves to 2 nights at Simpsons. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Ree and made to feel welcome as she showed us around the hotel. Our room was comfortable and had the added bonus of a balcony - just the place to enjoy the bottle of sparkling wine and chocolates waiting for us in the room. We needed to borrow a few things in order to prepare for a wedding, and Ree was wonderful in assuring us that we were no bother to her. The breakfast was lovely - simple and healthy, and provided in the sunroom out the back. We did not get a chance to enjoy the sitting room (with complimentary port and sherry), but this will definitely not be our last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience, it ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: greenman28
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the Simpsons Hotel. The rooms were impeccably clean, very large, very comfortable & lovely & quiet. The fittings and furnishings are lovely period pieces which give the hotel a lovely homely & elegant feel. The location is fabulous just a short stroll from the harbour & the fabulous Wooloomooloo Wharf & literally is about 30 steps from Macleay Street, which is full of great trendy cafes & interesting shops & boutiques!

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected but then only two nights”
Reviews.Author: snorfs
Reviews.Content: we were scheduled to spend four nights at Simpsons but earthquake in ChCh, NZ delayed us by several days. ended up with two nights at Simpsons. the building is beautiful. location is farther from harbor and center city than we thought it would be. our room was fine, comfortable. for those who are interested, there are no "views" to speak of. hospitality was odd. we felt a bit like we were intruders rather than guests. breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “irresponsible approach/unbusinesslike attitude”
Reviews.Author: BlackSwanSydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are getting married and we wanted to stay a couple of nights in a little b&b, however as we entered the hotel grounds to get information face-to-face, the landlady came out in a terribly rude manner treating us in the most offensive way. She neither introduced herself nor gave us any information claiming that she can't do it then. She refused to answer any of our questions, leaving us with a big question of racism in our heads. She was outrageously rude and acted as if we were invading her space.So shocked, we called the hotel later to get an expalanation, but her attitude remained appouling and she hang up the phone. The worst experience ever. No idea how they do business. Even if offered for free, never would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews Are Accurate”
Reviews.Author: Davidgpf
Reviews.Content: No need to reiterate in detail what others say. It is charming, small hotel which is very well run by very helpful people. Had planned to stay for three nights, and enjoyed it and Sydney (a world class city) so much we stayed longer. The rooms are very nice, and the air conditioning (a real concern in the summer) very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: nananddave
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique hotel on a quite street just minutes from the botanical gardens. There are a number of great restaurents within couple of blocks of this place, as well as coffee shops, grocery stores, bakeries etc. It's a nice change to stay in a quiet residential area. The place is elegant, spacious, and the owners are very friendly and always more than happy to give advice. Their continental breakfast is quite nice as well, in their beautiful breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dcoulson
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place, excellent position and the rooms are superb. The thing that really makes it special are the owners and manager, they make it a home from home. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of the great reviews.”
Reviews.Author: enine
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful building, etc. But, it is the people that make the hotel. Keith and staff are fantastic. I would strongly recommend Simpsons to anyone visiting Sydney, for the first time or the 100th. Away from the bustle of the CBD and the Rocks, Circular Quay area, but close enough that you can easily walk there. Much better value than the mainstream hotels as well. We look forward to our next stay

Reviews.Title: “Charming, little, victorianstyle Boutiquehotel”
Reviews.Author: RiccardaCaiati
Reviews.Content: Loved the place the minute i entered it. Sitting in a small residential street and only 10 minutes walk to kings cross,( and only a 20 minute walk to the operahouse) this hotel breathes a very warm and charming atmosphere. Rooms with high ceilings, spacious, comfortable beds, lovely bathrooms, all very clean and generous . Antique furniture. A quiet place. My favourite was the libary-lounge-room on the groundfloor. Lots of books, portwine for free, internetaccess (free) and leathersofas with plenty of cushions made it a perfect place to sit in the evening and let the eyes relax and enjoy... Keith and Ree have been so helpful with advice on where to go and what to do, they are true restaurant-experts and you just enjoy talking to them so much you don"t want to leave the hotel:-)) Breakfast had everything i needed and was held in a lovely little glassroofed room. I travelled in Australia and kept coming back to that wonderful place...is there anything more i need to say?

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: seamitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Simpsons of Potts Point Hotel. If you don't want one of the large downtown hotels (we didn't) this is perfect. Great neighborhood with many food choices and easy walking access to many places. Hotel is beautiful and the hosts are very helfpul. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Shortyesquire
Reviews.Content: Big comfortable rooms in a beautiful old mansion in Sydney's Potts Point. The staff are great and very helpful and the location is ideal for the great food in Potts Point and Woolloomooloo or the night life of Kings Cross and Darlinghurst. Would also be great for business travellers wanting a quiet retreat that is within 10mins walk of the central business district.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome with high quality accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen3160
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and professional reservation, welcome and service. The location is excellent of the city and for getting around. The breakfast was good and some little touches, like the offer of free sherry and port, made hte whole experience lovely. The standard of accommodation was extremely high too. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great b and b in a vibrant area”
Reviews.Author: jandj47
Reviews.Content: For our few days in Sydney at the end of along trip to Australia we were recommended Simpsons.It proved to be a terrific choice.The little hotel has real character and is well placed for a huge number of restaurants and also other sights like art galleries and the harbour.We eat really well at The Sardine Room and Fratelli Paradiso just a minute away.King's Cross station is also close by.What makes this boutique b and b special is not just the character and elegance of the bedrooms and the public spaces but the real helpfulness of Ree and Keith ,the owners.They couldn't rest in the morning without ensuring that all their guests had exciting plans for the day.Keith special walk around Bronte and Bondi was great as were their other tips.
