Reviews.Title: “Feel like home in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: chaberge
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at Simpsons of Potts Point! It was recommended to us by a friend. When I wrote a mail to them to see if they could fit us all in one room ( 2 aults and 4 children), I could already tell this was a warm and welcomimg place! They did everything they could to make us feel at home, and we almost felt like family. This is a quiet hotel, and if you are travelling with children, it is important that they are considerate. Potts Point is a charming area, with lots of good restaurants and cafes. The walk to the operahouse through the botanical gardens is a must! Ree and Keith will be more than happy to give you maps and advice about the city, and things to do. We canÂ´t wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Country feel and service, right in the heart of the Cross”
Reviews.Author: ChristianLuke
Reviews.Content: Travel the globe for work and stayed in many hotels. Simpsons gave me by far the best welcome and tour yet. Great vibe and feel to the place - Can't wait to get back! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful venue spoilt by the noise”
Reviews.Author: jOymarie255060
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our anniversary night away from the children and the room and champagne and chocolates on arrival were delightful. Not so the noise coming from the dining room (which we were located directly above) for the majority of the night - the occupants of the cloud suite beside us were clearly partying on into the wee hours of the morning and I ended up calling reception at 3 am and leaving a disgruntled message. When I raised the issue the next day (nothing having been said to me about my message) with Ree she was very casual about it and suggested I should have rung a different number to contact her directly but acknowledged that they were partying when she came in that night. So why didn't she ask them to stop? Well I later overheard her talking to them and the reason was quite clear - she was up partying with them! Not impressed...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value fo money”
Reviews.Author: brian5577
Reviews.Content: For anyone wishing to spend time at a home away from home this is the place. Without doubt one of the best B&B style hotels that I have ever stayed in. From the amazing welcome, assistance with local sights and a really well presented continental breakfast my stay was memorable. You immediately feel lie part of the family. Also well located for busses and 30 mintes walk from the Sydney Opera House - and what a spectacular walk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: rmklondon
Reviews.Content: Nice house ,comfortable room , charming hosts ... Love to come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Foxelms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location with prime tourist sites only a walk away & yet you are residing in comfortable Challis Avenue. I was able to walk through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House & Circular Quay as well as enjoying the art of the National Gallery within a stone's throw. I felt quite smug when I was picked up here for tour trips when other travellers were enduring the noise & crowds outside their hotels. Good restaurants across the road & the train at Kings Cross plus buses were all on hand for Bondi & the city. There is a Woolies supermarket nearby. The hosts gave great advice and the room fridge was stocked with affordable drinks. A towel was provided when I went swimming! I loved it and will definitely be staying here when I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “This is ideal accommodation for a Sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: bocabay
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Simpsons. It is centrally located in a super spot, not far from the central harbor/opera house (30 min walk) and close to good restaurants. The hotel itself is charming, comfortable and peaceful, and the staff go out of their way to make your stay in Sydney enjoyable. Simpsons will definitely be our choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: motherWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Although a while since we stayed at Simpsons I wanted to write a review as we are hopefully returning to Sydney and will most definately stay at Simpsons again. The welcome was lovely and nothing was too much trouble. As other reviewers have said, breakfast is a little limited but we always had enough to eat. It is a pleasant walk to the city and feels safe even at night. Whilst in Sydney we took the tour bus around the city which is very informative, this bus also took us out to Bondi Beach which is a nice day out. We also visited Manley Beach via ferry which is also good to visit. The highlight for us was a day trip to the Blue Mountains. The scenery is stunning and a must for all visitors to Sydney. All in all loved Simpsons and would return without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, cosy Hotel at good, quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: Marina_Ivashina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days (13 - 15 Jan), and we are really happy with the quality of our accomodation. A bit poor choice for a breakfast, but it all smoothes by their lovely hostess, who is alwasy willing to help. Room was nice, quiet - the most important thing for me... Furnishing and decoration are outstanding, but all designer efforts were a bit spoiled by a shabby built-in closet... In general - this hotel is a very good choice for staying.

Reviews.Title: “At home in the best neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Rower_walker
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel on a quiet street in a moderately fashionable neighborhood with lovely hosts. It would be a find in any city. But it is just up the steps from the heart of Sydney's waterfront hub, a short walk to the Botanical Gardens, the Art Gallery (with the current exhibition of Xian terracotta warriors from China), Circular Quay and all the ferries, and the central business district (CBD) with good shopping. Simpsons is more than a find -- it's a treasure. Keith and Ree looked after us in family fashion, and the rest of the staff was also warm, friendly, and highly functional. Breakfast in the conservatory is not of the hot cooked variety, but it is plenty substantial and very fresh. Yummy breads, excellent coffee and teas, fresh fruit, ham and cheese, cereals and yoghurt. One of the managers was always handy to guide you to the best day trips around and advice on how to negotiate the ferries, trains, and busses. We loved it so much that we extended our stay by two days, necessitating a move to the large suite in front - Cloud Suite. The stained glass and gracious proportions wowed us from the start. It was a bit more expensive, but it was even lovelier and more comfy than our first room. The jacuzzi tub and separate glassed-in shower were definitely a plus, as was the excellent air conditioner for the warm evenings. Other ideas for Sydney: 1 - the Bridge Climb of Sydney Harbour Bridge is great, but we'd suggest doing the shortened version. It's not cheaper, but a brisker pace would have been better for us. We went at 5pm and caught sunset a bit before 7. Not as pricey as the twilight climb but quite spectacular. 2 - Ferries to Watsons Bay and bus to Bondi Beach. Doyle's serves a great but very pricey lunch with great view back to Sydney's skyline, Nice walks along South Head. At Bondi Beach Iceberg Club (available to out-of-country visitors for a day) serves food comparable to Doyle's in quality if not in the wide selection for half the price with entertaining views of the lovely beach and surf. We loved Sydney and especially loved our retreat away from the noise of the busy central city. Highly recommend Simpsons!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but very quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: ratata
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our children, age 9 and 12 years, after three nights at Shangri-La. Simpsons of Potts Point is a totally different hotel, both positively and negatively. The hotel is very quite in itself and is located in a very quite area. We got one of the Dormer rooms at the 3rd floor which was perfect for our family. It is no lift in the building, which means that you have to carry your luggage all the way up. The service level is very personal and Keith and Ree greeted us by name every morning. Very nice! The breakfast is minimal, but good. It is easy to walk to the downtown area through the beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens. It will take you about 25-30 minutes, but it might be a bit long for small children. The hotel gives you a kind of "coming home to somebody" feeling and has beautiful antiques and furniture, so it is no playground for young children. However, it is really nice to sit down in the living room in the evening (without children...), enjoying the quietness, a good book and a glass of wine. There are a lot of restaurants nearby, but most of them were very busy during our stay (Christmas-time). It seems like you have to make reservations. We tried the Arun Thai Restaurant on 28 Macleay Street. It was very good, and not that busy. The room rate was extremely high during the New Years Eve weekend, as we had to pay AUD 545 plus tax per night. We decided to spend the New Years Eve at East Circular Quay (to watch the fireworks), but we were also invited home to Keith and Ree for the New Years Eve. Thatâ€™s really nice of them and very personal. Next time we will drop the 9 hours waiting at Circular Quay and accept their invitation! I think it is also very nice to watch the fireworks from the stairs at the end of the street where the hotel is located.

Reviews.Title: “great accommodation, excellent location. first class team looking after you”
Reviews.Author: MWELondon
Reviews.Content: Potts Point is a trendy area of restaurants, bars and selective shopping close to Sydney CBD and city attractions, either walk 15-20 mins, train 5-10 min walk,, bus 50 metres walk, or taxis plentiful. Simpsons is a beautifully restored building with comfortable rooms with all necessary mod cons. Has a relaxing communal lounge area. Keith, Marie and Ree will attend to your every need and are a wealth of knowledge to assist you plan the most from your stay in Sydney. Their breakfasts offer something to satisfy everyone with plenty of variety and healthy alternatives. If stairs are a difficulty for you, make sure request ground or lowwer floor room. Highly recommended and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - excellent location away from the noise”
Reviews.Author: RA_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The breakfast set up was very nice. The staff was engaging and helpful. We had a bad experience while visiting at a restaurant up the street from the hotel - Fratelli Paradiso and the management at the hotel was very sympathetic (I was nursing my 4 month baby and was called a "cow" by the management of the restaurant). Nice location

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to large chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: AWelly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a four day weekend in Sydney to celebrate an anniversary. We really enjoyed the stay. The location is good with great restaurants nearby and close enough to all the attractions in the city (particularly if you don't mind the walk around the harbour into the city which takes a little longer than the convenient public transport but is worth it). The management had the balance just right between being very helpful and not too intrusive. We also enjoyed meeting other guests in the lounge in the evening or the breakfast room in the morning. The room and amenities were great with lots of space in the room and plenty of character in the hotel. We will be certain to stay there again when we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, warm and welcoming proprietors and great location”
Reviews.Author: IlanaSaraf
Reviews.Content: Simpsons House of Potts Point served our needs perfectly. A gorgeous and Historic house, a bit off the beaten path which allowed for a nice walk each day as we explored Sydney by foot. Potts Point is a hip, real and friendly neighborhood with excellent restaurants, cafes and shops. Keith, Marie and Ree all made us feel welcome and at home as well as provided us with endless daily suggestions of things to do and see during our five days in Sydney. The room was comfortable, spacious, elegant yet cozy. The bathroom was roomy but I would have liked a more updated shower and bath. Breakfast was good, but nothing to write home about. I do love a great cup of coffee and I missed this each morning, but Keith's friendly greeting made up for it. WIth the strong Australian dollar SImpson's House provides great value. We recommend it highly and would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back To Simpsons, great in every way.”
Reviews.Author: julieab31
Reviews.Content: Welcoming and comfortable, nothing too much trouble. Our hosts were informative regarding Sydney, easy walk into the city. Good breakfast catering for special diets. Spacious room tasteful decor, quiet location. Great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic accommodations with delightful, personalized service.”
Reviews.Author: Cmaaarrr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Simpsons was a clear highlight of our trip to Sydney, both in terms of the accommodations and as a well-informed "home base" to explore the area. The house itself is beautiful, and our room was both charming and extremely functional. Spending an evening reading by the fire in the common room sipping a complimentary glass of port was a true delight. The breakfast spread was diverse and delicious, and the personalized service with it only help to start each day in a positive way. Keith, Ree, and the rest of the staff were an absolute joy to interact with, and Keith especially was exceedingly helpful in giving us ideas and planning to explore Sydney and the surrounding area. Their genuine warmth made us feel exceedingly welcome. Obviously, I have nothing negative to say about our three day stay at Simpsons! I hope to go back to Sydney at some point, and will definitely plan on staying here again. I recommend Simpsons highly to anyone traveling to Sydney, especially those unfamiliar with the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: inhiding
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great stay at the charming Simpsons of Potts Point. We were welcomed by Ree who was delightful to work with on getting us checked in. We arrived in the morning and a room wasn't ready, but the hotel's downstairs bathroom has a full tub and shower which Ree invited to use to freshen up. That was really appreciated considering we had just completed 20+ hours of flying! We stayed four nights in one of the top floor Dormer rooms. These rooms are billed as smaller but we found it to be just fine. The rooms featured a refrigerator, tea service, and a flat screen TV. Also included was free wireless internet...yep, FREE. Most hotels would likely charge A$20 or more a day for that service. The room and bathroom were clean and the bed was comfortable. A night's stay includes a continental breakfast which we really enjoyed. Included were cereals, fruit, yogurt, breads, juice, coffee and tea. Keith, Ree and the kitchen and housekeeping staff were all very pleasant and nice, as if we were guests in their own house. A few quick observations about the hotel that might be helpful in deciding if you should book: I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s a lift/elevator (itâ€™s an old house after all) so if have trouble climbing stairs you should request a ground floor room. The hotel was very quiet while we were there, which was fine with me, but if you tend be up late and loud, you might want to stay in a larger hotel (just my opinion). We found the Potts Point area to be a great place to use as our base in Sydney. The hotel is about 10 minute walk from the Kingâ€™s Cross rail station and the area seemed very safe during the day and at night. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and it seems more residential when compared to the CBD. Our trip to Australia started in Sydney at the Simpsons Hotel, then on to two others cities and then back to Sydney for two days before returning to the US. We had planned to return to the Simpsons hotel during our last two days in Sydney, but there was a miscommunication between myself and the hotel regarding the return visit and a room wasnâ€™t reserved for us those last two days. Once this oversight was realized, Keith quickly made a reservation for us at another hotel. The rate at the other hotel was slightly higher than the rate at the Simpsons for the same room, so Keith refunded the difference back to me. Now that is great service. We look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “great stay...”
Reviews.Author: renaust
Reviews.Content: Had a enjoyable few days at this hotel- one very small gripe would be the washing powder they use on all the bedding, towels etc... is fairly toxic and the smell is pretty awful. Would be great if they could use 'eco store product- environment friendly and chemical free- bought in any supermarket... I also think the 3pm check in is a little late in the day when check out is still at ten the following morning- 11am would be better considering.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: abroom
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located away from the city yet close enough to everythign you want. This is a real gem and we were very well looked after by Keith and his team who gave excellant service and told us all the things we would like t osee in our short stay. It probably is good value but with such a strong AUS dollar it makes it a bit more expensive to UK visitors right now. Thank you Keith for a lovely finish to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great B&B”
Reviews.Author: dantecat
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quiet and in a great location. We stayed 3 nites, the first 2 in room #11 on the 2nd level; and 1 day a week later in room 5 on the main level which came with a small porch. Room 5 is located next to the dining room but at least the morning we were there, we didn't hear any noise (though we smelt some breads cooking which got us out of bed). We preferred the room upstairs as the view includes many trees and you hear the birds in the morning. Both rooms were clean, well decorated in a traditional manner, and felt comfortable. Beds were large; bathrooms clean. A small living room space is enough to set down some books or computer, a flat screen TV is there which we didn't use; and a small refridge stocked with pop, juice, and water. The library on the main floor is stocked with leisure and travel books, a computer to use, and always some port for sipping. Breakfasts are good as others have said; Keith and Ree very charming hosts; knowledgeable about the area and helpful to plan outings. Location is interesting.. going out to the right, you go down a large set of stone stairs which brings you directly to the water where the Royal gardens are located, and the paths to get to the opera house. In contrast, going out of the house to the left, you first go thru a few streets with some nice cafes and restaurants, but soon get to Kings Cross which caters to the late nite adult oriented activiities (men's clubs,etc.). The contrast was rather surprising. Overall we found Simpons' to be pretty close to what is advertised; and would return there. The price was a bit higher than what we wanted to spend, but we made last minute arrangements so were glad to be able to stay there for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel with easy access to attractions!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDays101
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and in the city centre so could walk everywhere. We booked all of our tours online at www.ExperienceOz.com.au and got picked up at the hotel which was really convenient. If you wait till you get there you might miss out as it gets booked out quickly for the good tours. There are also some really good discounted passes so definitely worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: youngy16
Reviews.Content: Good location; near to all inner city attractions yet providing great access to other "must visit areas" like Bondi Beach, Sydney Harbour, Opera House, etc. Heaps of good eateries and bars right on the doorstep. The manager and staff made us feel most welcome; nothing was a bother. The room was clean and comfortable; it had everything we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, comfortable hotel -- warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: KatherineONeil
Reviews.Content: Terrific, trendy neighborhood filled with small, elegant shops and restaurants and a short walk downhill to harbor, Botanical Gardens. Rooms large, nicely furnished and comfortable. Hotel is on a quiet side street. Staff welcoming and well informed on sights of Sydney and surrounds. Sumptuous breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but elegant stay”
Reviews.Author: yukaara
Reviews.Content: Very clean and quiet place to stay at the center of the city, to experience friendly neighbourhood. Definitely would like to come back next time I visit Sydney. Yuka (Tokyo Japan)

Reviews.Title: “Different Nice”
Reviews.Author: Springfree
Reviews.Content: We travel widely for both work and pleasure. This would be the first time we've stayed at very small hotel. It is definitely not "corporate" but everything is very professional. It has a homeliness that makes it a wonderful change from the Intercontiental. Keith and his team make you feel like you've been visiting with them for years. The rooms, shared lounge room/library and the breakfast room all have a comfortable ambiance. That you can walk to and from Circular Quay in around 10 minutes makes it a perfect place to explore the CBD area. Lot's of good restaurants within walking distance. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprising”
Reviews.Author: Kel70
Reviews.Content: Simpsons was stunning, historical, wonderfully situated. We were very suprised. We have never stayed in a B&B type Hotel before and were a little unsure but, we will definately go back next time we are in Sydney. The staff were fantastic, and our special thanks to Ree who added a personal touch you don't get in a large establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable week”
Reviews.Author: Margaret087
Reviews.Content: We had more than a week at Simpsons and couldn't recommend it highly enough - the location is convenient with several excellent restaurants within walking distance. It's quiet and luxurious. The owners and staff can't do enough for you. We hope to go there again as it was such a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Your neighborhood oasis in the big city.”
Reviews.Author: SandstoneSprings
Reviews.Content: Keith, Marie, and Ree do a fantastic job of making their guests at Simpsons of Potts Point feel like they have chosen the best place to stay in Sydney. We stayed 3 nights and would recommend that as an absolute minimum. The architecture and decor are influenced by English Arts & Crafts and both are charming. The book-filled library and lounge come complete with a computer for guests. Our room was enormous and pretty and included a sitting area and a porch where we could sit and read, have tea or wine, and watch the street in the sunshine. Potts Point is a real neighborhood and Keith gave us great suggestions for where to eat, all of which were excellent. Breakfast was special (rhubarb compote ! ) and was served by a very nice gentleman whose name we did not learn. The location is very close to steps that take you close to the harbor and to the magnificent botanical gardens that rival any we have seen. We heartily recommend Simpsons at Potts Point.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Homey experience”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter-RS
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience to stay in a bed and breakfast hotel. Since we were used to the big brand name hotels, we had to overcome an initial adjustment. We adjusted well and found the staff friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel is conveniently located. We walked to the city or took a public bus. Keith and Marie made us feel like guests in their beautifully decorated home. If you like Bed and Breakfast accommodations this is definitely for you - if you don't, it is worth giving a try.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lisafishmd
Reviews.Content: Simpsons is a lovely small hotel in a nieghborhood with wonderful restaurants, and a walkable distance from the warf and Opera House. The owner Keith goes out of his way to be helpful and accomodating and internet service as well as a computer to use are both available. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the house is historic and lovingly restored.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis in a delightfully bustling neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bieteut
Reviews.Content: Simpsons has the look of a grand old house, the mod cons of a big chain hotel and all of the friendly service you could want from a B&B. Plus, it's in Potts Point, a really charming part of Sydney. The "family" room was huge, and while the big bed was super comfy, the smaller bed could use a mattress upgrade considering the room rate. The bathroom was clean, and at first it took a while to get the hang of the temperature settings in the shower but that worked out fine. The sofa and chairs and table in the corner were very comfy. All in all, it was very quiet, no noise from other rooms, or in the hall or from the street. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous, especially the crumpets. Tons of reading material provided, and in the lounge, free internet for those not taking a vacation from computers, and all of the travel guides & coffee table books on not only Sydney but other parts of Australia were great. The proprietors are super friendly and so is the housekeeper. As far as location goes, it was the ideal introduction to Sydney for me. I arrived on a Saturday as the sun was setting and as soon as I started exploring I felt right at home amongst the bustling outdoor cafes and locals doing their shopping or getting ready for a night out. Found a great deli for takeaway 'tapas style' in-room dining, and the Arun Thai restaurant was fabulous for a proper dinner out. The vibe in the neighborhood was never rowdy or threatening, unlike the aggro boozy streetscenes witnessed in the CBD during an overnight stay at a different hotel later on during the same trip. On Sunday morning, I met friendly locals walking their dogs, going for a jog, or both, and I was thrilled with the close proximity to the Botanic Gardens & harbor. A wonderful place in a wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmstock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons for three nights prior to leaving on a cruise. Our room was ready when we arrived early after a long flight and the owner Keith spent some time with us on a tour of the property as well as showing us a map and marking places we might want to see. Ree the manager was a delight and very helpful as well. The hotel was spotless and quiet and the Continental breakfast was quite good. It is conveniently located and it is a nice walk into the Botannical gardens and to the harbor (except for those stairs) :-) Thanks for a great stay and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, helpful”
Reviews.Author: PhotoK
Reviews.Content: While my husband was tied up with work obligations in NZ, I took our two kids, ages 13 and 10, to Sydney for 4 days. Having never been before, I wanted to be sure we'd be in a safe (enough) area and that we'd be able to make our way around the city fairly easily. Ree and Keith were very helpful with transport and attraction advice and we did indeed find our way all over very well. Walked the first morinng over to the opera house and then into the city. Took ferries around the harbour and to Darling Harbour, walked across the bridge, spent a couple hours at Luna Park (kids LOVED that), and ate at a lovely little bistro down the street one night. The hotel itself was very quiet and very clean and comfortable, even with the addition of a foldaway bed in one of the upstairs smaller dormer rooms. Continental breakfasts were plentiful and well looked after and our early morning cab ordered by Ree showed up right on time for our departure. We would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, stylish, and a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: tonyandnicky
Reviews.Content: Booked on line for our short stay in Sydney. Location is great, although access to much of Sydney needs either a taxi or strong walking boots! (Public transport leaves a lot to be desired, and is difficult to understand). The hotel is in a quiet street, within easy walking distance of some fine restaurants. We were made very welcome, and given a personalised briefing on things to do and see, with some vital information on the bus/train/ferry to take. Although a bit above our normal price range, it was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “History and Relaxation in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: RedlizNottingham
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with great charm and character located within walking distance of the city but with a vibrant neighbourhood of its own. Ree and the rest of the staff couldn't have been more helpful and the hotel itself is a real find in such a modern metropolis. Full of history, delightfully furnished and in a lovely quiet street but with brilliant restaurants very nearby. We shall return! Thank you very much, Ree and Keith. Liz and Derek, Nottingham, UK

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, really enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: meqRocks
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Ree, the hotel manager, this was just a lovely visit. She took such good care of me, including having my room ready at 6 AM the day I arrived from a long flight overseas. She set me up with a great map / walking tour of Sydney. The hotel is really nice, very clean, quiet, great neighborhood. Really enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: avrilross
Reviews.Content: What a treat to have such a wonderful stay in Sydney. We are very familiar with the city as have visited many times to visit our son and we were here this time for 5 days to attend our son's wedding. The elegant decor of the hotel, the close proximity to wonderful cafes & shops and meeting Ree, such a lovely helpful person & Damien who attended to our every need at breakfast completed the perfect stay. We will certainly return & recommend this unique hotel to our friends travelling from west to east. Ross & Avril Farrer Margaret River West Australia

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding B&B ideally suited to discover Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Pierre18
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nightsat Simpsons in early May 2010. We had the pleasant surprise of being upgraded to a very large room, which was very much appreciated after long flights from Europe. We had the opportunity to take a look into the other rooms; all were charming and very comfortable. Manager Ree and owners Marie and Keith were most welcoming. Over breakfasts, which were delicious, Keith took the time to give us advice and tips on how to discover this beautiful city, and went as far as to draw up maps to enable us make the most of our visit. The place is very quiet. The location is not really downtown, but is around a 20 - 30 minutes walk from the Opera House and Circular Quay through the beautiful Botanical Gardens. There are many pleasant and good value restaurants in the neighborhood, attended mostly by locals, and we were pleased to be away from the tourist crowd. All in all, staying at Simpsons has been a wonderful experience. Many many thanks to Ree, Marie and Keith.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: raecunn
Reviews.Content: A recent one night stay at Simpsons of Potts Point was certainly a positive experience. Having booked on wotif, I was expecting the usual chilly reception upon check in (many hotels do not seem to appreciate you using this service) but was pleasantly surprised by the so helpful and welcoming Ree. Our enquiry regarding a bottle of champagne was promptly met with the delivery of a lovely bottle of French in our fridge. When we were checking out i reminded Ree that we needed to pay for the bottle, she declined saying it was her shout! Having stayed inmany, many hotels over the years I found this extraordinary as I have never before been treated to anything for free by a hotel. this property is everything it says it is and a bit more. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back ;-)”
Reviews.Author: HouseOfLyonAustralia
Reviews.Content: From our welcome to our closing departure Ree & Keith were gracious and ready to assist. What a fabulous stay we had! Simpons Boutique Hotel was a wonderful experience in every way - from location, cleanliness, value to service. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great spot...”
Reviews.Author: HRMR
Reviews.Content: Simpsons was like staying in the home of a wealthy businessman from the days of early Sydney circa 1870.....AND being welcomed like a family member! What a special treat, we'll definitely be back! Ree's tips were brilliant, esp where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A special retreat.”
Reviews.Author: horsenick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary on 25th September for two nights leaving on Monday 27th September. We arrived at the hotel at about 7.30am after flying all night and were told by the amazing Ree who welcomed us at the door that we could go straight into our room even though check-ins are normally at 3.00pm. She also invited us to have breakfast downstairs after we had freshened up. The breakfast was lovely a pot of delicious hot tea with fruit, cereals, yoghurt and many different types of bread to toast, nuts,seeds, dried fruit and boiled eggs if you wanted. Ree the lady who looked after us for the three days while we were there, was gorgeous it was like coming home after exploring Sydney each day. Ree couldn't have been more helpful with her suggestions about where to go and also lent us Sydney site seeing books and gave us maps to help find our way around. Chocolates and champagne were thoughtfully left in our room for our anniversary. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel on our day of departure and freshen up in the downstairs bathroom before Ree saw us off in our taxi on Monday afternoon. Ree thank you for making our weekend a special one, it was lovely to meet you and we have told all our friends that Simpsons of Potts Point is the only place to stay in Sydney because of you. Suzanne and Clive also know as Bjorn and Mia.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: John Littleton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 3 days from the 11 - 14 September 2010 for a short break before we went on to Brisbane. We arrived at 0830hrs on the Saturday morning following a long flight from the UK and was welcomed by Keith who showed us to the lounge and produced a map as to where to go (What a top person). He invited us to have some breakfast and then showed us to where we could have a shower. Durning breakfast Keith informed us that our room would be ready in about 20 minutes althought check in is not till 1500hrs (3.00pm.) After breakfast was showen a delightful and most comfort room. On of the thing I forgot to bring was an adpator to charge up laptop but Keith produce a box and found one (What Service) and with the free wireless connection. Breakfast was a buffett style but there was plenty to have with juices, bread, cearels, and fruit with tea and coffee. Keith was willing to help as to where to go and how to get there with bus times etc. All I can say that this was a first class clean and great place to stop.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Rigseismic67
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this place, this is my first 5 star rating and it deserves it. Great room and service by Ree, I liked the bottle of champagne and welcome letter on arrival in our room as well as the port in the living room for a nightcap

Reviews.Title: “An ideal B&B”
Reviews.Author: JDC99
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of friends, we tried Simpson's for our several-day stay in Sydney. We stayed at the Park Hyatt last time we were in town, but were with friends who wanted something a bit more casual, so we gave this a try. It was wonderful. Very kind and attentive owners, who went out of their way to make sure that we had an excellent stay, both at the hotel and in Sydney. The rooms were very comfortable, the public spaces were welcoming and relaxed, and well thought-out (we watched as a couple arrived early in the a.m. after an 18 hour flight and used the special shower available for guests when there rooms are not yet ready). Very nice breakfasts as well. And a location we liked much better than the Central District. Great shops and easy access to everywhere we wanted to go. We look forward to a return stay in January 2011

Reviews.Title: “A different type of luxury”
Reviews.Author: lew2you
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Simpsons for three nights in August. We loved it. While it is not inexpensive for being somewhat removed from the center of town, we thought it more than justified its price with its charm and the great care that the staff gave us. Because it is small, the staff is able to make decisions--we were pleasantly surprised upon arrival to learn that we'd been upgraded to a nicer room. We did not ask for this, and they only did this because there was an extra room--still we liked that such decisions could be easily made. We received what amounts to incomparable personal attention from the staff--each day we were provided with detailed maps and ideas of places in town and at the beaches to explore, and when we had to catch an early flight out one morning the hotel booked the cab and even left a hand printed note in our room to confirm that they had made the booking. There was also a computer free for guest use and breakfast--two things that I think should be included in any good hotel. While a bit out of the way, Potts Point is lovely, and staying there gives you more a sense of staying in a working neighborhood. The walk through the Botanical Gardens is fabulous, so no real harm staying here as opposed to in the Rocks, for example. I would highly recommend staying at Simpsons. I have a hard time imagining anyone not enjoying their stay, unless they were really looking for the pools, gyms etc that comes with luxury high rise places. That is not Simpsons. However, I think personal attention, and care given to the hotel are the real luxurious commodities these days, and that is what Simpsons really does anomalously well.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor - on the button!”
Reviews.Author: Crazysteveb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Simpsons for one night as a treat to celebrate 25 years of marriage. The building is stunning and we were made to feel welcome by Ree who gave us quick guided tour and then advised us that we had been upgraded to a king bedroom. Fantastic! When we got to our bedroom there was a note of congratulations with a good bottle of champagne - thanks Team Simpsons Hotel - it was most appreciated. Good location for a nice walk around the botanic gardens to the opera house, or for a good dinner at one of the many local restaurants. Breakfast is excellent, and it was good to meet Keith and Maria and chat about travels, car rallies and New Zealand. Car parking was no hassle either. We will be visiting again - it is a gem - quaint and unique.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect, classy B&B, in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: simon040
Reviews.Content: The second time we have stayed: many clearly stay there regularly. No surprise. Large clean rooms, beautiful public spaces, and incredibly helpful and charming hosts. On a street with great cafes and restaurants; a few minutes walk from the park around the opera house; a superb stay, and a brilliant place from which to see Sydney. We would highly recommend it. So much better than the average city place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful B & B well located in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: News56
Reviews.Content: Our family of four including two teens stayed at Simpsons for a total of five nights in July. It was perfectly lovely. The breakfast was scrumptious, the beds heavenly, the decor beautiful and relaxing, and the hosts were lovely and genuinely interested in their guests and their travels (if you cared to chat). The hosts went out of their way to ensure our comfort. They even made it possible for us to purchase opera house tickets for our last evening in Sydney. The hotel is walking distance from the Royal Botanical Gardens, the Opera House, the Sydney Harbor Bridge, and the central ferry terminal, Circular Quay, yet it's also located in a quiet upscale neighborhood. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with the friends you always wished you had!”
Reviews.Author: mackiernan
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Simpsons in the past four years so either we are in a rut, or they are doing something right. Of course it is the latter. Staying at Simpsons is like staying with old friends, except none of our old friends have such a wonderful house! As on the last trip, we had the Ellis Rowan suite which is a large room in the front with a balcony on the street. The street noise is minimal. The hotel has wi-fi which worked on my iPhone in the room after Ree gave me the password. Ree and Keith were as friendly and helpful as always with Ree advising us on a Sunday ferry ride. We went to Manly where we lunched at the wonderful new Manly Pavilion restaurant. For dinners we did not stray far from Simpsons as we ate at Lotus, Fratelli Paradiso, and Fratelli Fresh, all of which were excellent. We find only two problems with Simpsons. We Americans can never get used to the hot and cold mixing valves in the bath (thought there was a water shortage). And there is never enough time to sit in the beautiful downstairs library by the fire and read the numerous interesting books!

Reviews.Title: “The best Choice to start a trip through Australia”
Reviews.Author: NorbertFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: Very nice hosts with a plenty of ideas what to do. Great atmosphere, very large and lovely rooms. We come back, be sure. Not only 3 days but a whole week.

Reviews.Title: “A Home for the Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: DBoylan
Reviews.Content: I travel 100 days + annually for over 15 years, and have regular good & consistent experiences in the international 4 & 5 star chain hotels but look out for somewhere different if I can. Sydney is a city by weather and topography that offers the opportunity to enjoy morning and evening walks, and Simpsons of Potts Point facilitates that with a 15 to 25 minute run to most places in the Central Business District. Spacious rooms, a home away from home, owners and staff that care, coupled with a decent breakfast and inclusive internet access if you must. All the restaurants / cafes and a little shopping around the corner in Potts Point, and local convenience stores for personal items or snacks. The House is a gem to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Simpsons - Simply Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Woolooware
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a surprise night away at Simpsons. My wife is particularly fastidious about where she will stay and is a light sleeper. I was somewhat concerned about how our night away might go! I need not have worried as our stay at Simpsons was perfect. Beautiful clean room, great location - an island of solitude close to everything. As my wife said to me after our stay if I had told her before we stayed, that Potts Point was the place to stay she wouldn't have believed me. At Simpsons it is all there, close to the city, the gardens and the nightlife in Kings Cross. So much to do or so little to do - sipping the complimentary port in front of the roaring log fire in the sitting room come library at Simpsons. Even though my wife and I generally sample a different 5 star hotel each year we will be going back to Simpsons again, it is so close to everything but just so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful piece of heritage that felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Magoogrowler
Reviews.Content: Simpsons of Potts Point is a gorgeous heritage B&B right in the heart of Sydney. Reasonably priced for what it offers, it offer individualised comfort more like staying with friends that a big chain experience - even if the chain is high class it cant match the warmth of a stay at Simpsons. From the genorous lounge at the front of the house , with a lovely fire burning and decanters of sherry and port and the complimentary water and juice in the mini fridge to the beautiful original art works around all the walls and antique furniture - it is a very homey experience - the sort of home that one woudl love to own in te heart of Sydney if one were a millionaire. Thanks for a lovely stay and return visit - it is still just as good as it was when I used to stay years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: u8kat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked for the night of our wedding. We are both 34 and found that this was a warm and friendly place to spend the first night of our marriage. We had gone and looked at the different rooms before booking, Ree was very warm, funny and helpful. The rooms are all decorated differently and we booked the room next to the Cloud room. It had a balcony that looked over the front of the property which is tree lined and has some lovely buildings. The front 'drawing' room is filled with very tasteful art books, palnts and leather couches. Internet is available for guests as to is a bathroom to shower in if your room is not ready. We didn't have breakfast yet I did see the backroom where they served and it was bright and from the selections of cereals and jams I could see sure it would be as great as the rest of the facilties.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: kbutterworth
Reviews.Content: It is a nice feeling to arrive back at Simpsons after a day out. It is like coming home. Through the front door and into the lovely sitting room, if you ike, for a complimentary port, or straight up to your room to relax. I enjoyed the opening windows and the leafy views. My room was particularly charming with its tasteful decor. The staff are friendly and pleasant, from the manager to the housekeepers. A short stroll to some excellent restaurants and the experience of a buzzy neighbourhood is a plus. Simple and delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, attractive with charming service”
Reviews.Author: HomeCanberra
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Simpsons, my first time staying in that area rather than Sydney's CBD. It was a beautifully appointed B & B, well located for restaurants, a short walk through parks to the city and in a quiet location. All facilties were clean and attractive. The staff was very accommodating, allowing me to park my car in their driveway whilst I attended an event nearby. I appreciate their courtesy and flexibility. Helen

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the price and something different”
Reviews.Author: Peter-the-eater77
Reviews.Content: Simpsons is a heritage hotel located in the fashionable area of Potts Point. My first impression was of a well run hotel. I was fortunate enough to get a quick look through most of the rooms due to them being vacant when I arrived. The Cloud suite is the best appointed of the rooms I viewed (though I was informed another was also as good) and was spacious and appeared to be comfortable. Having read a previous review where pictures of grumpy judges were referred to I was also interested to see these pictures. I found them and indeed there grumpy in enjoyably comical way which I did not find offensive, but can imagine why some may not like them whilst on a romantic type stay. Perhaps the setting of the judges could be in a better suited room where they could be appreciated? The sitting room at the front center of the hotel is no doubt the best part of the hotel and filled with comfortable vintage furniture, a cosy gas fire, some complimentary fortified wines and some very interesting books. I found myself enjoying this area on more than one occasion to wind down after and hustle and bustle of the Sydney way of life and in fact wish I could have enjoyed it somewhat more. I stayed in a loft apartment which was quite small, but was warm and very quiet with AC. I was not disturbed at any time by outside or inside noise. It had a nice HD tv and was very clean. The installed furniture was very dated being at the end of its lifespan and not really what I would have expected from the reviews I had read of the hotel. It would have benefited from some geniuine vintage furniture. Some of the bedrooms would benefit from some new cabinets being installed so as to not deract from the overall excellent quality of the hotel. I had cane type chairs in the bedroom which I didnt find comfortable. Unfortuntely the bed was hard (and needs replacing) with no real cushioning and I awoke with a dead arm on one occasion. The manager Ree was pleasant and informative regarding the hotel and things to do in Sydney. Breakfast was reasonable for a continental breakfast. I felt that hotel was pitched at couples and singles were not entirely encouraged, perhaps due to the problems that could arise from some with noise and the such. Simpsons is close to several excellent cafes/delis and a short walk to the vibrant nightlife of Kings Cross. I never felt unsafe walking around the area and found the Sydneysiders most friendly and engaging. I observed that people would pick up trash on the street (it was scarce indeed) and took a lot of pride in the beautiful Potts Point area. I all I enjoyed my stay at Simpsons and Potts Point and would definately stay again but would prefer if some things were freshened up including the bed in the loft room.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpfull hostess, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaVaasa
Reviews.Content: The entrance room fragrant with the scent of flowers, personal invitation wishing us wellcome to the city of the world: Sydney. Feeling home at first sight! A nice night in a quiet and airconditioned room after 30 hours flight. In the morning after tasty breakfast we were eager to see, what Sydney has to offer. And it has a lot. Personnel of the Potts Point gave good advice selecting attractions. Location of the hotel was perfect to reach attractions near by, harbour, Opera house and Botanic Garden. A lot of good restaurants were just around the corner. We will always remember friendly and very helpful hostess, especially when we needed a doctor and also when searching for an accomodation for our excursion in Blue Mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Simpson's is stylish, upmarket, chic and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: cathscan
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door we knew we'd hit the jackpot with Simpson's. Impressive from the outside and full of old worldly character within. The gorgeous bubbly Ree, manager extrodinaire, gave us a very warm welcome before showing us around this beautiful hotel. Our room was spacious and tastefully decorated. Enjoyed having the choice of either fresh air with the opened windows, or ducted air-conditioning. Although this hotel is situated in a very cosmopolitan part of town it was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. Everything is in walking distance so important to pack a good pair of walking shoes. Surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques. The walk to the CBD is an absolute treat, taking the scenic route around the harbour via the Opera House, Circular Quay, and eventually into the heart of the city. Our days and evenings spent in Sydney were very full and busy, so we looked forward to nothing more at the end of the day, then coming "home" to Simpsons and settling down to a glass or two of sherry before retiring up to our lovely room for the night. Ree was a wonderful host - i felt like i'd been friends with her for years. She was very helpful, pre-empting our needs, always good humoured and full of fun, and at the same time always the consumate professional. Can't imagine Simpson's without her. Looking forward to our next weekend in Sydney, staying at Simpson's, of course - wouldn't want to stay anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit and we would return again”
Reviews.Author: JDFOttawaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in 2008 then returned for 4 nights in March 2010. As mentioned in previous reviews, the location is perfect for so many reasons: many excellent restaurants, beautiful streets, ideal for walking through the Botanical Gardens to Sydney harbour and the ferry terminal. The owners and staff (Keith, Ree and Marie) are the single most ourstanding feature: friendly, funny, full of great ideas, even for the routing and activity suggestions for our on-going journey. We stayed in dormer room #13 which was bright and spacious. If you are there on a Saturday be sure to go to the Paddington Market (walkable). A tip: by planning ahead and paying in cash you can save on surcharges for using a credit card fees. This charge seems to be common in Australia although we haven't seen it at home (Canada). If we are fortunate to get to Sydney again, we will be back at Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “Very content”
Reviews.Author: FredPuetz
Reviews.Content: The place ist just more than just a hotel. It offers a house full of history, culture and style with generously equipped rooms still breathing the splendor of the past. This - together with hosts who offer you a warm and friendly welcome, always ready to provide you with any usefuk information you might need - made us really feel at home far away from home. Should we ever come back to Sydney, Simpsons will be our advice. There can hardly be a better place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ree's warm hospitality + A cozy B&B = A wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: gchiker
Reviews.Content: First I must apologize for the long delay in writing this review. This was our first visit to Australia for my wife Judy and recently college graduate daughter Jenny. Our stay at the Simpson's hotel in Sydney was our last stop before flying home. This was by far the best B &B we stayed in. We stayed in the family room which was large and beautifully decorated. It is in a great location, walking distance to the botanical gardens, the harbour, The Opera house, and restaurants. Ree is a wealth of information. Our last day, and after a long day of sight seeing, we picked up a cheese platter and bottle of wine and talked Ree into joining us. A great storyteller and sense of humor. We look forward to a return trip to the Simpson.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Gem in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Cheshirekatz
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit so any novelty had worn off. Again we found it excellent in all respects. We had a beautiful individual room with superb service and fantastic local advice. It made our visit to Sydney memorable. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully appointed and historic B&B within walking distance of central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JustAnotherJoe57
Reviews.Content: For a first trip to Australia, I couldn't have asked for better accommodations. Keith, Marie, and Ree made my stay very enjoyable and helped out with my booking day trips around Sydney. I would highly recommend this B&B to anyone. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Drogo888
Reviews.Content: Keith and his colleagues made our time in Sydney so pleasant. We really appreciate the trouble they took to make us feel welcome and comfortable in their beautiful hotel. They made numerous suggestions for things to do and places to eat [Potts Point has great restaurants!]. With only 5 days to try to see everything on our Sydney list, and they helped us make the best use of our time. Moreover, Keith had a great deal of valuable advice about our visit to other locations in Australia, such as Melbourne. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best little spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WordChristchurch
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor usually rate this as the No.1 hotel in Sydney. Itâ€™s not an international five-star hotel â€“ itâ€™s not the Park Hyatt or Hilton: Itâ€™s better. Simpsonâ€™s is one of the grandest old Victorian heritage buildings with stunning stained glass windows, in possibly the best street in Potts Point among the most expensive real estate in the city. Itâ€™s a five minute walk down to Woolloomooloo where Russell Crowe and Nicole Kidman own apartments at the end of the wharf. Then on to the Botanical Gardens; the NSW art gallery and down to the Opera House and Circular Quay. Stand on the footpath outside Simpsonâ€™s and you see the harbour, the city high rise, the Opera House, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the gardens. Back up the street are crammed with classy restaurants, trendy cafes, delis and people doing business lunches. It is such a great area, such a top location and the hotel has the charm and elegance befitting its status. Simpsonâ€™s rates No.1 on Trip Advisor on ratings guests have given them over the years referring to ambience of their historic building (probably unique in Sydney), the cosmopolitan area of Potts Point, the proximity to the city, and the personal effort they try to make guests as comfortable as they can, and for them to enjoy Sydney. Simpsonâ€™s is not perfect -- only half the 14 rooms had big flat screen tv; thereâ€™s no room service â€“ though they will bring you breakfast to your room if you ask; the old decor is not 21st century; but this place is very cool. Their library has two fireplaces, load of books, leather recliners, sofas, sherry and port wine, and a computer with free internet. The location is excellent. The place is run by Keith, Marie and Vanessa. They meet every guestâ€™s need. They are helpful. That genuine professional personal service can not be matched by big hotels. Free wi-fi internet access is a great touch. The neighbourhood has a chic but lived-in feel. Challis Avenue is a spectacular tree-lined street, with gracious and elegant period terraced houses. You could spend all week eating on the street at Fratelli Paradiso, La Buvette or the Sardine Room. The quality of the food and drinks is among the best in Sydney. Simpsonâ€™s is not trendy, sparse, or sterile but it oozes Australian history and possesses beautiful Australian antiques and artwork. There is an unspoken tranquil atmosphere here surrounded by quality furniture in a historic 120 year old house. The lounge-library is an excellent place to retreat after a long day traipsing around Sydney. The warm and sincere hospitality is almost unmatched. I arrived at 8am after an overseas Emirates business class flight. My room was not ready of course but I had use of a bathroom to shower and change in, as well as breakfast (not charged for). It's clear why this hotel is currently No.1 in Trip Advisor's list for Sydney. If you are a bit-old fashioned or romantic, you can not beat a place like this. Ends

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable stay in great location.”
Reviews.Author: TalbotMelbourne
Reviews.Content: While meeting overseas friends in Sydney we stayed at Simpson's of Potts Point. It was a great location with an easy walk to plenty of restaurants and Circular Quay etc. Keith was a great host and very helpful recommending good eating places and finding answers to all our questions. We had a lovely large room on the second floor with a balcony onto the quiet street. The downstairs sitting room is lovely and tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful boutique b&b steps from harbour”
Reviews.Author: jkwNewYork
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at Simpsons -- a gorgeous old residence-turned-b&b with a beautiful guest lounge, sunny dining room (delicious breakfasts) and nicely appointed rooms. Keith, our host, was incredibly helpful and could give information on everything from day tours, transport information, and even where the closes place was to buy a ladies swim suit! I will definitely visit again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old world style”
Reviews.Author: ness1perth
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Simpsons and enjoyed the wonderful style from a bygone era. The staff especially Keith could not have been more helpful. Even going to lenghts of helping freinds of ours who were not guests. Location is wonderful for all those gorgeous little cafes and shops in Potts Point. We'd stay again in a heartbeart.

Reviews.Title: “accessibility and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: janiambo
Reviews.Content: On short notice we were able to get an apartment which had a good view of the city. The kids loved it. Botanical Garden, Opera House, Kings Cross and the CBD are all in walking distance, and we did walk with the kids to these destinations.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel which makes you feel really welcome”
Reviews.Author: faltman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Simpsons a week and had a great time. Not only the hotel was charming and good but the friendliness and advice on what to do of the host and hostess made the stay at Sydney a real fantastic experience. The room and the hotel were in the style of the historical building and therefore very charming and luxurious within the limitations of an old build=ing/ A real germ in a nice part of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “We booked on the basis of the reviews on...”
Reviews.Author: KateAp
Reviews.Content: We booked on the basis of the reviews on here and were delighted to find ourselves in complete agreement! Simpson's is ideally located, is a gorgeous building and, most importantly, has hosts who really put themselves out to ensure you get the best from your experience of Sydney. For a city centre hotel great value for money, we can't recommend highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Can't do enough for you!”
Reviews.Author: victoriakate
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2008 for three nights- really lovely place- feels like home, and all the staff were really friendly and helpful in suggesting things to do. The neighbourhood is nice with a fantastic Italian at the end of the street and some great cafes for breakfast (although Simpsons does do a lovely spread!) More recently, my parents returned to Simpsons and I wanted to arrange some chocolates and wine for their arrival. The staff could not have been more helpful in sorting this out at pretty short notice and my mum and dad loved their gifts.

Reviews.Title: “Keith & his pleasant and efficient staff made our stay feel like we were at home.”
Reviews.Author: Karakolis
Reviews.Content: Everything essential about the hotel was positive and on this, our first trip to Australia, we received all the assistance, care and comfort we could ask for from the staff at Simpsons of Potts Point. The location is also very desirable, since the traveller finds himself or herself far from the downtown bustle, yet conveniently located for both excursions on foot and by public transport. We did feel that the hotel and rooms were ready for some renovation and maintenance, but this observation did not impact our impression of cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DKFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: Simpsons Hotel is located in the charming neighborhood of Potts Point surrounded by excellent restaurants (e.g. Franchelli Fresh). The hotel is an old mansion with the most amazing individual rooms. There is no reception - rather you are met by your hostess upon arrival, (who knows all your names) and who introduces you to the hotel, the surrounding area, transportation, activities in Sydney etc. A very personal place with a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and secluded but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: WimbledonSE
Reviews.Content: It did not quite live up to our expectations as our first encounters were difficult. On arrival late afternoon we asked for a recommendation for a local restaurant. When we explained that we did not eat the recommended Calamari, Ree found it quite impossible to recommend anywhere. The room had no shower gel, it had a shower and no bath, and when the next morning we asked for some we were met with, 'don't you use soap!' The next morning, however, we were also given an orientation session, including restaurants which all turned out to be excellent. The further minus was that our room had 9 paintings of grumpy looking UK Judges, not the most pleasant of surroundings in what otherwise was a very comfortable room. Basic breakfast; juices and prepared fruit were not fresh and there are no cooked options. Fresh fruit was available. Fresh coffee or tea. For a hotel in this category we might have expected fresh coffee and milk in the room, but this was just instant. Otherwise a good quality hotel. Quiet, comfortable and secluded yet close to excellent restaurants. After the initial strange encounters we found the manager very helpful, with lots of ideas for visits and happy to make arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome to Australia!”
Reviews.Author: andyian1965
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by the internationally known Paul Archer. Having landed in Sydney from London and totally fed up of travelling and trying to escape the airport we arrived at Simpsons. it is a charming, old (for Oz) truly boutique hotel. It sits in the middle of a quiet road with several bars/restaurants very close by (these turned out to be great for lunch/dinner/end of evening drinks and Stephano at the restaurant opposite was lovely). Although we arrived at breakfast time we were enthusiastically welcomed in by Ree and shown to a very welcome shower and bathroom. We were then provided with coffee and an instant itinerary for our first day in Sydney. Our room was ready before we set off and this was really very nice. A large airy room at the front of the house and overlooking the street. Large bathroom with shower and jacuzzi bath with endless hot water & good quality gels, towels etc. The bed was large and very comfortable. We spent 3 very pleasant nights there and later met Marie and Keith. Keith provided us with lots of travel tips to other parts of Oz that we were visiting and these all turned out to be excellent. All the staff were very friendly, kind and helpful. Breakfast is served in conservatory with a good buffet selection for such a small hotel. Particularly enjoyed the boiled eggs and vegemite soldiers! I don't remember the name of the guy who served us but he was also very friendly. Must not forget to mention the lovely lady from Santiago whose poor family were caught up in the earthquake. There is a very cosy but large lounge with sofas, papers, books and internet access. I would highly recommend this place. Whilst within walking distance of the Opera House it is quiet, relaxing and unique. Many thanks to all of you at Simpsons, Drs Andy Morris & Ian Stoddart, High Easter, Essex, Uk.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally helpful and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: s2art50
Reviews.Content: Staying in this outstanding hotel genuinely enhanced our first trip to Sydney. The location is perfect for those who don't mind a pleasant stroll into the city, and there are excellent restaurants and shops close by. But, best of all, the service! We were greeted personally on arrival and waved off with a hug on departure, and we always felt we were genuinely honoured guests. Recommendations for restaurants and day trips were matched exactly to our needs and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: A beautiful house in a great neighbourhood with easy access to the botanical gardens. I really like my room, spacious clean and comfortable. The place itself feels a little bit like a museum - loads of antiques, furniture and books so carefully arranged that I didn't really feel like hanging out in the communal areas and neither did anyone it seemed - a constant hush in the house and whispers at breakfast and this of course will suit some. Breakfast was adequate, nothing more. So a very decent (quite pricey) B&B, in a good location with a very comfortable night's sleep but lacking a bit in atmosphere..

Reviews.Title: “Oh so comfortable. Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: mikeholland2000
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Sydney. It is right in the thick of things to do, where you can walk to just about anything in town. A few doors away are great little eateries, and the nightlife of Kings Cross, while the other way is a beautiful stroll through the Botanical Gardens. Breakfast was simple yet wonderful. Nice pot of fresh coffee or tea, juice, cereals. etc. The hosts, Rees and Keith were extremely helpful, offering up guidance on walks, sights to see, places to eat, how to get about town on public transit, etc. Our room was on the top floor, but not a problem. The air conditioning was amazing and very quiet. We highly recommend this place, as do a lot of other people from the looks of the reviews here. We hope to be here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: gs_tsp
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy to have found this little hotel during our honeymoon in Australia. The staff and owners were wonderful, the location was perfect and all in all it was just so much better and so full of character compared a big, anonimous even if luxurious hotel. The building is beautiful and located in a peaceful and quiet area even though king's cross is just outside the door. There are plenty of excellent restaurants and pretty much anything else you could need within walking distance. In fact I can't thing of anything negative to say. If it is not fully booked and you can find a room go for it you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful and cosy place in a dynamic city”
Reviews.Author: lavdaar
Reviews.Content: The Simpsons is a delightful, small and stylish hotel in a historic city centre from which any trip into or outside town can easily be made. After an exiting day or enjoyable evening it offers comfort for body and mind.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in the best - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Parisannie35
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Simpsons and each time we enjoy it more. The place has such a welcoming feel about - you feel as if you are coming home. Ree the manager is wonderful and makes the place even more special. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great part of Sydney, with friendly and warm hosts”
Reviews.Author: canberrajohn
Reviews.Content: What a find!! We enjoyed our stay in this interesting and beautifully decorated hotel. The room was large and the the contintental breakfast was plentiful and a good assortment to choose from. The location was excellent and we could walk to most places or we caught the train from the nearby station. We could also park our car at the hotel, which was secure at night. The hosts were extremely warm, friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay at Simpons again on our Sydney trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very homely and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: XXXAsia
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights en route to New Zealand. Very friendly and comfortable, nice neighbourhood, conveniently located near restaurants & the wonderful Botanical Gardens (well worth a long stroll through to the Opera House). NB Its on a steep hill so not for the unfit. Tip: We had best steak of our trip at Kingsleys on Finger Quay (10 min walk there but uphill back!) but its so popular you need to book in advance for a table on the terrace which Dee will do for you. NB We found eating out in Sydney very expensive so if we were to spend longer would probably opt for a serviced apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BobFromTN
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a unique and glowing review of The Simpson's but the past reviewers are all correct. There is no need to add too much. I don't have one thing negative to say and all other details provided by other reviewers are spot on. Super, super way to start our 2 weeks in Australia. Ree was sensational as well as Jessica in the kitchen. Friendly and helpful. Very quiet with good showers and A/C. We too arrived at 7am and we were lucky to have our rooms ready. Ree told us to take a shower and then meet down for breakfast. My wife was thrilled and Ree made me look good! We found the location to be great and, if we didn't want to walk to/from our destination, a $10-$15 cab ride was all you need from anywhere in the wharf area in Sydney. Thanks again for a great stay and we look forward to staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Slice of Sydney Life”
Reviews.Author: choosyhampshire
Reviews.Content: All the recently posted comments are entirely valid. The rooms, the location, the helpfulness of the hosts and the very enjoyable breakfast are all part of its charm. The location can be seen as both a plus and a minus. Its not quite central Sydney, but it is an authentic neighbourhood and gives you a real flavour of Australian life, particularly as in our case this was our inital stop on our first trip to Australia. The walk to Circular Quay across the park is great, however the return journey with a long and steep set of steps is challenging on a hot day. The alternative is to use the 311 bus from the end of the road to Circular Quay (Gresham Street) Aus$3.30 one way. You can get the tickets from the convenience store on the corner (and I think on the bus at weekends). The restaurants at the end of the road were all good although they seemed pretty expensive to us at the time. Since then we have found that the cost of eating out in Australia to be a fact of life, and does not seem to vary between rerstaurants as much as in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Hounsfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at Simpsons on our honeymoon and couldn't fault it. We arrived late, and found a handwritten note waiting for us and everything we needed. In a 7 night stay, we were given three bottles of complimentary Champagne and chocolates. The attention to detail with everything was first class. It's the only hotel where I've had to ask for bolt cutters (to get into a bag with a lost key), and they were there with a smile in moments. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms and found it spacious and comfortable, with everything we needed. We then upgraded to the Cloud Suite, which was beautiful. But the most amazing thing about the place was the dining room and lounge, with its period furniture, free internet access and free port and sherry. Great! The most important thing though was the welcome. It's one of the friendliest places we've ever stayed. The owners, Keith and Marie, and the manager, Ree, make time to speak to everyone over breakfast and we were made to feel special. Keith especially was full of great tips and ideas for things to do in Sydney. One of the lovely things is that its location is perfect. It's a short walk to Circular Quay, but moments from the buzz of King's Cross. Potts Point is a fabulous spot and we ate out three nights at restaurants at the top of the road. Three different restaurants, three very different menus, three top notch meals. We'd return in a heartbeat. Keith, Marie, Ree, save us - it's cold here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful house and hosts.”
Reviews.Author: Ulysses123
Reviews.Content: The house is a beautiful reminder of another era, and the breakfast (especially the rhubard compote) in the cheerful breakfast room makes for a good start to the day. The hosts could not have been more helpful. The location is a 10-15 minute walk to downtown, but the area itself (Potts Point) has good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PrinceyManchester
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at Simpsons on our honeymoon. Great location for sightseeing and good restaurants and Keith was extremely helpful giving out maps and advising on the best places to go. We had a late flight out of Sydney but we were able to leave our bags at the hotel and even come back and have a shower before going to the airport - very helpful service. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “An oasis - beautiful, calming and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: pinkkatieb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons for three days in December and can't thank them enough for what they did for us. My girlfriend had been sick on the long haul flight into Sydney and it had been a bit of a nightmare. When we arrived after hours at Simpsons, not only was out room beautiful and cool with clear instructions on how to get to it, but Ree (the live in manager) was absolutely superb. I phoned to see if we could get some plain food and she immediately came and looked after us, providing us with toast and vegemite and making sure that we were ok. This kind and caring approach continued for our entire stay - we ended up staying an extra night. We felt totally looked after and felt secure that they would be happy to help us if we had an emergency. We would both highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Other than the specific situation we had, which they dealt with superbly, the hotel is gorgeous. It is spacious and beautiful - the photos on its website just don't do it justice. It is also in a fantastic location - Potts Point is great. Lots of cool shops and places to eat/drink and it is also within walking distance of the opera house through the Royal Botanical Gardens. Really great. We would definitely stay there again should we ever be back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A period treasure”
Reviews.Author: JJG57
Reviews.Content: A charming, tastefully-furnished heritage guest house with generously proportioned rooms and a lovely common sitting room at the front of the house. Perfectly situated to access Sydney's main attractions. Thoughtful hosts a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Relaxing and Private”
Reviews.Author: jokarAustralia
Reviews.Content: Thankyou to Keith for your kind assistance and providing us with a beautiful room at such short notice. We thoroughly enjoyed our short one night parents escape night. We got absolutely what we wanted which was quiet and privacy. Loved that we could arrive, open the front door, grab our room key without even havent to see anyone. Felt like walking in to our own home. Breakfast was lovely and we also very much appreciated our late checkout - dont remember the last time we got to stay in bed until nearly lunchtime!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located,"A Grand Duchess" of a hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: KazzaEastbourne
Reviews.Content: Third visit to Sydney and everytime we discover something new. Have stopped previously in Darling Harbour and Rose Bay.This hotel is handy for the Bontanical Gardens and Circular Quay. The surrounding area is full of good restaurants and bars and prices more economical than the main tourist spots. Staff excellent and only happy to provide any information you require. Rooms individual and comfortable.Large Hotels in Sydney lack the personal touch. Love Sydney and this Hotel is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time with old fashioned values”
Reviews.Author: Poshminchella
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome was given to us and the customer care was excellent.
