All the staff were very friendly and accommodating and made you feel at home. the hotel is old fashioned and takes you to bygone years which is a changed to the modern hotels we see nowadays. the hotel is ideally situated and everywhere is within walking distance. The only thing was that we thought it was a little on the expensive side although we usually stay with friends in Sydney so are not sure what other hotels in that area charge. Having said that we would certainly recommend Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “UNIQUE!”
Reviews.Author: Birderswidow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is uniquely comfortable and homely due to the management who go the extra mile to ensure that your stay in Sydney is memorable. Spotlessly clean, decorated in a style appropriate to the age of the building and conveniently located [bus stop and metro station are near by and central quay/Opera House a walk away across the Botanic Gardens]. We now have family in Sydney and would certainly stay here again when we return, although I have to say that for the price I would expect a cooked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hospitality, breakfasts, and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: inseineClearLake_Mn
Reviews.Content: Restored 1892 gem..wonderful staff, great breakfasts, convenient location, and comfortable accomodations..you'll like it

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel,staff,room and position”
Reviews.Author: oztoloz
Reviews.Content: The welcome was sincere, and during our stay the staff were always friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Our room was lovely and very peaceful. The location was in walking distance of the bridge,botanics and centre of the city. Excellent. The taxis passed the door and the local bus was at the top of the street.Restaurants and laundry all very close. We are pleased to have found Simpson's

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: BiomanDorset
Reviews.Content: Whilst Simpsons is a beautiful house, with superbly appointed public rooms, it did not live up to the standard described by other reviewers, nor the hotels own website. The breakfast was the most indifferent and underwhelming experience in 5 weeks touring Australia, NZ and the Far East. Indeed, although we had paid for a breakfast nothing was offered to us on the morning of our departure at 6.00 a.m. No tray was offered, nothing packed was supplied (as we saw other travellers had at the airport) and indeed Ree merely said to us the night before we left that there was orange juice in the room fridge which we could use. Considering the cost of staying at Simpsons, to which is added a Credit Card charge - the only hotel or B&B that did this - plus the quoted price does NOT include GST makes this hotel an expensive experience compared with what else is on offer in Sydney. Its saving grace is its ambience and location. Additionally, there was no assistance upon arrival or departure with suitcases, something of a disadvantage when you are on the top floor!! Overall, a disappointing experience which, with just a little effort, could have been a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: fathenry
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel for six days as a base for a visit to Sydney. It is situated 1.5 miles away from Central Quay after a walk across the Botanical Garden, useful for ferries to Manly and Watsons Bay etc. The hotel is situated near to a number of very busy restaurants at the top of the the road and there are further eateries in the adjacent Kings Cross area.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Tampatraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Simpsons for two weeks during my first visit to Australia, and don't think I could have picked a better place! The hotel is within walking distance to all of Sydney's major attractions - The Opera House, Botanical Gardens, Museums - while still offering a quaint escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The home is beautiful and clean, and the rooms are a perfect size for short or long stays. Even better is the fact the staff makes you feel more like family than a visitor. I would definitely recommend Simpsons to anyone traveling to Sydney, and look forward to returning sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “The Simpsons really delivered on hospitaltity and service”
Reviews.Author: klwrcl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Simpsons at Potts Point and the hospitality and service were excellent. We stayed almost a week and the staff consistently created a friendly and supportive atmosphere. The room was large and comfortable and always very quiet and easy to sleep. The recommendations for local restaurants and sites were accurate and the location of the hotel makes access easy. Ree and Jesse were always ready with a smile and encouragement. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: skybluewater
Reviews.Content: We spent the beginning of our vacation in Sydney at Simpson's Potts Point and what a welcome place to call home for a few days. Ree and Jesse are wonderful hosts. We felt at home immediatlely. The location was wonderful....lots of quaint spots to eat and cute local shops. An easy walk to the botanical gardens and the Quay. The morning breakfast was delicious and plentiful and Jesse makes excellent coffee. We look forward to the next time we visit Sydney and can stay at Simpsons! Thanks Ree and Jesse.....

Reviews.Title: “More like a homestay than a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rory K
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel from the favorites list on the Tripadvisor website. On arrival we were somewhat surprised as the property is not really hotel-like at all but more like a large private house - and this is the manner and sentiment with which it is run. The building is historic in terms of Australian architecture and the rooms (which are spacious and more like suites) are comfortable with a pleasant belend of old world charm and modern conveniences. Think (very) up market B&B rather than a traditional hotel format. Thus apart from the good in-house light breakfast served each day as part of the room tariff, you have to eat out. Ditto for laundry and dry cleaning. That said, on the same (very quiet) street there are at least three good restaurants and a dry cleaners/laundry with more of both on the main road. Staff/proprietors very very helpful and managed to get my internet access problem sorted out quickly - note internet is free, unlike many Sydney hotels that can charge quite heavily. The location (Challis Avenue in Potts Point) is outside central Sydney but well connected by either taxi or train from the nearby (10 min walk) Kings Cross Station. While Kings Cross itself is not an upmarket area, Potts Point certainly is with excellent restaurant choices and an atmosphere a little like Greenwich Village for those who know New York. Perhaps not the ideal choice location-wise for a business trip but very good for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Well earned reputation”
Reviews.Author: Oz2009
Reviews.Content: Ideal location. Welcoming staff. Clean if somewhat small rooms but wonderful ambiance within common areas, this hotel has a well earned reputation and value to match.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we took note of the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: amateurreviewer
Reviews.Content: This was our introduction to life in Sydney and we are so pleased we chose here to get over our jet-lag at this B&B. Simpson's is an absolute gem and if you like staying in an elegant house with great atmosphere and people, don't miss this one. We could not have asked for better care, attention, hospitality and kindness. I can add little to all the great reviews, but please feel free to ask questions.

Reviews.Title: “Just as welcoming as ever”
Reviews.Author: Fossil_and_Dither
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Simpsons on and off over the past five years. It's more like being in your own luxurious home, rather than a hotel. You book a room, which will be on one of just three floors (ground, first and second) and have breakfast in the large sunroom at the back of the house. Over the years the breakfast has remained the same; that's one of the attractions, I do love the rhubarb compote! There's a choice of food available which will set you up nicely for the day. There's a huge comfy loungeroom on the groundfloor with internet provided. In winter, which is when we tend to go, there's a lovely warm fire in the lounge, masses of books to read and lovely music playing. This isn't like your typical hotel with masses of staff. Keith and Marie run Simpsons with the assistance of a few other excellent staff. If you have any questions about how to get somewhere or where to go then Keith and the others are a mine of information. We had no hesitation in recommending Simpsons to friends coming from Britain (who were going to arrive jetlagged in Sydney) and had only four days there. The location is absolutely the best; if we lived in Sydney we'd choose Potts Point. We always walk throught the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House (40 mins or more) but you can catch a bus (?$) or a taxi ($8 -1$12) to the city or catch the train from Kings Cross which is just a short walk away. We have often walked back to Simpsons from the station at Kings Cross (ten minutes at max) late at night and, despite its reputation, the area feels very safe. I should add that Points Pott feels a world away from Kings Cross. It's quiet at night and you'd never think you were in the middle of a big city. The local deli's are fantastic. I don't think you'd need to cook if you lived there. Check out "Fratelli Fresh", "Yellow" and our favourite "Bottega del Vino" - their Nepalese Lentil Soup is out of this world. There's even a Woolworths which is open from 7am to 12 midnight seven days a week.There's are numerous restaurants but book ahead if you want to go to one of the popular ones. But what I like most of all about Simpsons are the Ellis Rowan flower prints. Google Ellis Rowan if you've never heard of her. These flower paintings are utterly amazing and the whole house/hotel is full of them.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Cajonqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in July. We were looking for a small, charming bed and breakfast from where we could explore Sydney. The building is beautiful and is located in a quiet area. We stayed in a dormer room on the 3rd floor. It was very spacious, clean, and first class. Keith met with us each day to help us plan out our day. He has maps and tourist booklets. He also gave us great suggestions. If you do not know Sydney then his guidance is invaluable. We purchased public transportation travel cards at the Sydney airport train station. These gave us unlimited use of trains, ferries, and buses. We paid a little more to get round trip train transportation from the airport to Potts Point (Kings Cross station). We were able to walk from the train station to the bed and breakfast (about half a mile, rolling our suitcases). The location of this B&B is perfect. It is in a quiet area close to restaurants, but it is also very close to the botanical gardens, opera house, Harbour Bridge, and circular quay where you catch the ferry boats to Manly Beach or Darling Harbour. We also walked to museums. It is expensive to stay here, but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's not glitzy, but I'd take charming any day.”
Reviews.Author: peterwt34
Reviews.Content: As I live in Hong Kong, when I travel I try to find unique small hotels of character rather than the usual international chain hotels. Simpsons is one such place. It's like a grand private home with hospitality to match. On the edge of the city, it is located in one of the smartest areas for shopping, restaurants and galleries. It will be my home away from home when I next visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in such a peaceful place within walking distance of Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: SharleneR
Reviews.Content: Simpsons Hotel in Sydney was a great place to stay while my husband and I had a weekend in Sydney. The hotel itself is a lovely looking heritage building with all sorts of interesting nooks and crannies. We had the use of the Cloud Suite which was lovely and very comfortable. We were able to explore Sydney CBD which is within easy walking distance. The staff were most helpful and we would most certainly recommend this hotel to others. We will stay there again when we go to Sydney. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal spot from which to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: rdude
Reviews.Content: Sydney was our first stop on a monthlong tour of Australia and Simpson's was an ideal setting for our family of five, including three small children. From the outset, Rhee was an outstanding ambassador for neighborhood, city, and nation. We found the Potts Point neighborhood to be an island of reality in a sea of tourists. A short stroll to the harbor, center city, or King's Cross, yet a place where one could retreat when the desire to act more like a local kicked in. And what a fine retreat. The house is spectacular; our room was spacious enough for five; the breakfast was plentiful and fresh. If I could change one thing about the hotel, I'd put it a block away from a train station or ferry dock to enable further exploration of the surrounds. There are hotels in locations that meet this description, but they can't match the quality of service or value. There's no question that we would choose this hotel on a return trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “WARM/INVITING/PEACEFUL/CONVENIENT/CLEAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: AMGAWRIT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a close friend booked two rooms here in June. It was lovely and everyone there, more than accomodating. It felt like we had known them for years. It is situated within walking distance of NSW Art Gallery/Opera House/shopping/amazing restaurants. It is the place to stay if you want to experience the real Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful home hosted by wonderful people.”
Reviews.Author: albertmunroscotland
Reviews.Content: The other reviews here can better describe the amenities and location and so forth. I just want to say that our host Keith (in keeping with everybody we were fortunate to encounter in Sydney) was such a kind and helpful person to meet. He went out of his way without his need to do so to help my mother and I enjoy our stay. I have no hesitation in advising anyone to spend some time here. A very big thank you once more to Keith and much success / best wishes to all at Simpsons. For the record, it is such a beautiful building and an ideal location for most people I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Accessible, Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Eug-lad
Reviews.Content: The 8 day stay at the rooms was absolutely amazing. The room was very spacious and comfortable and my wife and I absolutely loved it! We love the location of the place as well as it is very accessible (20min stroll could get you into the heart of the city) and the staffs were quite friendly and very welcoming. The only thing that it lacked was a good scenic view from the windows but a short 10 min walk will do the trick. Defnitely a great place to be with your loved ones!!!

Reviews.Title: “Prior 5 star reviews on T.A. were so right!”
Reviews.Author: fhungolfer
Reviews.Content: After a 15 hr. flight, 2 more hrs. through customs, and a 1/2 hr. ride into Sydney, Ree met us at the front door of Simpsons. (Wow - face to face without a counter between.) Any uncertainty we might have possessed instantly vanished. The charm of the neighborhood and Simpson's quaint facade were only exceeded by Ree's big Aussie smile and warm welcome. She ushered us into a perfectly appointed, spotlessly clean, but simple, room. The small refrig was apportioned with cold drinks - no charge. Ree brought hot tea and snacks, then designed a site seeing to-do list for our 1st day out-and-about. That night, we met again in the drawing room... sitting by the fire with desserts and sherry... very pleasant way to get the jet lag out of one's head. We felt part of Sydney versus the typical tourist who views at a distance from a cookie cutter, impersonal hotel room. We met Keith and Maryie, the owners, the next day over breakfast. (Wait until 8:30 after the other guests leave and you have this delightful couple to yourself for always intriguing conversation.) Keith became known as AK for 'Ask Keith.' He simply had all the answers. Maryie, always informally elegant, served us a gritty, french pressed coffee that we grew to enjoy much more than the smooth, filtered java served in the US. If you want to feel like you are coming home to family after a long absence, Simpsons is your place. Some suggestions: 1) Planes cannot land before 6 a.m. so they hit all at once in the morning. A later flight avoids some of the crush. 2) Pack 1/2 the clothes and have them laundered at the corner of Challis and McCleah. 8 bucks for a large load. 3) Yellow Restaurant has the best desserts, Potts Wine Store the best prices. 4) Sappros is great for lunch; Opium Den very loud 5) Skip the opera house restaurant for the Custom House Restaurant. 6) The Sydney Art Museum, free, is far better than the Aquarium, $38A a person. 7) Few establishments accept travelers' checks. 8) The best money exchanges are near the Victoria Building. 9) Aust. is rightfully serious about confiscating foodstuffs brought into the country. Research the Aussie quaranteen before entering. 10) Be sure to book the Hunter Valley wine tour. Richard is a wine genius. Book him before he justifiably raises his rates above the $150A we would have paid for the drive alone. 11) Finally, WE NEVER HEARD ANYONE SAY, "G'DAY MATE."

Reviews.Title: “Exquisitely-restored Victorian with eclectic artwork in an elegant setting”
Reviews.Author: BDN34
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend at Simpsons while in transit from Adelaide to San Francisco. The rooms and common areas are eye-poppingly beautiful with lavish artwork and furnishings. Hidden gems lurk around every corner (look for the Norman Lindsay letter and drawing in the ground-floor living room, along with a wonderful French map of terra australis circa 18th century). There are lovely cafes, shops, and restaurants in the area (Yellow Cafe & Fratelli Fresh are our favorites), and there are also quiet walks and sunrise viewpoints in the the Elizabeth Bay neighborhood. The location in Potts Point is an excellent jumping-off point for walking tours of the botanic gardens, city center, and ferry trips from Circular Quay, all of which are pleasant and comfortable twenty- to thirty-minute walks away. The owners and staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and full of ideas for exploring the city. Simpsons is a lovely property and a destination B&B in one of Australia's most vibrant and diverse cities. Highly recommended for first-time and return visitors alike!

Reviews.Title: “How peaceful and elegant................”
Reviews.Author: chocolatefriend
Reviews.Content: What a slice of heaven to rest in............we spent three comfortable nights in a king size bed and there is an amazing plasma that just folds out from the wall at the flip of the remote. A lovely balcony from room 7 is facing the street that would be beautiful in the right weather. (Don't be over 5' and expect to fit in the bath though) We made it to breakfast once and the rhubarb, thanks Maire, was to die for ! Great variety of breads and juices. Other lovely touches were the compilmentary soft drinks and water in the mini bar and of course the port and chocolates downstairs by the fire at night. Simpsons is a stunning lovingly restored house with magnificent hosts. Ree couldn't be more helpful ensuring you go to the best places to eat...........try "Yellow" just up the street around to the left and you must to go Fratelli Fresh above Woolworths up the street and to the right. Heaps of Delis nearby and if you want to venture to the Cross you can but plenty to eat this end ! Try Bounce Walking tours for a great guided walking tour of the area. Keith went out of his way to track them down and so with great owners and hosts this stay was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ElaineBu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a Superior room, but from what we could see all were of a very high standard. A continental breakfast is served in the conservatory and is very good. Great location only a 20 minute stroll through the beautiful Botanical Gardens to Circular Quay and its many attractions. A special thank you to Ree for making us feel so welcome in every aspect. We would love to return again one day.

Reviews.Title: “A great introduction to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMartha
Reviews.Content: Keith, Mary and Ree greeted us so warmly that we felt like we were family. When we arrived in Sydney at 7 a.m., our room was already open and they let us in to freshen up before setting out for our first day. Keith gave us many great tips on seeing the city and the area around Sydney. Our room -- the "family room" -- was spacious, and the breakfast buffet was fantastic. We couldn't get enough of the French press coffee. The location was perfect for walking or taking the train into the city. We spent three nights at Simpsons, then returned for one night after venturing north. I had my doubts about traveling so far back into the city for just one more night, but I'm really glad we did. Keith and Mary also told us great stories about Sydney. They have an amazing wealth of friends and history in the city. One last note -- I was a little apprehensive about the location because I had heard bad things about Kings Cross, which is the nearest train station. Although Darlinghurst road has a lot of seedy joints, we never felt unsafe anywhere. A walk up Victoria, instead of Darlinghurst, felt miles apart. Great restaurants, cafes and shops.

Reviews.Title: “fabulously nurturing with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: 4change
Reviews.Content: i loved my time at Simpsons: it is in a word perfect. Ree is a fabulous host, and that is how it felt, that we were being hosted by her. She went out of her way to make us feel at home. The common rooms at Simpsons are glorious, and very welcoming. i love the fires burning, the cosy chairs, and the graceful, large and bright bedroom that served as a study as well. This has to be the best place i have ever stayed: i hesitate to say hotel, because that image conjures up cool, impersonal spaces. Simpsons is a home away from home, and a beautiful one at that. Thanks Rees and your marvellous staff. i will be back (and so will Bill). You have spoiled me for the other places!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small, caring, personal hotel; wonderful private experience”
Reviews.Author: Ossiman
Reviews.Content: My beautiful Partner and I spent a night at Simpsons in one of their larger rooms fronting Challis Avenue. From the moment we arrived until we checked out the ambience was excellent and the service unobtrusive and excellent. A booking mix-up meant we weren't given the room of choice but the staff were more than accommodating and provided us with little extras in our room. The breakfast area is convivial and the selection adequate for our purposes. I rate the property highly and the ambience and style of the Hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place to stay in sydney!”
Reviews.Author: DnB27
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Simpsons for 4 nights in early May. We arrived very early in the morning after a long flight, and found that our room was all ready for us, at no additional charge! This was so wonderful after a long flight! The room was nice with a pleasant little patio and comfy bed. We loved breakfast in the morning, lots of fresh foods to choose from in a pretty greenhouse room, and the common area had comfy couches and a computer with internet free to guests. Keith was kind enough to spend an hour talking to us about the things to do and see in Sydney, including ferry schedules and even hand-drawn route maps for city walks and trips to the many beaches. Simpsons is also located in a great part of Sydney, with nice restaurants right nearby, quiet but close enough to the downtown--and the walk into the center of town is through the beautiful botanical gardens, where we watched the birds every morning and evening as we walked to and from town. While staying at Simpsons, we were told by another couple, who were frequent visitors to Sydney, that we were staying at the best place in town! It was such a great start to our trip up the coast!

Reviews.Title: “Old style hospitality and class in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: dozark
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at Simpson's and loved the location! Potts Point is like Lincoln Park in Chicago - great restaurants and yet is close enough to walk to Sydney's major attractions. In addition Ree made great recommendations of restaurants in the area. Simpson's has a wonderful, intimate feel - You do not feel like a visitor! Loved the crumpets in the morning and sherry and port in the evening! We were amazed at how quiet and comfortable the rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “Keith couldn't have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: OD
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful restored mansion in the very safe upscale neighbourthood of Potts Point near the CBD. We walked to the Botanical Gardens and the NSW Art Gallery, both of which were wonderful and worth an entire day each, if you have the time. A block away from the Simpson was a nice street with art galleries and many fine restaurants. But where we were it was very quiet, and we slept well at night even with our patio doors open. We stayed in #5 the Challis Room. It was a bit pricey, but we had a very large room and a sitting area. It also had a small patio/balcony which was lovely. We sat out and had a drink before dinner, or just relaxed after walking all day. I even hung out a wet bathing suit to dry over one of the chairs out there, because no-one could see in; it was so private. The only small quibble I had was that the bathroom floor was always slippery. It was impossible to have a shower and not have the water leak out all over the floor, and the summery climate being quite damp and steamy, things it didn't dry very fast. The towels didn't dry, but we were supplied with new ones whenever we needed them. For the price, I thought they might have served hot items for breakfast, but there was a good selection of cold things to eat. But then, my husband is very devoted to his bacon and eggs, and not everyone wants that these days. Very much recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simpsons of Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: miamiguy607
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Simpons Hotel during Mardi Gras in Sydney...The place was fantastic...very well located, great neighborhood....the decor was superb, the rooms are spacious and well equipped, the breakfast was very good, but the most remarkable aspect of my stay was their hospitality... Keith, Marie, Ree and the chilean lady were so attentive...they made my stay unforgetable...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: curlyscot77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Simpsons of Potts Point was fantastic. The room was lovely and spacious, even if a little pricey! Staff were friendly and helpful. Location was superb if you want to be out of the city centre, but still be within walking distance to all main attractions. We walked to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The Harbour Bridge Climb was our main reason to visit and it was a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: juddyray
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Simpsons. We stayed in a dormer room and if we had it to do over, we would take a more upscale room. Staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home from home”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterBilly
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at Simpsons during a recent trip and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I was travelling on my own and was a little concerned about feeling lonely far from home but I need not have worried about the Sydney leg of my trip. The staff at Simpsons were an absolute delight and the wonderful manager Ree deserves a special mention. Nothing was too much trouble for her and she made me feel very relaxed and at home. It was my first time in Sydney and I fell in love with the place. The location of Simpsons was perfect for me and Potts Point has just the sort of atmosphere I like best. Excellent restaurants, a well stocked supermarket, clothes shops, delis etc were all a stones throw away. I will certainly stay there again on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the most beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: MKBB
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights at Simpsons and thought it was an ideal spot. Small hotels appeal to us more, but Simpsons provided all the amenities of a larger place but with more charm and better service. The owners could not have been kinder or more helpful, even allowing us to shower in an extra bathroom before we headed off on the long trip home. Potts Point is a fascinating area with loads of galleries, shops and restaurants yet you can walk to Circular Quay if you want. I certainly recommend Simpsons if you like an intimate setting.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Boriqueno
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Australia, I wanted to stay in a place where I could interact with "Aussies" in a relaxed and familial environment. I read many positive reviews of the Simpsons and decided to try it out. My best decision regarding lodging and I spent a lot of time comparing places in and around Sydney. The place is immaculate and the rooms outstanding (we stayed in two different rooms). The family room/library was very homey and it gave me the opportunity to meet and chat with other visitors to Australia. It is conveniently located and in a very quaint area. I was able to enjoy all the sites in downtown Sydney and the Kings Cross area without difficulty. Marie was an absolute delight!! She made my wife and I feel at home from our first encounter. My wife is not a big breakfast eater, but she could not stop complimenting the Simpson for their selection of breakfast items and the nice people that attended to us during the mornings. All in all it was a wonderful experience, the Aussies are marvelous people and that was the first of what we expect to be many visits to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great place wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: RJR4
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable place. A home away from home. Wonderful hosts that really care about your visit and love their city. Bring comfortable walking shoes, you may do a bit, but worth the effort. Nice restaurants nearby and a very good breakfast at the hotel. Great laundry across the street. A little off the beaten track, but worth it for the serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Crawf_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the end of April, were given upgrade on room as not full during our visit. Keith and Ree very helpful, particularly enjoyed the breakfasts. Far superior to the normal multinational hotel. Also, as we had a hire car, parking in the drive was useful and saved on parking charges. Walk to CBD was OK, but my partner found the flight of stairs back to Challis Ave at the end of a days walking a tad fatiguing! Access to PC in lounge helped us keep in touch with home. Would be happy to stay again. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: GrampsNY
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful visit at Simpsons At Potts Point. The setting was lovely the staff especially Ree was just great. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Sydney. We travel a lot and this is just a great place to stay. Ross & Joyce Klinck USA

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler197899
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at Simpsons. Keith and Ree went out of their way to accommodate our itinerary -- eg we arrived early in the morning and they invited us for breakfast at no extra charge, stored our baggage, and gave us a place to clean up after the overnight flight. They gave useful advice about what to see, and were very friendly and open. The property is very well maintained, the rooms are large [we were there at the beginning and end of our trip, and stayed in two different rooms, both of which were spacious], and the location is quite convenient -- close in yet in a residential neighborhood with lots of local shops and restaurants. My wife left a sweater behind, and Keith shipped it to us as a courtesy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: buzzsaw09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights in this wonderful hotel. If you want a place that feels like home, (and you are treated like family) this is the place. Rates may be a little higher than some of the big chains, but it is well worth the extra. This was our first trip to Sydney, and the staff was most helpful in getting us settled. Rooms are large and very comfortable. The fresh flowers in the room were beautiful, and they just happen to be my wife's favorite. Will definitely stay here again when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GearoidFitz
Reviews.Content: Myself,wife and two kids stayed in Simpsons in July 2009 as part of a round-the-world trip. Not having been to Sydney (or Oz!) it was a great stay in a wonderful hotel, very intimate and excellent location. Vanessa (one of the management) looked after our two kids (Killian & Aisling) for a few hours one evening, while myself and my wife were able to go out for dinner. The rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. Yes, it's not cheap, but it's not meant to be! You get what you pay for. If were to go back to Sydney, I wouldn't contemplate staying anywhere else. There's a great sitting room, and plenty of books etc. It was fantastic to relax in the evening, after a days walking and sightseeing. Vanessa was excellent in directions and help in getting around. Well done to Simpsons!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old House in Great Neighbourhood with Friendly Hosts”
Reviews.Author: stuartandsue
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our five nights at Simpsons, a nicely restored former mansionhouse in a pleasant neighhood. Recommended by some American friends who stayed last year. We were arriving by car in the evening, and unsure of the exact time, so by pre-arrangement we were given the front door access code and room details, so it could not have been easier. The hosts, Keith, Marie and Ree, were all very helpful with tourist tips, and generally made us feel welcome and at home. The healthy breakfast (fruits and juices, etc) was just what we like to start the day, no hot foods or the stodgy stuff you get in overheated bain-maries !! Our room was very comfortable (rather than luxurious), in the old-fashioned style, medium size, but with all the creature comforts we needed, and a good bathroom with a great hot shower !! The house is nicely furnished, with interesting antiques and art. A few paint chips here and there, but that is what you expect in a 100-year old building. It is full of character and obviously well loved and maintained. We really enjoyed the Potts Point area, with all its restaurants and coffee shops, and the wonderful walk along the water and through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House or the city. A couple of mornings we did this walk through the gardens before breakfast....great exercise !! .. When you consider the complimentary parking, breakfast and computer access (all of which you get charged for in most hotels) we thought it very good value for money, and the nicest place that we stayed at on this trip to Australia. We hope to be back in Australia later in the year, and will certainly stay there again. We would definitely recommend Simpsons to those wanting something smaller and more personal the usual big chain hotels, but with everything needed to create a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's best-kept secret”
Reviews.Author: ahd1
Reviews.Content: Simpson's is a small hotel hidden away in one of the most picturesque parts of Sydney. In terms of location it has the lot - easy access on foot (if you're fit) to parks, Art Gallery, city shopping and also to the water. We've stayed there three or four times now, most recently in mid-April 2009. The dormer rooms are squeezy but nice, good value for money given the location. Perhaps a little attention is needed to details eg. missing letters in names on doors. The service is friendly and excellent and the downstairs library full of informative material. We feel at home at Simpson's immediately we check in. We are always sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great homely feel”
Reviews.Author: lorriemarchington
Reviews.Content: The great thing about Simpsons is the personal service, as well as the wonderfully comfortable rooms, as well as.... we really loved the place. The breakfast was good, the location was good as the area feels villagey - we ate in Macleay Bistro and had a wonderful meal. It was an enjoyable walk across to circular quay, or through Kings Cross to the station. Wonderful stay, and will book again when next in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “A unique perspective on Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Boontonite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at Simpson's in March, 2009. It was an excellent stay and provided a very different feel than typically experienced at a big hotel in the city center. The owners and head staff were personally involved, very friendly and helpful. They even surprised us with champagne and chocolates waiting in the room one night when we returned home, aware that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The property itself is a big old mansion, beautifully maintained and decorated. Our room, at the front of the house on the second floor, was very spacious with a fireplace and large balcony which was particularly enjoyable. The Potts Point neighborhood has a lot of character with plenty of dining and nightlife options in the immediate vicinity, only a pleasant 15 minute walk from the city center. Staying at Simpsons, it felt more like we lived in Sydney than just passing through, which was nice. The property is a little expensive but provided high quality for the money. Overall, a stay at Simpson's is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Simpsons!”
Reviews.Author: paularcher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Simpsons for 11 days for Mardi Gras in 2009. I was thrilled with this hotel. The room, breakfast, gorgeous decor and generous, friendly hosts were just superb! I especially loved the proximity to Andrew Boy Charlton Pool and all the nearby cafes and venues. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone used to a high standard of accomodation and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: LTVL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpons for 5 nights 3/18-22 and 3/26. Greeted by Ree after a long trip from Hawaii. She was very friendly and professional! We we traveling with our 8 yr old daughter so we had a king and a twin. (#8 upstairs) The room was large and bathroom was nice size-stocked and very clean. I think the price is a little on the high side but it is a small boutique style accomodation in a great part of town. The whole mansion has been restored and It is charming and the location is perfect! Close enough to CBD but also far enough away from hussle & bussle. Potts Point is very hip and happening! Great places to eat and views to die for. Head down steps to Woolloomooloo Wharf and hop on/off City Sightseeing bus for overall look at city-or walk thru Botanical Gardens just to see the bats. We loved Siena Marina right after the sun sets to see all the bats flying from The Domain..amazing! Harry's Cafe de Wheels for a meat pie at the wharf is a must. There are great eats right outside Simpsons-Fratelli Paradiso and Arun Thai on Macleay were very good. Coffee across the street is great for people watching..and Fratelli Fresh is great too! Right on Macleay St is blue&blue laundry which is reasonable for wash,dry & fold. Highly recommend Simpsons if you like to be out of the 'tourisy' area and in a small hotel environment. We met great people at breakfast and couldn't have been more happy with our stay! Aloha to Keith, Ree, Jesse and Belinda! What a trip! The Lange Ohana

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience ....”
Reviews.Author: Jas380
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I ever stay in ,the location the helpfulness of the owners and all the staff truely make this a wonderfully warm refuge to come home to after busy days sight seeing and exploring the city ,I visit Sydney often and always choose to stay at Simpsons , Traveling the world on a regular basis I consider this type of a haven to be extremly hard to find in most large international cities ,The location is brillant ,far enough away from the city but still in the heart of everything , I look forward to the start of the day here as breakfast is brillant ,a full selection of fruits ,yoghurts ,breads ,preserves,and juice ,eggs , Another thing I enjoy about this hotel are all the cafes and resturants that are all in the same street ,They have great food and are open late ,makes life very easy You couldnt find nicer hosts than Marie and Keith ,extremly helpful and very careing I consider this hotel great value for money ,and would only ever stay here in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: To all the readers, if you are choosing this hotel know that you are booking a boutique style hotel that is smaller and doesn't necessarily have what a 5 star luxury hotel would have. What you are paying for at this hotel is the impeccable service; any request within reason is met with extreme promptness. I stayed in two different rooms during my 7+1 day stay here in Sydney with the biggest difference being the flat screen TV in one room and a 13" CRT in the other. Apparently 10 out of the 12 rooms do have flat screens so if you're looking for a better TV in your room, request one that does. I would have liked some premium movie channels with my room but I was out and about for most of the time so this was not that big of a deal. The internet was spotty on my first day of arrival, but that got quickly fixed and it was reliable during the rest of the stay. The continental breakfast is sufficient but those that want a hot eggs & bacon style breakfast will be disappointed. The decor is charming for the most part, though for the fastidious there are some areas that need a little sanding/repainting. Potts Point is definitely a trendy, charming area to stay and the walk through the Royal Botannical Gardens to the Opera House and then the Circular Quay is a nice 20-30 minute stroll. I do wish the price were a little lower as this was the most expensive place for my trip but I stayed during the extremely busy time of Mardis Gras so the prices were reasonable due to the demand and due to the fact that Sydney is a relatively expensive city. All in all I enjoyed my stay and would gladly return the next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lioncity
Reviews.Content: We travelled in Australia for a month. On our last day, we stayed at Simpsons of Potts. On arrival, we were greeted by Keith (owner) who was super warm and friendly. .we immediately felt at home. He showed us around the B & B and helped us up to our room. The B & B is absolutely charrming.. what a gem in a perfect location.. within walking distance to some great restaurants, shopping and to the Opera House. We had to leave after breakfast to catch our flight back to Toronto. For us staying at Simpsons was a fitting end to the memorable trip we had in Australia. We wished that we could have stayed longer but left planning to be back again. Brian & Veronica, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent service but slightly tatty place”
Reviews.Author: JacqLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I only stayed one night at Simpsons and perhaps a longer stay would have made us feel more enthusiastic about it. However, we were a little underwhelmed by our room, what with the price (It's not expensive as such but it's not cheap and we expected a little better) and all the glowing reviews Simpsons gets. Our room was a bit old-fashioned and we didn't much like the colours or the furniture (I know that's just a matter of personal taste though) and a couple of things were off; for example the light switch in the bathroom was hanging off, the windows rattled a bit in the wind, and the bathroom was cramped and toiletries strange (body lotion but no shower gel) and in tiny bottles. Someone else on this site has mentioned similar small minus points and then said that they don't matter because you'd overlook them if you were staying with a friend. I'd say to that though that you don't normally pay to stay with a friend! On the plus side the bed was huge and very comfortable with nice linen, the room was large and had comfy chairs and a sofa, they have free wifi in the rooms, and the minibar contains complimentary soft drinks, water and fruit juice as well as teabags and coffee, although only instant coffee as far as I remember. HOWEVER, the hotel has some really lovely aspects. The most striking is how personable, hospitable and lovely Keith is. He rang us when we arrived (he was off-site as it was late) to make sure we were OK and see if we needed anything, and at breakfast the next day he came over, addressed us by name and was chatty, courteous and charming. He seemed to know all the guests' names and chatted easily to everyone. When we came to leave he called a taxi for us, helped us out to it with our bags and waved us off like old friends. Breakfast is billed as 'continental', which sometimes means in my experience a bit mean and basic, but Simpsons breakfast is gorgeous. Cereal, yoghurt, a selection of fresh and canned fruit, nuts and seeds (very nice touch!), hard-boiled eggs, breads, muffins and crumpets to toast and various jams, sliced cheeses and cold meats. Coffee was excellent and delivered very quickly by a friendly waiter. You eat in the conservatory, which is beautiful, as is the guest drawing-room. So all in all I would go back to Simpsons or recommend it to a friend for the friendly welcome, the gorgeous breakfast, the generous complimentary drinks and the building itself. What would make me hesitate to be really enthusiastic about it is that I found it a little overpriced for the overall impression I had of our room. By all accounts the Cloud Suite is beautiful so perhaps if I stayed there I'd feel that it was better value. I would go back to Simpsons I think, but they'd have to offer me a very good deal as I think the advertised room rates, and even the deal we got, don't really make this hotel the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HantsFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Sydney for a few days before making the long trip back to England and our stay at Simpson's couldn't have been better. I had booked it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and from my first contact with the owners was impressed with the very friendly and helpful service. We were travelling with our 2 small children 6 and 20 months and they immediately felt right at home using the huge Lounge like their own, my daughter was particularly impressed to be able to play on the computer. Both of them loved breakfast time and saying hello to all the other guests. The only downside with small people having to carry a buggy up and down all those steps to Wooloomooloo wharf! The whole visit felt more like staying in a friendly family home than a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “what a welcome”
Reviews.Author: cmsc17222
Reviews.Content: Keith and Marie make you so welcome, perfect location to walk through Botanic Gardens to bridge and harbour area. Hotel relaxed and comfortable, perfect alternative to the big chains but with all possible amenities including a shower and bathroom to use before or after checking in / out., with a left luggage facility so we could spend the day in town for an late afternoon flight also free internet. A wonderful haven to find in a big city, wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Intro to Australia!”
Reviews.Author: Kim54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several nights in January before embarking on a cruise. We chose this hotel because we did not want to stay with the masses of tourists staying around the ship quays--we would be seeing them on the ships. We wanted to get a more local feel of the area. This was a wonderful place to stay!! We were able to check in early after our long flight. Keith then helped us "fine tune" our research. The hotel location is within easy walking distance of the things we wanted to do within Sydney proper. The maps of Sydney make it look huge--but it is very walkable--distances are not that great. A few times we walked to Circular Quay and caught the local ferries to places like Manly Beach and Watson Bay. I was very impressed with the local transportation--and the prices were great!! Vanessa was a great help, too! Her restaurant suggestions were right on! We walked only 1-3 minutes to the restaurants for dinner. Definitely local vibes--how cool! Some of the restaurants let you bring your own wine and the corkage fee is low. There is shopping around the corner from the hotel--everything you need. Also, there is a Chinese laundry across the street that turned our clothes around in four hours for an extremely reasonable price. Simpson's was charming. We were very pleased with our experience. They even had free wireless. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “I wish all hotels were like this......”
Reviews.Author: Londoner29
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Simpsons and would say what a lovely stay. The hotel is an old Victorian building, so all the rooms are different, there are communal areas for all the guests to use, it is very much a home from home. The staff are wonderful, giving great advice and they get to know all the guests using first name terms. The location of the hotel is good, not being directly in the CBD means you get a sense of Sydney as the locals see it, but it is only a brief 15mins walk to the CBD via the Botanic Gardens, so not a bad walk to do every day.

Reviews.Title: “Simpsons- Superb”
Reviews.Author: WORCSCOUPLE
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Australia spent 5 nights in the Cloud Suite at Simpsons of Potts Point. From arrival to departure the whole experience was superb in every way. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “What else to say?”
Reviews.Author: sunny2596
Reviews.Content: I've chosen this lovely hotel based on what I've read in trip advisor before. Once there, I was delighted to the utmost!. I arrived early morning and Keith welcomed me warmly and he instantly provided all important information what to do that early morning until my room was available around lunch time. So even before I could enter my room, I had a great walk along the harbour and in the parks, thanks to Keith. And thanks to Keith's precise inputs which were supported by some sketches I did not miss any spot that morning. Once back, Vanessa made me familiar with my room and I instantly felt home at this lovely place. Since this was my first trip to Australia, I only can say that there is no better "Australian-Opening-Label" than this lovely place with its warm-hearted and caring hosts. I seldom felt myself such comfortable and home after such a short time. Thank you all, Keith, Marie and Vanessa and your staff. Finally I staid at Simpsons a full week and took again some nights on my way back from Melbourne to my home country. So I fully agree with all previous reviews and actually nothing can be mentioned anymore. All has been said and I just could express my great and positive impression as well. It's a great place to stay at a perfect location in walking distance to almost all attractions in Sydney. I was deeply touched and would love to come again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with warm friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: BristolBaz
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to start our Australian trip. The location is perfect. Walk out the door, turn right and there in front of you is the vista of Sydney. A brisk 20 min walk down the hill, past the Warf and through the botanical gardens and you are at the opera house. It was the perfect place to stay. The building is pretty, the inside is tastefully decorated, the rooms are quirky and comfortable and the owners are so helpful they are better than the tourist information sites! Add to that the lovely breakfast with perfect coffee and you have a fantastic B&B. Def recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder they are #1 - they earn it”
Reviews.Author: Brusselscov
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three (16 year old son). We arrived late after 24+ hours of travel and were welcomed by the hotel's annual Christmas Champagne party for friends and neighbors. Our family room was spacious, clean and quiet. Breakfasts were complementary (great feature) and more than adequate. Both Vanessa and Keith were always helpful with tips, bookings, etc. and we felt like Simpson's was our house - including free wi fi! Even after we left, Vanessa helped with restaurant bookings when we returned to Sydney for NYE (no room at the Simpson's Inn so we had to stay elsewhere) and invited us to the hotel's NYE fireworks viewing. We can't say enough positive things about the hotel, Vanessa, Keith, the whole experience. Most highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simpsons is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: clw13
Reviews.Content: With Tripadvisor as our guide we booked a ground floor queen room for 3 nights in early December. From the time we arrived to the moment our cab door closed to take us to the airport, Simpsons was absolute perfection. We arrived early in the morning on Sunday to find Vanessa ready to handle all our travel needs. Our luggage was taken care of, we were given a key to our room (and told it would be ready within a few hours), maps, tips, a bathroom to use and the confidence to go navigate Sydney. Located in a colorful and convenient neighborhood we walked through the botanical gardens and were quickly at The Rocks. Several fine restaurants are just down the street or around the corner and shopping is just as close. For the three days we were there, Vanessa was not only helpful but we quickly felt like old friends. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The breakfast is continental but there are PLENTLY of wonderful choices for every appetite. We truly would not think of staying anywhere else when we return...and we will.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: madmasri
Reviews.Content: I am impressed. This was my first experience in boutique hotel, and I think this a great one to be used as reference for all others! We stayed there for 6 nights (myself, my wife and my sister), where we booked two rooms. We got a large room (Challis Room) downstairs next to the breakfast area, and my sister got a smaller room in the last floor. Service: Great personalized service! Vanessa, our host for most of the days, was great at welcoming us into the establishment as soon as we arrived, and catered to our requests whenever had one, including heaps of useful info about what to do and where to go in Sydney. We arrived very early from Dubai, and Vanessa was able to get us our rooms early so we can sleep off the 14 hours of flight we got into! I thought that was great! Rooms: Great spacious rooms with comfy beds. They had everything you needed for your stay tucked away in the closet (iron, ironing board etc etc). The bathroom is good - not extremely spacious, but still nice. My concern there is that when you flush the toilet, it takes a really long time to "reload", and with it comes the sound, which could be slightly annoying at night. I found that in both my room and my sister's room so I assume it is across. Nothing major, but a small concern. My only advice, regarding our room location, if you are someone who is a light sleeper, and would like to sleep through the morning hours, is to book a room "away" from the breakfast area. Our room was right next to it, so we heard early breakfast go-ers sometimes. Location: Fabulous! A 10 minutes walk from the KingsCross metro station, a 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay ... makes this place superb! Botanical gardens are on the way to Circular Quay and the Opera, so you even opt for longer scenic walks if you want to! Many grocery stores are close by, laundry is also close by as well as some restaurants, all found on your way to the KingsCross metro station. Our only initial concern was the proximity of KingsCross road - but everyone told us that is safe to walk through if needed. Breakfast was nice. Being Egyptians, we were the loudest in the room for sure, but the people were friendly, and did not mind us! I think what made us love the place is that it felt like home ... and that really counts! If you are going to Sydney and thinking of a place to stay ... forget the idea of all those 5 & 4 star hotels around there and just book in the Simpsons ... you will not regret it! Thanks Vanessa & Keith for your great hospitality and help! P.S. I enjoy stating the fact that we were probably the first Egyptians to stay there, although not the first "Dubaians"! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....”
Reviews.Author: dazanddi
Reviews.Content: This beautiful Victorian style property was an absolute gem of a place. It's brilliantly located - can see the harbour bridge and the opera house from the top of the road. There are some lovely restaurants and bars close by which cater for the more expensive budget as well as the cheaper budget. We walked on most occasions into the city, which took a maximum of 30 mins but would definitely recommend the walk through the Royal Botanical gardens to MacQuaries Point which gives a fabulous view of the opera house and harbour bridge. If, however, walking isn't your thing, then there's a bus stop at the end of the road which takes you through the city to Circular Quay - very easy and cheap. Now, to the place itself. It's beautifully decorated with a wonderful lounge area, with reading material galore and access to the internet. Port and Sherry is also provided gratis. The rooms were delightful, not super modern but decorated in keeping with the house and all mod cons supplied. The best thing about Simpsons, however, is the most wonderful people that work there - especially Vanessa. We were given a really warm welcome and she went to great lengths to explain about places to visit and how to get there. Her knowledge and helpfulness were second to none and really contributed to our enjoyment of the place. We really enjoyed this place, it was different - no glitzy, shiny modern and faceless hotel but a warm and welcoming oasis in a big city. We would stay again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: michaeluk007
Reviews.Content: Very nice accommodation with pleasant decor a very large bedroom and all the room amenities you would expect from a top class B&B. We really enjoyed our six night stay at Simpsons and enjoyed my chat with Venessa on the Ireland history, thanks for a nice stay in Sydney, Regards Mike and Phyllis from Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “If I ran a B+B, I'd want it to be like this one”
Reviews.Author: Edwardknows
Reviews.Content: Having spent five nights here a the end of a long holiday, I have to agree with all the reviewers who describe it as a great place to stay. However, rather than the building getting all the praise, it's the team that run it that definitely deserve the five stars. Keith, Marie and Vanessa in particular (although any of the staff we bumped into were very pleasant) make you feel so welcome that you leave almost feeling that you've stayed in a friend's home. Yes, some of the fixtures and fittings need sprucing up and some of the furniture looks a bit worn but you overlook that when you're staying at a friend's house, don't you? At the end of the day, the bed was really comfortable, and that's the most important thing for me. Although this wasn't our first visit to Sydney (we love the place) with Keith's help we "discovered" Watson's Bay which was great. I am sure Keith gives the same spiel to all the guests but it's done in such a way as to make you think you're the first people he's ever told about Sydney's highlights, and that makes you feel special, and that's why people rave about Simpson's. After an evening out, we'd sit in the lounge enjoying a complementary glass of sherry whilst checking our emails and the BBC News (for free... why do so few hotels offer that?). At breakfast, Marie (or Keith) would enquire as to what we were planning to do that day and would offer suggestions of sights to see or hidden treasures whilst they served up the coffee. I challenge anyone to stay here and spend time talking to the staff and not love the place. It's a real home-from-home.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Ellen74
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights here as a stopover on our way to Melbourne, and felt welcome as soon as we arrived. We turned up early in the morning from the airport and we were able to leave our luggage and make use of the downstairs shower room with towels and toiletries provided, had a cup of tea and were given advice by Keith on how to walk into the city and what to see. We had a large comfortable room and really felt at home there. Lots of restaurants to choose from in the area - they get full quite early. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor's Reviews Are On The Mark Again”
Reviews.Author: wabanrail
Reviews.Content: Yes, Trip Advisor's No. 1 rating is correct again. Simpsons of Potts Point is superb. Keith is the perfect host. Everything is first class, though I wish that the in room refrigerator were less noisy. And sometimes autos disconcertingly roared up Challis Ave. But where else can you find a tub with four controls--hot and cold for tub and shower? How about a king size bed in a large room with sofa and easy chair? Or complimentary after dinner port in a lounge oozing with Victorian charm? Potts Point is indeed in an interesting part of town with all sorts of restaurants nearby. It is easy to walk to the Botanic Gardens, the opera house, and down to the Circular Quay. Watch out, however. There is a steep set of steps at the beginning of the journey, and more steps going up to the Botanic Gardens. We took the shuttle from the airport and actually enjoyed our tour of the city center. We were the last ones in the van. The return trip was another story. The shuttle never arrived after two phone calls. We took a cab which made it to the airport in about half the time. To the credit of the shuttle, we were given our "return" fare back. We recommend the cab to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It's home!”
Reviews.Author: THEPOW
Reviews.Content: It's just the kind of place you hope to find when far from home. From the personal welcome to nice rooms and highest quality staff, it's just what a hotel should be for the traveler who does not need ball rooms, large meeting space or crowds. The staff really cares about your comfort and goes out of their way to make your stay memorable. It's located in a nice neighborhood within an easy 15-20 minutes walking distance to the CBD. Quality restaurants 1/2 block away. Great breakfast, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, Internet access on their own computer [left the laptop at home - no problem] and a staff that really cares! Parking is limited but really no need for a car in a city which is easy to use public transit be it taxi, bus, train or ferry.

Reviews.Title: “You are home at Simpsons”
Reviews.Author: Evessa
Reviews.Content: Simpsons is listed in Trip Advisor's reviews of Sydney hotels and was #1 when I read the reviews in October 2008. It was not a difficult decision to book here after reading the reviews for this one of a kind B&B. It lived up to it's reputation. If you want a cozy and homey place in Sydney and don't want to be right down town in a big hotel, this is the place! It's a charming Victorian house with lovely interiors and a friendly staff that treats everyone like family. Breakfast is served in a bright and airy room on the main floor and sherry and port are available in the evening in one of several beautifully furnished public rooms. A complimentary computer is always available. Simpsons location is ideal because your are close to downtown....a 15 or 20 minute stroll from the front door through the Botonical Gardens will bring you to the Opera House and Circular Quay. Another plus is the local neighborhood around Simpsons. You will find grocery stores, great restaurants and coffee and snack bars. Just across the street is a wonderful restaurant...Sardine.......creative dishes with lots of fresh fish on the menu. We loved Sydney and loved our stay at Simpsons!!

Reviews.Title: “a real oasis”
Reviews.Author: UKBells
Reviews.Content: I can only endorse what others have included in their reviews. This small hotel is a real haven after a busy sightseeing day. The staff were so helpful, particularly with suggestions of where to go and what to see in the limited time we had. The many restaurants within 50 metres were superb, especially The Sardine Room. The walk into the centre through the Botanic Gardens was lovely though there were many steps to negotiate on the way. This was fine going into the city but coming back (rather tired) we found it easier to take a 311 bus from Circular Quay! The many and efficient ferries running from the Quay offer a wealth of places to see and I would recommend Watson's Bay and South head, a bus to Bondi and a walk to Bronte or Coogee but Keith in the hotel will be happy to tell you all about where to go. A trip to the Blue Mountains is a must, but only if the weather is good. We took a guided tour which collected us from the hotel and ended with a ferry from the Olympic Park back into the city and we felt it was excellent value for money but it is possible to do it on the train. All in all we had six fantastic days and should we go back to Sydney (there are so many other places we want to see!) we would certainly stay at Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “Warm atmosphere and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: JWBToronto
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending 8 nights at the Simpsons Hotel. I was warmly welcomed to this 12 room boutique hotel (B&B) by Vanessa who provided me with directions for a day of sight seeing. It is an easy walk to the Opera House, Botanic Gardens and the Shopping areas. The bus routes are very convenient if you are not a walker. The hotel is a hertiage building which has lovely antique furniture, fireplace and free internet service. Breakfast is served in the sunny solarium where you have the opportunity to meet other travellers. This is a gem of a hotel for those who prefer a cosy and warm atmosphere with personalized attention. I will be returning in 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Six wonderfull nights.”
Reviews.Author: Stagglet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six wonderfull nights at Simpsons, a nice boutique hotel close to the city centre, the botanical gardens and numerous good restuarants. We had a ground floor room which was very comfortable and quiet. The friendly helpfull service from Keith, Vanessa and the other staff, was exactly as earlier postings had inferred. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and Keith's knowledge of the city and its attractions was fantastic. The little extra tips on where to go, what to see etc. was most usefull. Return to Sydney? Yes, if only to stay at the Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: norno
Reviews.Content: This was just the perfect stay to start our vacation. The staff were exceptionally friendly, the breakfast delicious (especially the homemade rhubarb and raspberry compote). Location was amazing...lovely walk all the way to the Opera House. Quite simply I cannot recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, rooms and hosts”
Reviews.Author: AndyRapkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons for 3 nights at the beginning of our Honeymoon to Australia, and again for 1 night before returning home. We were warmly welcomed by Keith when we arrived early at 6:30 am and were able to get into our fantastic room (Cloud Suite) to freshen up. Keith gave us some great information and maps to help us around on our first day in Sydney - a fantastic host with lots of local knowledge. All of the Simpsons team were friendly and welcoming. The location of Simpsons is fantastic. Walk to the end of the road and you have a great view of the Sydney skyline, Opera House and Bridge which really took our breath away. There is a small, public gardens at the end of Challis Avenue where you can relax with the views and locals walking their dogs just 2 minutes from the Hotel. Central Sydney is a wonderful walk away (30 minutes or so) through Woolloomooloo, past the Finger Wharf and Royal Botanic Gardens to get to Circular Quays where you can reach anything with public transport links. The rooms are clean and very comfortable, breakfast is delicious - particularly the Rhubarb Compote and the Muffins are great too. For a splash of luxury in Sydney, Simpsons offers reasonable value in a fantastic location as an alternative to a lot of chain / boutique hotels. Potts Point itself is a great area with many cafÃ©s and restaurants right on the doorstep. A particular favourite for us was Dolcetta (walk down from Simpsons, turn left into Victoria Street and it's on the right after about 8 minutes walk). This is a wonderful streetside providore serving excellent food (BYO wine) and fantastic coffee with flawless service. We really felt like we were experiencing a local treat here. For another amazing Sydney experience, we ate at Ripples CafÃ© by the Olympic Pool beside the Harbour Bridge on our last night. Another BYO, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough for food, service and location. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: jannerboy
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel nicely located for touring the city's many attractions. Keith and Marie are very friendly and helpful and will make suggestions for sightseeing. Hotel is beautiful, inside and out. Rooms generous and well fitted out. Comfortable bed, good bathroom, easy wireless access, and perfect continental breakfast to set you up for the day. Cancellation policy is perfectly understandable (seven days notice) but will make it difficult for future business trips from England however some dates can be fixed and I hope to stay at Simpsons again.

Reviews.Title: “elegant country house in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ElRon29
Reviews.Content: The house is beautifully appointed and our room was lovely. The location is superb with wonderful restaurants, boutiques and shops in the neighborhood. Walking through the botanical gardens to the city center is an enjoyable way to start the day. On arrival our host sat down with us and gave us suggestions of what to do with our limited time in Sydney and then told us our room was ready even though we were much too early for check-in. Very much appreciated after our flight. The experience was like being welcomed as a weekend guest at an elegant country house. A very lucky weekend guest, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandPickwick
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome was matched by the relaxed ambience of the hotel. Within easy walking distance of the botanical gardens and the heart if the city an ideal location from which to explore Sydney. Keith gave us much helpful advice and direction to make the most of our stay. A quiet hotel well suited to those of a gentle disposition; not really a place for children or those having a boisterous disposition. Peter & Sue Dickens, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Retreat in the Heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Nevermannsetal
Reviews.Content: I needed accommodation close to the City, which provided support for my business requirements, but also had a personal touch. I found Keith, Marie and Vanessa incredibly helpful and informative. This is a very special boutique hotel in a great location, run by outstanding people. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The epitomy of warm hospitality”
Reviews.Content: I understand why Simpsons is the #1 Trip Advisor hotel in Sydney. We stayed there on our first night in Australia, and it was perfect! The restored 1920's house is warm and welcoming, as are Keith and Vanessa, the hosts whom we met. The room was comfortable and inviting, breakfast was delicious, and Vanessa gave us a map with a detailed itinerary for our first day that provided us with a great experience of the city and kept us awake and moving through jet lag after a 22 hr. trip. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home!”
Reviews.Author: Mathryn
Reviews.Content: Simpsons Hotel is a home from home! We booked a 2 night stay at Simpsons Hotel after reading about it here on Trip Advisor. No wonder it is voted best place to stay in Sydney! It is a gorgeous little boutique hotel. It really feels like you are staying with a rich friend! We stayed in a dormer room which was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable and there were all the amenities you would need including an iron & ironing board! Breakfast was included in our stay and it was delicious! Such a variety ranging from muffins and crumpets, to stewed fruit, yoghurt and muesli. The manager, Vanessa was extremely helpful, suggesting places nearby to eat and the best ways of walking to the harbour etc. Nothing was too much trouble. There is a lovely communal lounge at the hotel where we sat both nights after dinner by the warm fire enjoying the complimentary sherry and port! There is also free internet in the lounge and lots of reading material including lonely planet guides to Sydney. On our first morning we walked through the botanical gardens to the Harbour â€“ this is a lovely walk and only took about 25 minutes. Potts Point is a great location as there are loads of restaurants and lovely boutiques in the area. Be careful of the Sydney taxi drivers however. We paid $22 for a trip to Darling Harbour and were only charged $11 for the same trip on the way back later that night! It also only cost around $10 to get a cab to the Harbour so donâ€™t let the fact you are not in the hustle and bustle put you off staying at this wonderful hotel. It is exceptionally good value for money. We looked at many other hotels in the CBD to stay but the prices are astronomical. You get great value for money at Simpsons Hotel and a friendly personable service. Vanessa really makes you feel at home during your stay â€“ a service you would not receive at a big hotel. We will definitely be staying at Simpsons Hotel again the next time we are in Sydney and have recommended it to family and friends. Thank you Vanessa for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying With Family”
Reviews.Author: BrumbyGully
Reviews.Content: This place is very, very cool. It reminded me of my grandpa's beautiful old house from the same century (except this one is renovated!) The den was my favorite spot. It has two fireplaces, a library with a LOAD of books, leather recliners, sofas, sherry and port wine, and a computer with free internet! The best part about the computer is that it is not all locked down like most hotel computers. You can download your photos to the hard drive, resize them, then post them on webshots or kodak picture gallery to share with your family. It's like having your own personal computer right in front of you. Vanessa (the host) was kind enough to lend me her digital camera's wire. Vanessa was also very helpful with tips on where to go and what to do, and even booked reservations for us. The only drawbacks are: you have to be super-quiet at night so as not to disturb your neighbors. It really feels like you're staying at someone's home. Also, no room service. The location is excellent. I enjoyed the walk down the steps to the meat pie stand and on to the Botannical Gardens. Go to the Indian restaurant at the base of the pier past the meat pie stand. It was had first-rate food and top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: TheWearyTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a really charming hotel and very much like living in a large Edwardian house with all the trimmings. Lovely stained glass windows, large bedrooms with tea and coffee, ironing board, TV, air con, clean and comfortable. Large and cozy living room, with sherry at the ready after a busy day. Free access to the Internet is a great touch. Not a large hotel, so quite personal. No pool or gardens, but who has time for this as there is so much to do in Sydney and the Botanical Gardens are practically on your door step? The location was excellent, not in the thick of it, but an easy walk to the centre of town (20 mins max) or a fairly cheap taxi ride. It's also close to Kings Cross, the red light district - but this isnt a particular draw back, far from it. It means that restaurants and bars are open a little later close to the hotel. The hotel itself is in a quiet street off the main drag so there's no disturbance. Breakfast was fine - coffee, tea, juices and toast with jams or soft cheese. Just enough to start you off for the day. Good size breakfast room with daily papers and tourist info, maps etc. Not particularly cheap, but comparable to other hotels of a similar class. Very nice place to stay and thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very personal service”
Reviews.Author: DAEsmae
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on ratings on this site for the last few nights of a honeymoon trip, looking for a non-chain experience. Due to planned activities we did not see a great deal of the staff or run into other guests. What contact we had with the staff was excellent, however. They drew us maps, wrote us notes when we got in late and they wanted to update us, offered to make arrangements for us, and were very helpful in every way. This is the outstanding service that makes small places like this ever so much nicer to stay in than chain hotels - like hospitable relatives who are helpful but you don't have to make small talk with. The location is superb for walking around or a myriad of activities. Free (though slow) internet was very appreciated. The room was comfortable, although it was winter and we could not locate a heater to adjust (the provided extra blanket solved the problem). We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, offering superb value for $”
Reviews.Author: Ingle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a delightful 3 nights in Room 10 at Simpsons. It was a first trip to Australia for both of us, and I believe we fell in love with Sydney certainly partially as a result of the staff at Simpsons and the place itself. We were immediately struck by the warm and personal welcome from Vanessa who greeted us by name and shook our hands even before we had introduced ourselves.
