She showed us around and painstakingly (not perfunctorily, as is usually the case) marked useful information on a map. She patiently addressed all our questions. That first impression was a strong and very positive one, created by a genuinely service-oriented young woman. It was followed by pleasant interactions with both Marie and Keith - consistently gracious hosts. Room 10 was the brightest room on the second floor. In addition to its charm, it was appointed with small conveniences that one doesn't usually find in one accomodation. They were all present in Room 10 - windows in two directions that opened, a loveseat and coffee table, effective sconces and lamps, a good-sized desk, a small fridge, ample storage room for shoes, hanging and folded clothes, and lots of surface areas for knick-knacks such as sunglasses, guidebooks etc. The bathroom was very small and steamed up quickly, but the rain shower was wonderful. The "king" bed was two doubles pushed together - not optimal, but perfectly adequate. We made much use of the coffee and tea making service, as we did the computer (and the sherry!) in the drawing room downstairs. The only "issue" with the room was that, due to a misunderstanding, it did not have the balcony we were expecting. (I believe only one room has a balcony). Vanessa handled this problem promptly, forthrtightly and pleasantly and, after checking their file, offered a 10% discount on the price, which we gladly accepted. The breakfasts were served in an attractive, albeit cold, solarium, with a good selection of continental fare - pastries, toasted breads, bagels and english muffins (with cream cheese and jams), cereals, juices, fresh and dried fruits, and yogurt. Newspapers were provided. The breakfasts were satisfying and we did not leave the table wanting. The neighbourhood could not have been better. It was ideal - replete with trendy bars, restaurants, and shops and close to the sites without being "downtown" alongside large chain hotels. It had a chic but lived-in feel. Simpsons itself is on Challis, a gorgeous street, with gracious and elegant period establishments. Bus stops were within a block or two - and one bus gets you directly to the harbour, opera house, and all the sites on every visitor's must-see list. We used the busses a lot to get around inexpensively. The only small blemish was on the morning of our departure when unbeknownst to us, we came down to breakfast 30 minutes early (it was a Saturday and breakfast times started and ended later) and were met by server who was less than gracious. I believe difficulty with engligh may have been part of the problem, but she did not smile or explain that unfortunately we were early, or that to try and accomodate us she would try to have things out sooner. Nor did she even try to "act" or "sound" accomodating, understanding or reassuring. Rather she appeared annoyed with and disapproving of us, a reaction that was a bit surprising for an inn that otherwise exemplified first-rate, personal service. We will without doubt stay at Simpsons should we return to Sydney, and would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone. If you are looking for accomodations in Sydney, I can assure you that you will love the vibrant neighbourhood, the charming rooms, the gracious owners, and the attention paid to all the little extra details that made this for us such an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: greenspecs99
Reviews.Content: There's not much to add that hasn't already been said! Its a lovely place, well situated and a delight to stay in. Keith, Mairie and Vanessa were the ideal hosts - helpful and full of ideas and useful tips for sightseeing. There are lots of restaurants to choose from in the area too. Hospitality extended beyond the expected, too. We arrived at 7.45 am after a very long flight. Of course, our room was not ready but we had use of a bathroom to shower and change in, as well as breakfast (not charged for). It's clear why this hotel is currenty #1 in Tripadvisors list for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Victorian Splendour with a hint of the Unusual”
Reviews.Author: rogerandjenny
Reviews.Content: This heritage hotel is located in a trendy area within easy walking distance of waterside restaurants, the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House etc. Breakfast is served in the Conservatory and the bedrooms are furnished in keeping with the period. The decor of the lounge is traditional, very comfortable and and has a wonderful collection of unusual objet d'art.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and luxurious boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ardent_traveller_7
Reviews.Content: Where can I start? This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. It's most like having friends of friends invite you to stay at their lovely big house with your own bit of the house to come and go as you please! Nothing was too much trouble for Vanessa and Keith, and they were both truly welcoming and generous with their time, trouble and attention. We benefited most from Vanessa (simply because of the times/ days we were at the hotel), who recommended things to do etc. The room was beautiful as was the whole place. Incidentally, there's access to a PC for the internet. I can wholeheartedly recommend that you stay here! the location was perfect, just a short stroll from the botanical gardens and from there to the city centre and the bay.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: WAG1940
Reviews.Content: This is a short review as so much has been said in other reviews about this excellent hotel We particularly liked the friendliness and help from Keith ,Marie and Vanessa who helped us celebrate our friends 60th and gave good advice on restaurants and everything else After a hard day there are good restaurants within five minutes walk and it is a lovely walk through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House . Beats getting the bus. A lovely atmosphere here surrounded by quality furniture in a historic house. You cannot beat it

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Keepupwiththejones
Reviews.Content: The house was lovely the rooms quite nice. We booked the B&B having read Tripadvisor recommendation and weren't disappointed. The location is perfect - just a short walk through Botanical Gardens to city centre. The staff (particularly Vanessa) were very helpful. Not a first class hotel but certainly very good value for money B&B in expensive city. Only slight problem for us, admittedly VERY light sleepers, was there was some traffic noise - which could be remedied by secondary double glazing - obviously you wouldn't want to change the original, beautiful windows. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting Sydney. Agree with earlier reviewer that Lilianfels is wonderful but don't forget it's more than twice the price of Simpsons. Forty somethings, Oxford, England

Reviews.Title: “Four day stop-over”
Reviews.Author: Taihape
Reviews.Content: From my first enquiry email (booking a room) through to our early morning departure at the end of our stay, Keith, Marie & Vanessa gave us friendly service and advice to cram as much as possible into our 4 days of "exploring Sydney". The hotel is beautifully restored and a welcome departure from the modern purpose- built, big chain clones. Our king-sized room at the back of the hotel was comfortable and bright, with writing table, sofa, and provision for tea and coffee making. The ensuite was small but spotless, the room quiet, and the staff unobstrusively helpful. Free internet access was available in the downstairs lounge/reading room 24/7. A delightful stay and a definite "will return".

Reviews.Title: “Felt special......”
Reviews.Author: LEDSydney
Reviews.Content: Our experience varies from previous guests due to the fact that we are Sydney siders. Our overnight stay was acquired through a Breast Cancer fund raiser, that the owners of "the Simpsons" very kindly donated to. Even though we were not "paying customers" so to speak, we were welcomed with the same warmth and sincerity. This was to be a special weekend for us as we were celebrating birthdays and unbeknown to the hosts, I myself had recently undergone cancer treatment. We were not disappointed. The room, diningroom, lounge etc. all kept in the hotel's historical period had a lovely ambiance and was kept very clean. It is located close to great restaurants and just a short walk away from the most beautiful harbour in the world. Even friends that we had dined with were so impressed that they intend staying next time they are in town. If you're looking for great accommodation, you can find it anywhere in a number of lovely places all over Sydney.....but they would not have that special touch that makes "the Simpsons" unique. Thank you to everyone at the Simpsons for leaving us with a wonderful memory of a very special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanJamLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons of Potts Point in early February. This charming hotel is in perfect condition with beautiful woodwork and stained glass windows. The bedrooms are spacious and clean and the communal areas are comfortable and contain a number of travel guides and a computer with free Internet access. Both Vanessa & Keith, the hotel managers, were extremely helpful recommending various sites to visit in and around Sydney and assisting us with booking both dinner and day-spa reservations. For those who haven't been to Sydney before, this hotel is only a short walk away from the Botanical Gardens and the famous Rocks district. So if you are looking for charming hotel near the top tourist destinations in Sydney, we would highly recommend Simpsons of Potts Point!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: honohar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons at Potts Point in Jan. 2008. It is a wonderful small hotel. The rooms are charming and the house had a comfortable feeling throughout. The staff was very helpful with directions as well as booking a tour to the Hunter Valley. The hotel/b&b is centrally located to the center of Sydney. The breakfast was continental with an excellent variety. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Tulitulip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in January and what a find, we just loved the place. I found this place on Trip Advisor actually. It can only be described as beautiful in a great location. It is spotless clean, the breakfast was Excellent. What a beautiful property this is, the staff are so terrific. It is so handy to restaurants and deli's we found so many places to eat nearby. We fancied this restaurant and lounge just down the street called Lotus. If you visit Sydney you must stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paultubby
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in a good location,the owner gave us some great tips and ideas to make our stay even better. Lovely breakfast served. Some very nice restaurants are within easy walking of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: jaclak
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel in Sydney we found that Simpson's would cost about the same as staying in the Mercure or similiar, so decided to book it. I am very pleased that we did. Our room was large and well appointed, with a couch and magazines, fridge and kettle with coffee and tea. Although billed as a continental breakfast it was the best B&B breakfast we encountered, with plenty of choice. The lounge area was very inviting with comfortable chairs, magazines and plenty of guide books. The glass of port was a nice touch. The free Internet was very welcome. We arrived late but Keith (the host) had emailed us with details of how to get in and was very helpful the next morning in making suggestions as to where to go. Our daughter was staying at Simpsons a couple of weeks after us, and we wanted to leave some treats for her and her husband. When we asked Keith if we could leave something for her he arranged the whole thing for us and all we had to provide was a greetings card. The hotel is in a quiet side street. Apart from the steep hill down to Woollomoloo it wasa very pleasant 20 min walk across the botanic garden to circular quay. There were plenty of restauraunts within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant mistake!”
Reviews.Author: travelbee777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in November 2007. On my arrival to Sydney, after 24hrs of travelling, I arrived at the Best Western Azure Apts. Unfortunately, there was an error on the Wotif booking site where I had my confirmation but the hotel didnt receive theirs, thus, no hotel room for me (see my review, "Shaky start but nice stay" for Best Western). Best Western immediately called "Simpsons" nearby, to see if they had a room to accomodate us & they did. Although it wasn't in the B&B itself, it was right next door in an apt. building. (I don't know if its part of the B&B or a separate business because I didnt see it mentioned on their website) The apt. was immaculate. It was a contemporary styled one bedroom apartment w/a small complete kitchenette, & nice view. Nicer than the room, were the staff. The owners were beyond pleasant. Keith had made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. He showed us around & took the time to map out what we could do, where to eat, or what market to go to if we wanted to cook in our apt. The tropical, brick paved entrance was beautiful. There was what I think was a reading area or den, and an area where one could use their internet (free). Though we weren't officially booked w/Simpsons, they were kind enough to offer us breakfast the next morning when I had stopped by to use their internet. Their breakfast area was a beautiful, bright & airy room; exactly like their website pic. Their breakfast was basic but good; breads, fruits, juices, cereal, fresh coffee. Satisfying. We had a wonderful conversation with one of their staff members (Marie, Maria?) from Columbia. She was such a sweet woman, & when we had mentioned that we would have loved to continue our stay there (we were due to go back to Best western after our 1 night stay), she immediately spoke w/the owner to see if we could be accomodated. Unfortunately, they were fully booked. We really enjoyed/loved this place. From the pics on their site, would haved loved to actually stay in one of their charming B&B rooms, though the apt was quite nice. I understand we all have different tastes, but if you're expecting luxury & pampering, white glove style as you're accustomed to, then by all means book those types of accomodations. But if you're looking for wonderful, home-style & personal charm, with wonderful personal attention, then Simpsons is the place to be. The location- nice restaurants, close to the Royal Botanic Garden (about15-20min, walking) which was beautiful! An extra 15/20mins would bring you to the CBD. ut if walking isnt your thing there were buses & many taxis to hail. All in all, wonderful place & would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and Welcoming Experience”
Reviews.Author: PuckStop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about 5 days during our visit to Sydney in Sept 2007. I booked the Simpsons based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The property sits in a quiet - mainly residential - area, but is only 1-3 blocks away from restaurants, laundry services, and some small markets. There is a supermarket nearby, and our room had a small mini-fridge where we would put some juice and water. The people here made our stay very enjoyable. We arrived early in the morning - well before check-in time - but I had already contacted the hotel about this and they were able to accommodate our needs. On a few mornings we arrived 15-30 minutes before breakfast time, but the staff went out of their way to help us out on those days. They were also able to provide us with detailed maps and opinions on hotels and sights throughout the city. On a day we drove to the Blue Mountains, they even loaned us a driving tour book from the library to make sure we got the most out of our day. Breakfast is held in a beautiful sun room, and includes a nice variety of cereals, yogurt with fruit, breads and juices. The french-press coffee is great, too! Overall, this was a great hotel focused on service and a personal touch. We felt right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Tartan69
Reviews.Content: The accommodation highlight of our Oz trip. Staff were extremely friendly & went out of their way to give us advice and assistance. The house is beautiful in a fantastic location, just 15mins walk through Botanic gardens to city center and minutes from nightlife of Kings Cross. Rooms are well appointed with elegant furnishings and nice touches like magazines. The shared lounge is great for internet access, book browsing & free port. Breakfast is delicious. Simple muesli & bread selection - exactly what you want so you can embark on a day of eating your way round Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: drmrussellphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights this last December and had an amazing time. The room..#3 was teriffic; there were 2 beds for 3 of us and there was plenty of room. The Inn is lovely and beautifully decorated...very clean and feels like home. The best part, of course, were the owners, who were very friendly and gave us perfect suggestions for our few days in Sydney- truly, Mari and Keith, the owners, were just amazing. The breakfasts were self-serve continental style, but very filling and there was always fruit for noshing. Another highpoint was the neighborhood, Potts Point, which was charming, quiet, full of top notch restaurants and easy walking distance to all points of interest via the amazing Royal Botanical Gardens. We were so happy that we cancelled our room at the Mariott on the HArbour and took our chances with this little gem. For the money, it really is a terrific value. We will stay here every time we come back to Sydney, which we hope is very often. You will love it!! -Michele Ahwahnee

Reviews.Title: “Not what we'd call boutique”
Reviews.Author: youngandfiftyish
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in boutique hotels recently in South Africa and were expecting something similar. Simpsons is in a pleasant position in a residential road about 20/30 minutes walk to the Opera House. There are a couple of excellent restauants in the area (booking advisable). We were welcomed by the delightful Vanessa who was very much Simpsons to us. The reception rooms and dining room were fine. Our room (called a suite?) by the hotel was a reasonable size with settee and a view through a large window overlooking the not particularly attractive back street. Although the building is handsome it very much needs certainly redecoration and a little refurbishment. Boutique we believe should be modern or striking this is more shabby without the chic.

Reviews.Title: “Better than 5 star.....”
Reviews.Author: Katharine_Richard
Reviews.Content: This is not a 5 star international hotel. This is something better. Simpsons is a delightful boutique hotel with extremely friendly staff in a nice area. We spent 9 nights there in December 2007. We could not have been made to feel more welcome from the moment we were greeted with a big smile by Vanessa to when Keith waved us off in our taxi to the airport. We look forward to returning to Simpsons in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jg415
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Simpsons of Potts Point in November for 3 nights. Like most everyone who has reviewed it on this site, we had a wonderful stay. The property is a beautiful historic house, very nicely furnished and comfortable. The neighborhood is great; you feel like you are living among residents of Sydney in one of the nicest areas in town. It is a short, enjoyable walk to the Opera House, ferries, and most of the CBD through the botanic gardens. Finally the staff is really wonderful, very helpful and hospitable. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly!”
Reviews.Author: SusieBon
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful start to my Oz adventure. I received such a warm and friendly welcome. The staff are so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTraveller_7
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this bed and breakfast enough. Great location, terrific service, beautifully appointed rooms and yummy breakfast. A great place to stay either for a romantic getaway or with friends/family etc. We had a really great time and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel!”
Reviews.Author: bryan4134
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 nights at Simpsons. It is a delightful property with hosts who go beyond the call of duty in every respect. The rooms are emmaculate and comfortable, the breakfast healthy and wholesome. The location is perfect - it is closer enough to the city to walk (through beautiful parklands) and yet far enough away to be peaceful. There are many small excellent restaurants within a few hundred yards of the hotel. We especially enjoyed the complimentary port and sherry in the guests' lounge! Throughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: NLDMorrisville_PA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience staying at the Simpson's of Potts Point. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The room we stayed in was very tastefully decorated as was the whole B&B. We never needed a car while in Sydney because of the great location of Simpson's. We walked to all the nearby restaruants, to Hyde Park, the botanical gardens and to catch the many ferries. What really made our stay so special was when we had left the Simpson's in a shuttle to the airport. The Simpson's called the shuttle to let them know that my husband had left his carry-on bag containing our passports and boarding passes at the B&B. We called when we got to the airport and spoke with Keith Wherry. Keith told us not to worry, he would bring our bag to the airport in time for us to catch our plane. As promised, 20 minutes later, Keith pulls up with my husband's bag. He didn't have to do that, he could have just sent it in a cab, but that's not the way they treat their guests at the Simpson's. Morrisville, PA USA

Reviews.Title: “The personal touch in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mackiernan
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Simpsons on our first visit to Sydney. Upon arrival we were greeted by Keith Wherry who, with pre-prepared map in hand, advised us on how to best take advantage of our limited time. In light of the beautiful weather he steered us to a nearby waterside restaurant as opposed to our original plan to book a less scenic venue. The Woolloomooloo Wharf is a 5 minute walk from the hotel with waterside dining and an unanticipated view of the bats arising from the Sydney Botanical Gardens. Simpsons is a good 20 minute walk from Circular Quay although one is tempted to spend hours strolling though the gardens enroute. Taxis are an inexpensive alternative, especially on the way back so as to avoid a somewhat uphill climb. The hotel is a converted Victorian with period furnishings and interesting art. Our room (number 10, the Victoria) was very comfortable and spacious with a large walk-in shower. The air-conditioned hotel was a welcome refuge after a hard day of sightseeing. The internet connection in the study was very efficient although one is tempted to lounge in the leather sofas, reading the owner's Rolls Royce literature and drinking sherry, instead. The staff was very pleasant and Mr. Wherry was a congenial host who was very flexible in meeting our travel needs upon departure. Simpsons is an ideal alternative for those who do not wish to stay in a downtown highrise and appreciate a more neighborly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: sandstones
Reviews.Content: The pros: very helpful owner - both when making the reservation and while staying there, less than a block to numerous excellent restaurants, overall appearance is nicely done upper end antique, comfortable rooms. Free Wifi worked well, and there is a public PC as well. The cons: breakfast was pretty mediocre (supermarket bread, english muffins, cereal etc), and after 2 days of the identical stuff we started going to the Italian cafe up the street. Maintenance was a bit spotty as well - some things like the rusty door handles to the bathroom and the door to the built-in mini refrigerator that didn't seem to close didn't fit with the overall image. Overall I thought it was a bit pricey for what we got. The location was good in that there are great restaurants in Potts Point, but not so good in that its a 20-30 minute walk to downtown and all the attractions. There is a bus, but its a pretty circular route that takes longer than walking to most places, and during most of the day only comes every half hour. The Fratelli Paridiso - Italian restaurant and cafe - just up the street was wonderful - both for breakfast and dinner. Its also very popular - we got there at 6:45 on a Monday night and got the next to last table.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and service”
Reviews.Author: akanakagawa
Reviews.Content: After seeing the raves on Tripadvisor and coming for only a brief visit to Sydney after a medical mission to Papua New Guinea, we looked to Simpson's for a treat. We were not disappointed!!! Ideally located within walking distance of almost everything worth seeing in a very worth-seeing city, Simpson's offered superb service and a beautiful, warm, inviting atmosphere. The Cloud Room had a window facing the tree-lined, quiet street and offered lots of amenities including champagne, candy and fresh flowers, a corner fireplace as well as a jacuzzi tub! Our breakfast was taken in a very sunny solarium and there was complementary sherry or port to warm the cool evenings. Jackie, the proprietor, was extremely helpful with suggestions for trips and meals and there was high speed internet available for free in the well appointed living room/library. We could not have been more satisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as they said”
Reviews.Author: JackieNamibia
Reviews.Content: Simpsonâ€™s is not for those seeking the kind of experience you get from the Holiday Inn or one of the big chains of hotels. It is small, intimate and friendly. Our room was beautifully furnished, the owners and staff were friendly, and there was a beautiful cosy living room with a fire always burning, which was just right for reading stories to a jet-lagged three-year old at three in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance and charm”
Reviews.Author: isabel88
Reviews.Content: Simpsons is a charming, quiet, well appointed bed and breakfast within easy walking distance of the centre of Sydney. We enjoyed the classic decor and spacious, comfortable room. The staff were very warm and welcoming and went out of their way to assist us with car parking and other requests. The continental breakfast provided a good variety of options and was very filling. We enjoyed our stay very much and will be returning there when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, elegant and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: diannuccia
Reviews.Content: We had a most comfortable stay here and would endorse other recommendations. Our room on the ground floor was spacious, attractively furnished and most comfortable. It was great to return here to relax at the end of a day's sightseeing. It was also particularly good to be able to eat at the excellent local restaurants. We appreciated the suggestions made by Keith for restaurants and also for places to visit during the day - his maps were very helpful and enhanced our first visit to Sydney. Although the hotel is away from the centre the walk through the Botanical Gardens was very beautiful and our first sight of the flying foxes was memorable. Breakfast was relatively simple but good. We are looking forward to a return visit next time we visit Australia and would definitely recommend Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: JandJDaniel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons for 2 nights at the end of our 2 week trip to Australia. It was really wonderful in every way! We arrived later than our expected check-in time on a rainy evening and Jackie said she was worried about us - there was no check in as she was waiting for us to come. We stayed in the Cloud Suite and found it to be very comfortable. Large jacuzzi tub and shower stall in the bathroom. The location is wonderful and we walked everywhere we went- from the great pizza place nearby to the Opera House by way of the beautiful Domain Botanical Gardens. Breakfast was very nice with cereal, toast, juice and fruit. All staff and other guests were very friendly and welcoming. We felt like we were staying in someone's home rather than a hotel. The decor, the nicely restored old building, welcoming sitting room and the warm hospitality really impressed us. If we ever return to Sydney, you will find us at Simpsons!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleNat
Reviews.Content: Simpsons of Potts Point has become our favourite place to stay when in Sydney. What's not to like about this beautifully restored heritage bed and breakfast in the Potts Point end of Kings Cross? It has friendly staff, comfortable rooms with big beds, and its central location means that Darlinghurst, the Art Gallery etc are within walking distance. Returning from dinner one rainy night, we spent some time in Simpsons' communal library/drawing room, sipping on complimentary port and warming ourselves up in front of the lit fireplace. And our wedding anniversary didn't go unnoticed - chocolates and champagne were waiting in our room for us. Needless to say, we're hooked and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in Fun Residential Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CharleyG
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is located in Potts Point which is a 25 minute walk (throught the magnificent botanical garden, but up and down some tall stairways) to the Circular Quay area. It is a short cab ride to anywhere in Sydney. Potts Point is a charming mix of residential, small hotels, shops and restaurants. We had wonderful dinners within a block or two of the hotel. The hotel is kept immaculately, and we stayed for five nights. Our room (#11) was one flight up, over-sized, very quiet, but a touch dark. Bathroom was large and clean. On the ground floor, there is a large living room for guests with reading materials and some sherry to sip to recover from your day of sight seeing. Breakfast is very good, but less elaborate than at other places. The staff (especially Keith) was wonderfully helpful. Keith prepared day trips with maps for us on several occasions. He recommended local restaurants for the evening meal. At the end of our stay, we felt like we were leaving the home of a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: WinKz
Reviews.Content: After reading about #1 ranked Simpsons on TripAdvisor, I just had to try it for myself. Arranged for our last night's stay there (May 6) Very boutique. No check-in! They were already expecting us. Gave us simple instructions via the intercom, buzzed the door open and we were left on our own. We booked the Dormer room, and was given a room on the 3rd floor. There's no elevator or bell-boy. =) we lugged our bags up. Found our room all ready and key on the room door. The room was just beautiful! Exactly as promised on the website, maybe even better. Spacious and grand, I loved it immediately. They have a large and exquisite reading room, which unfortunately we did not have more time to explore. Free internet access came very handy when we were searching for directions. Location: Just off King's Cross. U can easily find bars and restaurants open late in the area. But rather far from city centre and cabs don't come by often. We walked to the Rocks market, took about an hour. Met the hotel staff for the first time next morning during breakfast. They were wonderful and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Extra care and attention”
Reviews.Author: companero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Simpsons of Potts Point in April. It was the end of a trip to New Zealand for me and my mom, and a short two night stay in Sydney. We were so glad to be at Simpsons. Jackie and Keith were attentive hosts along with the rest of the staff. We stayed at some wonderful places in New Zealand, and Simpsons topped off our trip with a wonderful lasting memory. I still wish I could wake up and go down to the conservatory for the yummy breakfast. The YOGURT! Yum! We were given complimentary passes to a nearby gym (yoga classes etc. if you have time) but unfortunately didn't have time. Keith sketched out the perfect day for us as we had one full day in Sydney. We walked all over (through the Royal Botanic Gardens) --took the ferry to Manley and Shelley Beach, dined, swam, went to the ballet at the Opera House that night and had a full beautiful day. Keith also arranged our taxi for the morning back to the airport. And Jackie and whoever was on staff to cook in the morning allowed us to come down to breakfast early so we could catch our taxi. The nicest staff!! The sitting area is a great place to go read or use the computer (complimentary) or have a glass of port or sherry (complimentary) or borrow a book to read. Our room was a bit musty, but we aired it out and used our wonderful lavendar oils in the bathroom. It is an old house full of charm. Our room wasn't the fanciest (don't remember the name or number--it was very yellow inside and on the second landing level) but the hotel was wonderful over all. We needed two beds. The birds in Sydney are incredible and they serenaded us in the morning. It was a bit of luxury that wasn't horribly overpriced in an expensive city. I will go back if I am ever able!!

Reviews.Title: “Warmth and Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: OldiesKensington
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an 8 day trip to Sydney where we were recommended a stay at Simpsons by friends of our daughter who had stayed there. We were warmly greeted on arrival and shown to our suite. We had requested a ground floor suite as we are both getting to the "no stairs" stage of life. This had not been available when we first booked but as there had been a change in bookings they were able to accommodate us. The suite was most comfortable with a Queen sized bed and all the facilities one could ask for. We found that with a quiet 30 minute stroll, we could walk along the water line to the Opera House via the Mrs Macquarie Point area. We could also walk through the gardens to the centre of Sydney. We were most impressed with the service provided by Simpsons and we particularly appreciated the breakfasts which were filling and healthy with fresh fruit, cereals, toast and tea of coffee plus the little extras which make life worthwhile. Staff were very friendly and helpful with information on current events and shows available in Sydney. We will not hesitate to recommend Simpsons to others and will certainly stay there next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Do yourself a favour and stay here”
Reviews.Author: bukina_faso
Reviews.Content: What a find! After spending a few hours searching the net for somewhere to stay in Sydney, I read the reviews on trip advisor and am so glad I did. We arrived after a long flight at 8am in the morning and as soon as we walked through the door the staff could not be any more helpful. Our room wasn't ready, but they said another room was ready if we didn't mind upgrading (at no extra cost). The room itself was amazing and have to say the bed was the most comfortable one I have ever slept on. There is alot in the area, supermarket, chemist, great pubs and bottle shops and it is only a short walk to the city. Would definatly stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: alluvium
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at Simpsons and received such a warm welcome that we knew then we were in a special place. Simpsons is a gracious hotel with great style. where the personal touch is important and where your name is actually remembered. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the breakfasts in the conservatory were really 'yummy'. Keith, Jackie and Marie were friendly and helpful and went out of their way to give us information about where to visit. Staying at Simpsons certainly enhanced our visit to Sydney, and after a busy day out it was good to return to this small intimate and friendly hotel. The walk into Sydney wasn't too bad, and we even climbed the steps on the way back (although we did take a taxi to that point!). We liked the restaurants at the top of the street and the general atmosphere of the area. All in all, Simpsons is a fabulous place to stay, and we shall return. We even received a welcome home email - how personal and friendly is that.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific personal service”
Reviews.Author: LisJ
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two teenage daughters and stayed at Simpsons for one week in April. We want to endorse all the positive comments made here. From the start we were made to feel so welcome and Jacqui had made sure we had interconnecting rooms with a cool balcony! Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and Keith had lots of advice on where to go, even where to eat, and provided us with maps and travel hints. The rooms are of a high standard â€” you would pay so much more in big hotels without the personal service. NB: possibly the most comfortable bed ever! The location is excellent and the view towards the Botanical Gardens and the harbour will linger long in the memory. By great fortune, Simpsons is also very convenient for a close relative who lives in Potts Point so we shall definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great combo of business and tourism”
Reviews.Author: terpprof
Reviews.Content: I spent two WEEKS at Simpsons in late March and it was wonderful. I will definitely try to come back - certainly I will stay there any time I return to Sydney. Like Cheers, this is definitely a place where everyone knows your name. I was welcomed off my early morning long flight from US with a lovely bathroom and shower, to refresh. My bags were lugged by nice people (thank you, Jackie?) up the incredible Victorian staircase to my charming garrett room (which I had picked, on-line). The room was something out of a child (and adult) dream, with TV and fridge cleverly hidden in the decorative cupboards. It was a joy to explore. Morning breakfast was a joy as well, with the home-made rhubarb compote a special treat in the sunny breakfast room. The whole place has wireless internet, which was a major decision in my choice of hotel given the length of my stay - I didn't want to be nickled and dimed for my necessary hookups with my work back home... Folks were personable and helpful- I don't know where to begin. The location is also "to die for" as they say in some circles. Walk out the door and you overlook downtown Sydney, the Bridge, and the roof of the Opera House; the stairs down to the Gardens and whole "tourist area" are but a short block away. Go the other way, and there are restaurants galore, and, for long-stayers such as me, a grocery 'round the corner (Woolworth's, downstairs, no, it is not a 5 and dime in OZ), and a majorly good bottle shop a few blocks further. So, the place has ambiance to beat the band (the downstairs area, sitting room, breakfast area, etc, is story-book like), great rooms, equal to any majorly lux hotel I have stayed in recently, although maybe not as large), and persona that you can't find in too many other places. I am a pretty road-worn traveler, and this was JUST great. Thanks to Keith, Jackie and all the others... still tired from my trip so forgive if I don't mention you all by name...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: swartzlosgatos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Simpson's of Potts Point. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was like a suite. It was very comfortable with a nice view. Breakfast, an extended continental was ample. It was served in a lovely room.The owners and assistants were very friendly and very helpful.They made great suggestions as to where to go and where to eat. This bed and breakfast is well located and there are many small restaurants, and cafes nearby. We strongly recommend this bed and breakfast place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Aussies too”
Reviews.Author: Oztravelhound
Reviews.Content: We've also found our new home in Sydney. Perfect for a long weekend. Superior room was huge with plush, new furnishing in a house with olde worlde ambience. Challis Avenue is a row of mainly terrace houses with the city skyline over the Botanic Gardens at the end. Take a walk down the steps (there are 111 of them) to the new Woolloomoolloo wharf restaurant precinct - much better than Darling harbour (less touristy, buzzing with locals who come to buy a meat pie at midnight at Harry's, and a great city skyline view) - or walk uphill just round the corner to 'Yellow" (the hip dessert place for coffee). Stored our bags all day after checkout AND able to shower before catching plane back to Brisbane AND they offered to call the taxi for us. Breakfast was healthy and filling, with nice touches - be it the cranberrry juice, rubarb compote, crisp white tablecloths or overflowing weekend papers. Not only can't we think of any reason to stay in the higher priced city hotels again, we can't think of anything we'd want changed about Simpsons.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Girlsgetaway33
Reviews.Content: A short visit to see the two great Queens in Sydney Harbour was made all the better with our two night stay at Simpsons. It was perfectly located a short walk from the City (and just up the street from where Queen Mary 2 was docked), the family room was great for three adults, breakfast was brilliant and the staff friendly, welcoming. and very helpful. T

Reviews.Title: “Style at Simpsons”
Reviews.Author: Gilliansc
Reviews.Content: Simpson's is an elegant boutique' bed and breakfast hotel in Potts Point, walking distance of the Botanical Gardens, Kings Cross, Opera House etc. Decor is antiques in tastefully decorated rooms, with a sunny breakfast room and large lounge with magazines and books, free internet connection. Staff are particularly friendly and helpful, will find out train times, give advice etc. We had a really lovely stay and would recommend it unreservedly. Well worth paying for!

Reviews.Title: “TLC Downunder”
Reviews.Author: GeriLa
Reviews.Content: Simpsons of Potts Point has all the comfort of an excellent hotel but much more warmth - the personal touch. They are interested in their guests. Breakfast is healthy and great. They went out of their way to be helpful. They passed complimentary tickets for the Opera House tour onto us. Our departure flight was evening, hours after room check-out. There were facilities for us to change and shower before leaving for the airport. If we visit Sydney again, we won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great People, Great Service !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhi-Ali
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and are always amazed by the service and attention to detail that Keith and his team provide - definetely a home from home. The location is fantastic and the rooms are big. (They dont charge for internet access or parking -something that REALLY irratates me in the "big hotels"!!) Potts Point is away from the normal tourist traps of the CBD and only a very short cab ride to Darling Harbour, Circular Keys etc. Hard to fault this place - just a very well run boutique hotel and very reasonably priced for what you get. We will be going back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: roddybenhurst
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a lovely stay at Simpsons of Potts Point in January this year and cannot recommend it enough. Keith, Marie, John and the rest of the team made us very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. They were always on-hand to offer any advice regarding our stay. The hotel has been beautifully renovated and was very homely and had a great character which is more preferable than the impersonal larger hotels that are on offer. The hotel is very well looked after and our room was very clean and comfortable. There was a varied selection of food for breakfast which was served in a lovely, airy dining room. Free use of the internet and the complimentary port while using it were also very much appreciated. The hotel is situated in a great area and the main CBD and main sights are a lovely walk through the Botanical Gardens. I must say that the bus was always welcome at the end of a dayâ€™s sight-seeing ! There is a cluster of good restaurants within walking distance nearby and we did not have one bad meal while we were there. You can also take a short walk to some great restaurants at the Wharf at Woollomooloo. Canâ€™t wait to stay there again next time we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Sydney. K & K

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service !”
Reviews.Author: Limar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to explore the city and surroundings. From the hotel it is a 15 minutes walk to the opera house. Staff gave great recommendations for tours to the hunter valley and the blue mountains. Restaurants can be found really close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and different!”
Reviews.Author: kesharoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked at Simpson's through the internet and found the experience of dealing with Keith, Marie and Jacqueline to be very friendly and welcoming. Simpson's is not a hotel, it is a home away from home. The place has been lovingly maintained and the room spacious and the amenities wonderful. Both Marie and Jacqueline were available during the weekend to assist us in our questions and helped us in planning our day. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely return. KC from Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and homely”
Reviews.Author: cheesemonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year as a result of recommendations on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. It provides a quiet, relaxing, homely environment, with lots of character and is within walking distance (or short cab ride) of the city. The hosts are helpful, friendly and welcoming, and the continental breakfast is adequate. Not particularly cheap and not suited to families though. p.s. I was pleased that Keith had a chance to defend himself against his detractor as we booked by e-mail and found him to be polite, patient and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “As good as all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Flin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the Cloud suite for 5 nights with my fiancee in Jan 07 after spending the previous 14 nights in serviced apartments in Melbourne and Sydney. The change was certainly welcome - Room was very impressive with a large bed, fantastic decor and large jacussi spa in the bathroom. When the jacussi was on it sounded like the bath was going to take off but that all added to the experience. One of the best aspects of the hotel in the communal areas including a big living room with board games, books and free broadband internet access. This room also has a bathroom with shower which makes it ideal if you have a late flight out like we did. Keith the owner was also very helpful with suggestions and tips. Only slight downside was the breakfast - I thought they could do a little more here. Overall highly recommended for something different to mainstream hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience!”
Reviews.Author: pinkyd
Reviews.Content: We always look at Trip Advisor when choosing our hotels. Having seen the reviews already posted we had high expectations of this hotel and were not disappointed in any way whatsoever. It was important to us that the hotel met our expectations as it was the start of a very special 3 wk holiday in Australia and we have booked to stay with them for 4 nights. We arrived very early in the morning after a long flight from Hong Kong and were given a very personal welcome by John, the Hotel Manager. As it was so early, our room was not available, but we were given facilities to shower, change and leave our luggage until later in the day. Turning to the accommodation, we usually look to stay in 4*+ large hotels, and had chosen a boutique hotel for the first time. We booked the Cloud Suite as we were travelling with our 15 yr old daughter and needed the extra space. We felt that the Cloud Suite was very reasonably priced and it also included sparkliing wine and chocolates which was appreciated by my wife! The room itself was large, beautifully decorated in an individual style, and also comprised a huge bathroom with a large circular jacuzzi bath and walk-in shower. The room was fresh, immaculately clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Having peeked in and seen other rooms in the hotel whilst they were being cleaned, it is apparent that all the rooms are decorated individually and are of a very high standard throughout. We loved the whole feel of the hotel and our daughter appreciated the free internet access in the downstairs drawing room! We were treated as if we were personal guests in a English Country House and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was served in a gloriously light room with glass ceilings which allowed the sun to stream through. Both Keith and Marie were on hand at this time in the day to provide advice and ideas when planning the day's itinerary. With respect to the location, do not be concerned that this hotel is not in the city centre. We felt it was better that it is not , because you have the benefit of a delightful 20 min walk to central locations through the Botanical Gardens including great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (the Opera House can be seen from the end of the road that Simpsons is in). In the evenings it is a quick taxi ride back (10 AUD) to the hotel from most central points. A lovely stay, a great start to our holiday and we will always stay at Simpsons Hotel when we return to Australia in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: Simpsons of Potts Point Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Challis Ave | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
